The area consists of five practices: Data Governance and Data Management, Data Visualization, Data Science and AI, Data Engineering and Data Migrations, and Spatial Intelligence. Each with a distinct focus on content and the right solution. Over 170 professionals work in a content practice that is a logical fit for them. We believe in the power of multidisciplinary teams. Your expertise, personal ambitions and customer requirements are the basis for the composition of our High Performance Teams. You’ll become an indispensable link in a team of professionals so together you can all bring out the best in each other. Everyone contributes from their own expertise and technology so we all keep learning from each other and no one is ever alone. This is you Master's degree or the equivalent in experience in a Data Science field as a Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps, or Software Engineer Experience in some of the following Data Science techniques: supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms deep learning anomaly detection recommender systems natural language processing computer vision and reinforcement learning autoencoders, transformers, forecasting Experience in one of the following languages: Python R Experience in bringing Data Science solutions/software to production (Azure, AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, Docker, etc.) Experience in building and implementing advanced analytics solutions and you can provide some reference cases In-depth knowledge of open-source software and libraries in Python and/or R for machine and deep learning Experience in big data and platforms such as Azure Machine Learning Services and Amazon SageMaker is an advantage Good command of the Dutch language Benefits Part of our Data community with passionate and experienced peers; focus on working with one of our High Performance Teams (HPT) at renowned clients; you work in a high-tech environment with a focus on knowledge and innovation, an open no-nonsense corporate culture with room for own initiative; working with less travel time; remote & flexible; an environment where entrepreneurship and own initiative are encouraged; a culture where collegiality, knowledge sharing and collaboration are key; a pension plan, to which you are not required to contribute; 20 statutory days off and 7 additional days off via flex benefits; adapt your terms of employment to your personal wishes with flex benefits choice between a company car or a mobility scheme; Everyone is welcome to apply. Because we believe in the power of diversity and value inclusion. After all, the best ideas and smartest solutions arise in diverse teams. That is exactly why we pay so much attention to the composition of our high performance teams. So that you feel at home and can get the best out of yourself.

title: Freelancing At Dept®
description: We like to have a flexible shell of freelance professionals around our core of Depsters. Simply because we sometimes need specialists. Will you help us out? As a freelance professional at DEPT® you have all the advantages of a large family, with the freedom to go wherever you want. You can fully participate in projects with our customers, or join a team of your DEPT® colleagues. And: you really become part of the DEPT® family. The doors of our offices are always wide open for you. At DEPT® we work with the coolest brands from all over the world. Our task: to make their lives – and that of our customers – better and more fun. That is why we consider a good relationship with our customers to be of vital importance. As a result, they like to come to our parties, and more importantly, we can inspire and challenge them to become even better. Curious about what we do? Check our cases! A few years ago we started our 'DEPT® Freelance Community'. A group of selected digital professionals with whom we would like to work, or want to work with. By leaving your details at the bottom, you sign up for this community and we will contact you when a new opportunity presents itself. So would you like to work with us and are you a: – Software Engineer, Frontend, Backend, Full-stack, Architect – Designer Visual, Interaction, UX, Service design – Data Engineer Analytics, Predictive Modeling, Visualization – Product Manager Product Owner, Scrum Master, Business Manager – Content Creator Copy, Video, Campaign – Creative Content, Art Director – Project Manager – …? Then sign up here! Send your CV and Portfolio, or your own code via a link. Who knows 'till soon!

title: Data Engineer
description: We love to see people grow. We empower our product teams, farmers, dealers & suppliers to move forward. Driving the digital future of Kramp Group by discovering and building great products, making life easy for our customers. Kramp Group discovers and builds e-commerce, supply chain & data science solutions that are aimed at giving the ag-tech industry a push forward. We’re building a digital platform, serving thousands of customers, and generating a turnover of over one billion euros per year. Our Data vision is to provide a centralized entry point for data to be used on self-service platforms that unlock the full potential of Data for Kramp Group, ensuring data accessibility, quality, and value generation across all departments in a unified way. The mission of a Data Engineer role is to accelerate the rollout of our Cloud Data Warehouse and make an impact on how data and technology are used to provide next-generation tools to an organization. You will be part of Data Office which is an international cross-functional team, combining: Data Governance; BI Development; Software Development; Data Science. The team is in the transformation from an on-premise data warehouse to a Google Cloud Platform-based data warehouse (DWH). This DWH builds the foundation of Kramp's self-service analytics platform feeding different targets as: Data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau); Data-driven e-commerce applications; Kramp's Machine Learning platform. What we offer: The Data Office is international, and cross-functional team, combining Business Intelligence, Pricing Management, Data Science, and Software Development; Working within Agile SCRUM Methodologies and the Atlassian toolchain (JIRA, Confluence, Bitbucket, Git); To build our state-of-the-art cloud data warehouse, we use Python, Java, BigQuery SQL, other Google Cloud Platform services such as Cloud Build, Data transfers, Workflows, Schedulers and Functions; Making use of Dataform, Terraform & CDKTF and Data Modelling Tools; You will get deep insights into the work at an international wholesaler being in the middle of the digital transformation, you can contribute and make a real impact; And a lot of freedom to initiate new ideas and develop these further. Some facts about us: We follow the philosophy of "You build it, you own it, you love it." We believe in empowering individuals to take control of their own growth, with guidance provided. Our colleagues come from 66 different countries, creating an inclusive and open-minded environment. Transparent environment, mature management team with clear vision and specific goals, and open to feedback. Kramp Group is a healthy and financially stable company. What else we bring to the table: 25 vacation days and 12 ATV days (based on a full time contract). Flexible working policy in hours and location (with offices in Utrecht and Varsseveld). Travel and working from home allowance. Profit sharing bonus. Learning budget for training and courses to support your growth ambitions. Generous pension plan. Who you are: What will help you be successful in this role? Openness to engage in continuous learning and agility in addressing business challenges; Experience in designing, developing, documenting, and maintaining software written in Python and/or Java as well as dataflows written in SQL; Knowledge of different Data Modelling principles and selecting the right one depending on the needs of a consumer; Feeling comfortable working with Linux, git, and Docker to extend and maintain our CI/CD workflows and pipelines or are you eager to dive into this topic; Experience in working in cloud environments (preferably GCP or AWS); Experience or knowledge of Infrastructure-as-Code applications like Terraform and data transformation tools as dbt and Dataform; Cultural awareness, sensitivity, and adaptability in building connections with people from diverse backgrounds; Excel conceptual thinking and a proactive approach to decision-making, taking ownership to ensure project success. Who Kramp is Thanks to our ambitions we are active throughout Europe: a leading position in the agricultural market for parts. We heavily invest in E-Business and supply chain innovations. Our aim is to make it easy for our customers to run their business. Working at Kramp means working with over 3500 international colleagues. The people at Kramp are enthusiastic, professional and involved. We speak our customers’ language, understand their challenges and earn their trust to exceed their expectations. Our promise “It’s that easy” is embedded in our culture and DNA. Working at Kramp means: … you belong here! Being part of our open business community … your work makes a difference! Have an impact on what matters … you will develop and realize! Learn and realize your potential More about Kramp: https://www.careeratkramp.com/nl-nl Do you see yourself in this role but don't hit every requirement? That's okay! Apply anyway. This is a great chance for you to grow and learn. Don't hesitate to reach out to Julia Bodun julia@kramphub.com if you have any questions. N.B. External recruiters/agencies we'd appreciate it if you'd let us reach out to you if we need help. At the moment, this is not the case :) Utrecht (NL) Varsseveld (NL)

title: Business Analyst
description: Reference Code: 97413 Business Analyst Amsterdam, NH, NL Fixed Term The story of Cartier is founded on audacity and passion. For more than 170 years we have embraced a bold, pioneering spirit that continues to inspire our teams across all Métiers from our boutiques to our workshops and corporate offices. Our 9000+ colleagues of 105 nationalities are united by a shared independent spirit and commitment to excellence, striving to continuously enrich our Maison’s heritage by pushing the boundaries of creativity. Business Analyst – Cartier Benelux & Nordics (7 month FTC, full time) Want to join Cartier Benelux & Nordics team to actively contribute to data management and business analysis to support our Commercial initiatives? Join us as our Business Analyst. HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT? As Business Analyst, reporting to the Commercial Operations & Performance Manager, you are mainly responsible for supporting the Commercial Management & Local Executive committee with data-driven insights & recommendations. Below the main responsibilities: Collect, clean, organize data from various sources, and contribute to the continuous improvement of network performance dashboard elaboration. In particular, design and create dashboards and visual reports to present findings in a clear and understandable manner, for Commercial management to constantly spot business opportunities. Proactively collaborate with Business teams, but as well Client, Marketing and Finance teams, and acquire necessary data to enrich analysis combined with market insight and business result for decision making. Support Commercial management in the sales forecast and ensure accurate upload of the Budget on a quarterly basis. HOW WILL YOUR EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US? You have a keen eye for detail and ability to understand where and how to look for errors in large datasets. You possess strong data visualization skills: ability to analyze data for strategic insights and develop materials that showcase data that summarizes performance for Leadership. You possess a problem-solving mindset, and you are comfortable in a fast-paced changing environment, always driving for excellence You have a “team player” spirit, and the ability to work well within a group / team dynamic. Advanced skills in MS office tools, Excel, PowerPoint. Ability to use POWER BI reports, Google Looker & ANAPLAN sales planning is a plus. HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING? A great opportunity to be a part of a dynamic and diverse team that goes the extra mile. We value our people, and you will be provided with an complete on-boarding and continued training throughout your career to grow with Cartier. This role will also help deepen your knowledge of luxury and its business. YOUR JOURNEY WITH US: If your application is successful, you will receive an introductory call from a member of our Talent Acquisition team to discuss the opportunity. If you are successful through the interview, you will be invited to attend an interview with our Commercial Performance & Operation Manager to assess your fit for the role and who will share insights on our team dynamics and the overall vision. Finally, you will meet the HR Business Partner to ask any questions and have the final feedback.

title: Data Analyst
description: As a Web Data Analyst you are responsible for analyzing our website’s overall performance. By closely monitoring our KPIs, and working together with our digital development-, commercial-, SEA- and SEO teams, you will strive every day to improve the quantity and quality of our traffic and conversion rate, while decreasing our bounce and exit rates. You will work with a team of analysts on digital forecasting, querying, automation, dashboarding and reporting. You have a crucial role in making the different teams work aligned and synchronized. Does this sound interesting? Then we might be looking for you to join our team! Tasks And Activities Tracking and forecasting of wide variety of KPIs (special focus on traffic and conversion rate); Digital forecasting and automation of data flows; In charge of automating reports through the use and creation of dashboards; Weekly and monthly reporting of performance; data visualization and data storytelling; Build action plans based on analysis, assess other teams on implementation. Track performance once implementation is done; Providing input to management about the online performance; Supporting the online growth by providing new insights and actively sharing these with internal and external stakeholders; Be part of the AB testing process, providing valuable insights and hypothesis to test but specially defining the correct metrics and analyzing test results; Your Profile Ideally 3-5 years of working experience as a web data analyst (experience with CRO considered a big plus); HBO/WO Degree in the field of Economics, Business Administration, Statistics, Mathematics or equivalent; Experience with SQL is a must (BigQuery is a plus); Knowledge of Google Analytics including custom reporting, complex segmentation, marketing tools connections and their use; Knowledge of dashboarding (PowerBI, Looker Studio, Tableau, etc); Knowledge of Google Tag Manager; Knowledge of Python is a plus; Customer focus and data driven; Pro activeness, ownership, willingness to learn; Stakeholder management and strong communication skills; Prioritization and time management skills; Critical thinker and problem-solving skills; Flexible, ability to adapt and work autonomously; Our Offer A - without exaggerating - fantastic workplace on the 40th floor in 'De Rotterdam' with a view of the Erasmus Bridge; Good working conditions and development and opportunities for growth; Renumerations will be based on experience, skills and competences; Freedom and responsibility to shape your own role and to bring ideas to fruition in an environment where anything is possible; The opportunity to achieve the best results as a team, simply because you are a winner; In addition to a great place to work, we also offer 30 holidays, an attractive employee discount, group health insurance, company fitness and discounts on various insurance products; At MediaMarkt we simply have guts. We are entrepreneurs within a company, giving you the chance to develop yourself quickly and in a variety of ways; This is Us We are the market leader in consumer electronics in the Netherlands. As a team we work together to remain the omnichannel player with 49 branches and an online shop. How do we do that? By putting our customers first. Always. By offering the best customer experience both online and offline. We build a party for and with our customers. We believe that anything is possible if you take action yourself. Working at MediaMarkt means: having fun and wanting to win!

title: Data Analyst
description: Powering our sustainable future, together We live in an era where electric mobility is "the new normal." Whereas over the past decade, electric vehicles were only for the few, today they are for everyone. Welcome to the electric era. Enter EVBox. Founded in 2010, EVBox empowers forward-thinking businesses to build a sustainable future by providing flexible and scalable electric vehicle charging solutions. With its offering of residential, commercial, and fast charging stations, as well as scalable charging management software, EVBox ensures that electric mobility is accessible to everyone. We believe in a future where daily transportation is emission-free and sustained by smart charging infrastructure. That's why we've made it our goal to accelerate the adoption of electric mobility by bringing the most accessible and scalable charging solutions to the world. However, the transition from gas to electric cars will change a great deal of what we know about transportation. The growth and success of EVBox is driven by the passion and dedication of everyone in the company. Today, EVBox has grown into an international team across multiple offices in Europe and the United States, with hundreds of driven professionals from different wals of life working for us. About Us: At the Everon Platform Organization within EVBox, we empower forward-thinking businesses to build a sustainable future by providing top-notch EV Charging management solutions. Our engineers build new products, enhance existing solutions and resolve many interesting challenges on a daily basis. This work is delivered in a culture that emphasizes ownership and excellence. Everyone is empowered to make bold decisions and take responsibility for the solutions they build. About the Role: As a Data Analyst, you will join our Data team to expand the data capabilities of the Everon platform. We leverage the vast amounts of data from our global network of customers and charging stations to build high-quality data sets, generate valuable insights, and create innovative data products. We build and run data services and pipelines that validate and enrich incoming data, and provide convenient and secure access to teams across the organization. Our aim is to empower our customers and deliver a delightful user experience by responsibly leveraging data, learning from insights, growing our knowledge, and paving the way towards a sustainable future. In this role you will: Analyze transactional and operational data, leveraging data analysis and models to unlock actionable insights, identify business improvement opportunities, and provide recommendations to enhance performance and efficiency Design, execute, and interpret experiments to validate hypotheses, drawing detailed and impactful conclusions to drive innovation and optimize delivery processes Collaborate closely with various teams, aligning on data strategy and KPIs. Engage with stakeholders to collect requirements, deliver insights, and ensure clear communication of findings, recommendations, and progress Provide and support tools and data visualizations to stakeholders to empower their data-based decision-making process Develop data-driven business insights to find opportunities and recommend the prioritization of product, growth, and optimization initiatives Being able to define and design business value from raw data and implement data models with an abstraction level close to the business domains Enhance the data landscape by collaborating with peers to ensure data logging and data pipelines' availability, integrity, accuracy, and reliability About you: You hold a Bachelor's degree or higher in Math, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or other related quantitative fields 4+ years of experience in roles such as Product Analyst, Data Analyst, or in other data analysis-focused functions Advanced SQL expertise and strong Python proficiency for data analysis and modelling. Experience working with dbt is a plus Experienced with dashboarding/data visualization platforms such as Grafana, Tableau, Looker, or similar Ability to deliver on tight deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks while maintaining quality and detail Proven track record of handling large datasets, extracting insights, and summarizing key learnings and takeaways Proven aptitude toward Data Storytelling and Root Cause Analysis using data At EVBox, we believe that when people feel valued and rewarded their potential is unlimited. We offer competitive salaries and review remuneration packages regularly to ensure that our pay always positively reflects performance. We promote within, offering learning and development opportunities, and we also provide the following benefits, as standard: A very diverse workforce and an open culture Private pension contribution 25 vacation days Holiday Swap (2 days) - ability to swap out a public holiday for a paid vacation day Commuting allowance Up to 3 days remote working, including working from home allowance of EUR 2 net per day (in consultation with your manager) Budget of 600 Euro to set up your home office Ability to work remotely from anywhere outside of the Netherlands for 4 weeks Access to learning platforms and personal development budget Across our 8 locations, more than 700 EVBoxers work together to provide electric vehicle charging solutions that help businesses move forward. Are you ready to join them? Hit apply. We at EVBox aim to take down historical and structural barriers that stand in the way of our employees. The chargers we manufacture are built for the sustainable future we believe in. We commit to sustained action in tackling processes and practices that systematically penalize our employees. Our DEI efforts are designed not just for the present, but create long-lasting change in the future of our industry. We continue to learn and dismantle the roadblocks that our people face in order to create positive outcomes for all. We believe in an equitable, diverse and inclusive environment where everyone, no matter their gender, race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sexual orientation, identity, religious belief, education or ability, feel valued and respected. We embrace diverse life experiences and heritages and ensure that all voices are valued and heard. Do you want to get to know us even better? Then pay a visit to our Career page, blog or check out our social media channels: LinkedIn, YouTube, Instagram, Facebook or Twitter. EVBox will retain your personal data collected through the application process for 1 year after the position is filled in case of rejection. You can request your data to be deleted at any time. Please read about how EVBox processes your personal data here. EVBox will retain your personal data collected through the application process for 1 year after the position is filled in case of rejection. You can request your data to be deleted at any time. Please read here how EVBox processes your personal data.

title: Analytics Intern
description: What to Expect Location: Amsterdam Duration: 5-6 months Start date: January / February 2024 Postion: Fulltime (40hours) Please Note: Candidates must be enrolled in education for the full duration of this internship The Business Analytics Intern will support the development of tools, analyses and planning for Tesla’s Environmental Health, Safety and Security (EHS&S) Org. The intern will have an unique opportunity to improve how Tesla uses data in an EHS&S context. This will include creating collecting and analyzing data, developing dashboards and managing EHS&S databases. Although this role has a strong technical component, the intern will also gain experience in taking a “consultative” approach to their work as they will be involved in scoping and building out projects from start to finish. Data is deeply embedded in the culture at Tesla. We rely on data – lots of it – to improve our products, to optimize results, and to proactively detect opportunities for advancement. As a EHS&S Business Analytics Intern, you will be part of the team that solves issues that affect Tesla’s impact on the Environment and employee Health, Safety and Security by using data and reporting metrics to identify potential problems in the field, investigate discrepancies, and initiate repair actions when needed. An ideal candidate is knowledgeable at data analytics, data visualization, reporting, and data processing concepts and is naturally motivated to seek out and fix problems in a methodical way. What You’ll Do Use data and visualization to communicate complex problems to internal and external stakeholders; as well as to support decision-making processes Support the creation and management of global performance metrics to determine the program’s success at mitigating known risk factors Identify and support opportunities to collect and store data in structured databases for analysis Extract and clean datasets for use in global performance metrics Prepare reports to be presented to leadership, stakeholders, etc Support EHS&S processes from a data perspective What You’ll Bring Currently enrolled preferably in a relevant field such as Business and IT, Computer Science or an equivalent technical field. Students in EHS&S related fields may also be considered if they have a strong technical background Ability to leverage technology to solve complex problems Level C1 English (spoken and written) Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills Good written and oral presentation skills Willing to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines Advanced knowledge and experience with MS Excel including modelling, statistical analysis etc Familiair with PowerBI and/or Tableau Good knowledge of with Microsoft PowerApps, Power Automate and other Microsoft products highly desirable Familiar with SQL, Python and/or other database applications

title: Data Scientist
description: Job Description: Mars Veterinary Health (MVH) is part of Mars Petcare, a global, family-owned business. At Mars Veterinary Health, our 70,000+ Associates are dedicated to creating A BETTER WORLD FOR PETS™. Mars Veterinary Health is a leading veterinary health provider with an international network of over 2,500 pet hospitals including BANFIELD™, BLUEPEARL™, VCA™, Linnaeus, AniCura, VSH, VES, Mount Pleasant and others across 20+ countries. We are committed to offering compassionate high-quality veterinary care, from wellness and prevention, through primary, emergency and specialty care. To learn more, visit our website or follow us on LinkedIn. AniCura is Europe’s leading provider of high-quality veterinary care for companion animals. AniCura offers a wide range of high-quality medical services covering preventive and basic health care as well as advanced diagnostics, internal medicine, intensive care, surgery, and orthopedics. Since 2018, AniCura is part of MARS Veterinary Health, a division of MARS Inc. Job Purpose/Overview At Mars Veterinary Health International, we are on a mission to redefine the future of veterinary care by leveraging data in unprecedented ways. We are seeking a dynamic, forward-thinking Data Analyst/Data Scientist (DA/DS) to join our vibrant team in AniCura. You will be at the forefront of all things data related, working with a team that is not just analyzing data but revolutionizing the way we operate and eventually change the lives of pets for the better. If you are passionate about data and eager to drive change, we want you on our team! The DA/DS will work to advance the data & analytics capabilities of MVHI and will be part of the D&A team at AniCura. This role will report into the Head of Data & Analytics, AniCura. This role is based in AniCura headquarters in Amsterdam, Netherlands. Key Responsibilities Unlock Insights and Drive Innovation: Utilize your analytical prowess to dissect complex data sets and unveil insights that will propel our business forward. Collaborate and Influence: Work closely with cross-functional teams to develop data-driven strategies that will add value. Visual Storytelling: Develop compelling data visualizations and dashboards that narrate the story behind the numbers, influencing key stakeholder decisions. Champion Data Quality: Be the guardian of data quality, ensuring accuracy and consistency, while identifying opportunities for process improvements. Continuous Learning: Stay abreast of the latest trends and technologies in data analytics/data science, bringing fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to our team. Job Specifications/Qualifications 2-4 years of experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence, or consulting B.Sc. or M.Sc. degree in data analytics, statistics, economics, computer science or a similar field Experience with large and complex datasets Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a knack for translating data into actionable insights Intermediate/advanced proficiency in Power BI/Query, Python and Excel Proficiency in data analysis and querying data through Python and SQL, data modelling and machine learning Fluent verbal and written communication skills in English Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information in a clear and concise manner Experience working with applications like Azure Suite, Power Automate, Databricks, Alteryx, PySpark as well as a good knowledge of ETL, dataflows of data warehouses would be a plus (but no requirement) What can you expect from AniCura? Work with over 12.000 like-minded and talented Associates at AniCura and over 130.000 at Mars, all guided by The Five Principles Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to shape the future of veterinary care, together An industry competitive salary and benefits package Flexible working hours, an international and digital work environment The opportunity to cuddle our beloved 4-legged friends in our offices About AniCura AniCura is present at 500 European locations in 15 countries and creates peace of mind for pet owners through excellent access and patient safety. Every year, AniCura’s 12,000 employees attend to more than 3.6 million companion animal patients. AniCura is a trusted training and referral body. Since 2018, AniCura is part of Mars Veterinary Health, a family-owned company with the sole objective of advancing the veterinary profession for the health and wellbeing of people, pets, and planet. Through our collective network of 2,500 veterinary clinics, hospitals, and diagnostic labs across 21 countries, we can provide the highest standards in pet care and achieve our collective Purpose: A better world for pets through Shaping the Future of Veterinary Care, together. Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

title: Data Analyst
description: Introductie Voor een interessante opdracht bij onze eindklant in Noord-Brabant zijn wij op zoek naar een Freelance Data Analist . Location: Den Bosch Startdate: ASAP Duration: 12 months with option to extent (40 hrs. /week) Extra: – 4 days remote, 1 day in the office is possible – CV’s and motivation written in English Organisatie The Technology department is responsible for the digital strategy, innovation and digital transformation as well as developing analytics solutions for our products and services. Developing state of the art analytical solutions powered by a modern and scalable architecture is seen as a key differentiator for the future. With analytics we strive to improve efficiency while improving outcomes and support fact based decisioning within the organization. The Analytics team’s mission is to mine and exploit latent value from our data; this improves our products, optimizes our customer approach and makes processes more efficient and intelligent. During projects you will be developing technical solution yourself and/or managing development teams. You will be working along-side other experts, such as Data Scientists, Architects, Data Engineer, etc. to realize Cloud solutions that help shape the future of our global enterprise. Functie As a data analyst your job is to work with BI tools to create actionable insights on data and to support analysts in local companies with training and expertise. The data analyst reports to the manager learning Analytics of the technology department. The current team exists of 4 team members. Your job: Translate business problems into dashboard designs Develop data structures as basis for dashboards in close collaboration with data engineers Design and develop dashboards Analyzing issues from our products and advising on possible strategic solutions Being aware of the latest developments when it comes to visualization standards Analyze the data and business performance Process data in the Big Data environment Maintain PowerBI premium capacity and workspaces Functie-eisen Bachelor or Masters degree in Computer Science or Business Information Management At least three years of experience in a business intelligence In-depth understanding of data structures Experience with programming language, eg. Python and SQL • In-depth experience with PowerBI • Results and customer focused with pragmatic and hands-on attitude. Experience in working in an international environment Strong written, verbal and presentation skills. Mastering the English language. Inlichtingen Michel Koning 06 – 34657362

title: Data Analyst
description: About Apeiron Insight Apeiron Insight is a data-driven research & analytics company, providing data products and insights to investment companies. We use predictive modelling to deliver actionable intelligence to the biggest sharks in the tank. Apeiron Insight is growing fast. We are hiring for several roles in multiple disciplines to scale up our operation. Your role with us As a Data Analyst you are responsible for analyzing Apeiron’s various data streams. You will help the Data Engineering team to spot anomalies in the data processing & provide the Business team with data analyses and actionable insights. You collect and combine data sets from various sources and build and maintain dashboards and reports to provide insights into the processes in our warehouse. Main responsibilities will include: Collecting, analyzing and interpreting large amounts of data. Identifying patterns, trends and deviations in the data and translating them into understandable reports and actionable insights. Maintaining existing data processes and engineering new (automation) solutions to achieve better and faster reporting and analysis of our various datasets. Collaborating with the Engineering team to optimize data collection and analysis processes. Presenting findings and recommendations to internal stakeholders in a clear and concise manner and become the intermediary between the business needs and data solutions. What are we looking for? Bachelor’s or master’s degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science or a related field. Demonstrable experience in analyzing large datasets and using statistical analysis methods. Extensive knowledge of programming languages such as Python and SQL. Experience with data visualization and the use of tools such as Excel (including writing macros) and Power BI and data analysis libraries, such as Matplotlib, Pandas, NumPy and SciPy. You are a self-starter who works well in a fast-paced environment. You are currently living in the Netherlands and are able to fluently communicate in English (verbally and in writing). Command of the Dutch language is a plus. You are legally allowed to work in the Netherlands. You are able to come to our lovely office in Rijswijk twice a week, or more. What we offer? This is your chance to join a dynamic data company where you’ll be part of a very ambitious and smart team on a mission. You’ll get all the benefits of working for an agile scale-up such as a relaxed work environment, the possibility to work from home part of the time, easy-going colleagues and freedom in your work. Additionally, we offer you: Competitive salary tailored to your skills & experience. 25 vacation days based on a 40 hour working week. 8% holiday payment. Profit Sharing Bonus scheme. Pension & Mobility Allowance. An annual budget of €3.000 to spend on professional or personal development. Hybrid work model: a mix of working from home and in the office. Healthy and delicious buffet breakfast, lunch and a filled refrigerator in the office. Everything you need to work from home: a screen, keyboard and mouse. Fun events with colleagues. A referral reward program: refer a friend for one of our jobs. If you think this position fits you well, we sincerely hope to hear from you. If so, please submit your resume and motivation letter.

title: Data Analyst
description: Your Impact You bridge the gap between business, information and technology as a one of Ordina’s Data Analysts. Like a true subject matter expert, you hold discussions with stakeholders such as administrators, users and architects. You identify their needs and translate them into information solutions. You also draw up validated requirements and specifications with the right quality and depth and prioritize these with the business. You’re the point of contact for the organization and for the scrum teams when it comes to content. And you’re able to clearly convey what needs to be realized like no other. Where you're going to get started We create sustainable value for our clients through data within our Data area. We help companies stay agile while in transition by making data and technology part of both daily operations and strategic decision-making. We use data to help our clients stay ahead of change. Our ambition is to help organizations excel with data. The area consists of five practices: Data Governance and Data Management, Data Visualization, Data Science and AI, Data Engineering and Data Migrations, and Spatial Intelligence. Each with a distinct focus on content and the right solution. Over 170 professionals work in a content practice that is a logical fit for them. We believe in the power of multidisciplinary teams. Your expertise, personal ambitions and customer requirements are the basis for the composition of our High Performance Teams. You’ll become an indispensable link in a team of professionals so together you can all bring out the best in each other. Everyone contributes from their own expertise and technology so we all keep learning from each other and no one is ever alone. This is you You have a passion for your work and a focus on customer satisfaction and quality. Guts, proactive communication skills and a strong analytical approach are essential for your role as a Data Analyst. Required Expertise: Bachelor’s or master’s degree Two years’ experience in data analysis and data design Affinity with data, data structures and data mapping Knowledge and experience with data modeling and relational algebra Accurate and precise work ethic Analytical thinking skills, strong communication skills and a practical attitude Experience with SQL is a definite advantage Command of the Dutch language Benefits Part of our Data community with passionate and experienced peers; focus on working with one of our High Performance Teams (HPT) at renowned clients; you work in a high-tech environment with a focus on knowledge and innovation, an open no-nonsense corporate culture with room for own initiative; working with less travel time; remote & flexible; an environment where entrepreneurship and own initiative are encouraged; a culture where collegiality, knowledge sharing and collaboration are key; a pension plan, to which you are not required to contribute; 20 statutory days off and 7 additional days off via flex benefits; adapt your terms of employment to your personal wishes with flex benefits choice between a company car or a mobility scheme; Everyone is welcome to apply. Because we believe in the power of diversity and value inclusion. After all, the best ideas and smartest solutions arise in diverse teams. That is exactly why we pay so much attention to the composition of our high performance teams. So that you feel at home and can get the best out of yourself.

title: Intern
description: What to Expect Starting date: January/February 2024 Location: Tilburg Lenght: 6 months Period: Fulltime (40hours a week) NOTE: YOU MUST BE ENROLLED IN HIGHER EDUCATION DURING THE ENTIRE INTERNSHIP TO BE CONSIDERED. As an intern within Global Trade and New Markets department in EMEA, you will be supporting with the daily activities and inquiries related to the Trade billing process, with the focus being on optimizing and automating the process going forward to ensure a smooth, timely and complaint payments to Trade vendors. You will also be involved in a variety of ongoing customs projects and activities including, but not limited to, creating and improving visibility of all customs activities with related costs broken down by commodity group and, by selected countries/regions with attention to constantly changing business priorities. What You’ll Do Being part of a global team operating in a constantly changing, international and fast-paced environment Data collection and visualization for strategic decision-making Interacting with dynamic teams at different levels of expertise across the company Interacting with government officials across the region Working with both internal and external strategic partners What You’ll Bring Currently enrolled in a Supply Chain management or International Trade Business relevant field Project management skills, self-starting capabilities, creative thinking Good Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills Data visualization. Experience with BI building is a plus Affinity with import/export/logistics Level C1 in English (written and spoken), other languages are a plus

title: Data Engineer
description: Optiver are looking for a skilled Data Visualization Engineer to design, develop and implement solutions for our trading teams in Amsterdam and globally. The successful Engineer will bring a strong technical capability as well as an approach that will enable them to integrate with our high-paced trading teams, collaborate with trading stakeholders to formulate requirements and create innovative visualizations and tooling on the trading floor. WHO WE ARE: Our Amsterdam office is where it all began. Over 35 years ago, Optiver's business started with a single trader on the floor of Amsterdam's European Stock Exchange. Since our 1986 founding, Optiver's Amsterdam office has grown into one of the most dynamic and exciting trading floors in Europe. Our culture reflects the Dutch capital city's progressive, innovative and inclusive nature. With its unique spirit, Amsterdam is the ideal hub for our teams to trade a wide range of products from listed derivatives to cash equities, ETFs, bonds and foreign exchange. WHAT YOU'LL DO: You will work on creating and maintaining data visualizations and UI applications that are used by traders to form trading decisions and to interact with other Optiver systems. The goal of the team is to provide users with highly responsive, flexible and reliable tools that can be used to monitor the state of global financial markets and to control our internal strategies. The impact of the work you will do spans across multiple different teams and levels of the organization. Apart from creating user interfaces and their backends, the UX team also owns and develops internal frameworks and standards describing how to create user interfaces within the company. As a Data Visualization Engineer you can expect to: Create web based data visualizations Work closely with traders, developers and other stakeholders to discover requirements and design solutions Design and build data processing pipelines used during data pre-processing stages Contribute to the UI framework and ecosystem used across multiple teams within the company Be involved in a very short feedback loop and see your products having actual impact on daily work of their users Work on data and UI optimization problems Help members of other teams create and optimize data visualizations WHO YOU ARE: Trading applications need to be reliable and robust, therefore we look for developers with a strong engineering mindset that can work in a highly dynamic environment while creating simple and solid solutions. Those solutions must integrate well with the broad ecosystem of Optiver data sources and backend services. In terms of skills and qualifications we're looking for: A degree in computer science or a related field Strong knowledge of Python Experience with creating data visualizations and user interfaces Experience with creating web applications and working with distributed systems Familiarity with one or more of the following technologies: Plotly Dash, Bokeh, React.js, SQL, C++, JavaScript, HTML/CSS Strong communication skills Problem solving mindset Eagerness to learn(including financial and trading knowledge) Proactiveness WHAT YOU'LL GET: The chance to start your career working alongside best-in-class professionals from over 40 different countries. Alongside this you will get great secondary benefits such as 25 paid vacation days, fully paid first-class commuting expenses, training opportunities, discounts on health insurance, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, Friday afternoon drinks and even weekly in-house chair massages. Being highly international, we are accustomed to guiding expats through their relocation, offering competitive relocation packages and providing visa sponsorship where necessary. HOW TO APPLY: If you're interested in taking your career to one of the most exciting trading floors in Europe, please apply via the form below. While we love how bilingual our teams are, be sure to write your CV and motivation letter in English. We're eager to learn all about your background and interests, which means applications lacking a motivation letter sadly will not be reviewed. But if we think you could be a good fit, you'll hear from us sooner than you might expect! More information on how Optiver Europe processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy. In the event of questions, feel free to contact our Recruitment team at recruitment@optiver.com. Kindly note that we do not require any assistance from third-parties including agencies in the recruitment of this role. DIVERSITY STATEMENT: As an intentionally flat organisation, we believe that great ideas and impact can come from everyone. We are passionate about empowering individuals and creating diverse teams that thrive. Every person at Optiver should feel included, valued and respected, because we believe our best work is done together. Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is hardwired through every stage of our hiring process. We encourage applications from candidates from any and all backgrounds, and we welcome requests for reasonable adjustments during the process to ensure that you can best demonstrate your abilities.

title: Head of Data
description: About ZEEKR We are ZEEKR, built on a decade of European experience. We are a premium electric vehicle and technology solutions brand from Geely Holding Group, one of world’s largest privately held automotive companies. Our goal and vision is to accelerate the shift to fully electrified mobility. We are committed to driving the future of transportation with cutting-edge technology and a customer-centric approach. Our cars have finally arrived in Europe with the ZEEKR 001 and the new ZEEKR X, and with several markets on our expansion roadmap, there has never been a better time to join the team. The role We are hiring a Head of Data and Business Intelligence to lead the ZEEKR EU Data and Business Intelligence strategy. In the role, you will be the cornerstone of our organization's data-driven decision-making process. Your responsibility will extend beyond managing big data; you will be expected to have first-hand experience working with large datasets, employing both custom-built tools and established platforms like Power BI. Your insights will assist us with efficiency, innovation, and strategic opportunities across the company. As a steward of data, you will empower every department with the information needed to excel in their objectives, ensuring that data is not just a resource but a core pillar of our operational strategy. This is what you will do: Define and own the data and business intelligence strategy for ZEEKR EU across all business functions – marketing, product, HR, legal, finance etc. You and your team will advise and shape the data environment our internal and external customers need to get the most out of their data. Through workshops, presentations, and ongoing education, you will ensure that all levels of the organization understand and harness the potential of BI tools and data analytics. Lead implementation of data governance within the business, onboard and train data owners and data stewards. Focus on compliance and quality initiatives across the ZEEKR EU business groups. Ensure all data framework is in line with EU data privacy legislation. To be successful in the role you should demonstrate the following: Big Data Expertise: Hands-on experience with large data sets and custom-built data tools, with at least 10 years in a data-centric role. Power BI Proficiency: Strong proficiency in employing Power BI for data analysis and visualization, with a minimum of 5 years of practical use. Data Infrastructure Development: Ability to architect and manage scalable data infrastructure, with at least 8 years in data architecture. Analytical Problem-Solving: Proven track record of leveraging data for business innovation and strategic decisions. Leadership in Data Governance: Experience in leading data governance initiatives and fostering a data-driven culture within an organization. Communication and Training: Excellent communication skills with experience conducting workshops and training sessions to enhance data literacy, with at least 5 years in a data advocacy role. Data Analytics and Insight Generation: Skilled at transforming raw data into actionable insights and strategic assets, with extensive experience in data analysis. Experience working with OneTrust. To thrive at ZEEKR we believe that you have the courage to lead with trust and care and you don’t mind getting your hands dirty. You are highly innovative and have a great ability to adapt and perform in a constantly changing, fast-paced, highly demanding work environment. Like us, you believe it’s important to have a passion to work in an international and multicultural environment with the desire and ability to embrace the diversity of people, perspectives, and styles. Apply today, we will perform ongoing selection during the application period. We look forward to hearing from you. Please note that due to GDPR regulations we can only accept applications sent through the recruitment system, not via email or other channels.

title: User Experience Designer
description: Location Veldhoven, Netherlands Team Interns and Trainees Educational background Computer Science, Data Science, Other technical backgrounds Travel No Remote work Hybrid Fulltime/parttime Part time Job ID: J-00287423 Introduction Are you a bachelor or master student and have educational background in Data Visualization, Information Technology or Communication & Multimedia Design? Are you interested in user interface and experience design? If yes, this internship could be interesting for you! Background information ASML Customer Support is responsible to service a global installed base of thousands machines in a 24x7 operation with >9000 employees worldwide. The Customer Support DUV Global Support Center (GSC) is a department providing diagnostic expert support for our DUV installed base. Your assignment Within GSC team, your assignment will fully focus on helping us to design our desired “engineer cockpit solution”, not the exact content details, but definitely the user interface and experience part of it. The assignment will include among others understand the requirements and translate those to “visualizations” including a complete user experience design. A specific part of your deliverables will focus on our to-be troubleshooting timeline solution. The results from your assignment will be applied in our department roadmap and support the realization of crucial elements of it. This is an unique opportunity to look behind the scenes of and contribute to our global support organizations. Work with us to establish direction for future success of ASML Customer Support and particular the DUV GSC department. Your profile To be the perfect match for this internship, you: Are a bachelor/master student looking to do your graduation project/thesis or a master student, who is looking to gain work experience (do an apprentice internship); You have educational background in Data Visualization, Information Technology, Communication & Multimedia Design, UX/UI Design or related; You are self-driven, who likes to work in a technical environment and flourish in a multi-cultural setting; English is required. The assignment is for four days a week with a duration of six months, starting in January/February of 2024. You are expected to work at our headquarters in Veldhoven two days per week. Please note that: 1) You will receive an update on your application on December 7th. 2) We can only consider students who are enrolled at a university for the entire duration of the internship. Diversity and inclusion ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company. Other information Change the world – one nanometer at a time Become an intern at a Dutch company that’s a global industry leader. You’ll gain valuable experience in a highly innovative environment – one that sparks your imagination and creativity. In addition to a monthly internship allowance of maximum €600 (plus a possible housing and/or travel allowance), you’ll get practical guidance from experts in the field and the chance to work in and experience a dynamic team environment. ASML: be part of progress ASML is a high-tech company headquartered in the Netherlands. We manufacture the complex lithography machines that chipmakers use to produce integrated circuits, or computer chips. What we do is at the heart of all the electronic devices that keep us informed, entertained and connected. Every day, you use electronics that simply wouldn’t exist without our machines. Behind ASML’s innovations are engineers who think ahead. The people who work at our company include some of the most creative minds in physics, electrical engineering, mathematics, chemistry, mechatronics, optics, mechanical engineering, and computer science and software engineering. We believe we can always do better. We believe the winning idea can come from anyone. We love what we do – not because it’s easy, but because it’s hard. Students: getting ready for real-world R&D We’re a global team of about 29,000 people of 120 different nationalities and counting. Headquartered in Europe’s top tech hub, the Brainport Eindhoven region in the Netherlands, our operations are spread across Europe, Asia and the US. In such an environment, your colleagues may be sitting next door, or they could be thousands of kilometers away in a different country – or even working for a different company. An internship at ASML is the opportunity to get to know not only the world of industrial-strength R&D, but yourself – you’ll discover just what excites you most. Will you design a part of the machine, or make sure it gets built to the tightest possible specifications? Will you write software that drives the system to its best performance, or work side-by-side with the engineers of our customers in a fab, optimizing a system to the requirements of the customer? How will you be part of progress?

title: Wanted: Data Junkie!
description: Junk is not, like alcohol or a weed, a means to increased enjoyment of life. Junk is not a kick. It is a way of life. Zie jij in alles data of data-oplossingen? Een data junkie bij Victa denkt in codes (SQL, Python), ziet in alles structuren en datamodellering (Kimball, Data Vault) of is verslaafd aan data analytics. En omdat een echte data junkie zich niet makkelijk laat definiëren of in een hokje drukken hebben we bij Victa niet zozeer functies maar rollen en specialisaties die je kunt vervullen. Rollen van een data junkie: Data Analytics Consultant (BI Consultant) Data Engineer / Developer (DevOps) Data Scientist (Predictive) Data Visualization (UX/UI) Data Management (DataOps) Data Warehouse Consultant Wat wij gebruiken? Wij zijn niet de enigen die gek zijn op data. Ook onze klanten en opdrachtgevers hebben een steeds grotere behoefte. Bij Victa hebben we een innovatief portfolio van BI producten en diensten waardoor we iedereen in elke fase kunnen voorzien in hun verlangens. Een greep uit onze producten/drugs en specialisaties/verslavingsgebieden: Data Analytics (Power BI, QlikView, Qlik Sense) Data Pipelines (Qlik Replicate, Azure Datafactory, Victa Data Collector) Data Storage (Azure BLOB, Azure SQL, Azure Datalake) Data Management (Qlik Compose, Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Databricks) Data Warehousing (TimeXtender, Azure DWH/SQL, Snowflake) Data Science (Python, R, Tangent, DataRobot) Data Hosting (Azure, AWS) Wat wij je bieden? Wij faciliteren je volledig in je data begeerte en stimuleren je geest door je te laten werken aan uitdagende opdrachten en met gave klanten. We hebben een dynamische en innovatieve klantgerichte outside-in organisatie waarbij we met markt leidende software en oplossing het beste voor onze klanten bereiken. Dit doe je natuurlijk niet alleen maar met een team van vakidioten die net zo verslaafd zijn aan data. Afkicken is wat ons betreft ook niet nodig. We leven in een wereld waarin data steeds belangrijker is en bieden je daarom een zekere toekomst. Om voorop te blijven lopen in de markt experimenteren wij continu met nieuwe ontwikkelingen en zoeken we steeds naar nieuwe verslavingsgebieden. Interesse gewekt? Lijkt het jou, na het lezen van bovenstaande de moeite waard om een trip naar ons HQ te maken en wil jij jouw verslaving voor ons laten werken? Reageer en kom langs voor een goed gesprek. Are you a resident outside the European Union? And if you do not have a work permit, unfortunately we cannot process the application. Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze advertentie is verloren tijd want wij hebben een vaste HR en Recruitment dealer die helpt bij het zoeken naar passende verslavingen.

title: Data Specialist
description: Your Impact As a Linked Data Specialist, you enjoy solving complex issues related to accessing and visualizing very diverse types of datasets and knowledge trenches. These datasets can be large in size as well as diverse in numbers, meaning and structure. Semantic Web Technology and Linked Data play an important role in this regard. In the position of Linked Data Specialist, you will work on structuring, modeling, visualizing and transforming the data, map information into an ontology. You will also bring the technical platform to fruition. Hands on work alternates regularly with consultancy, you stay in close contact with the business. This can vary from soliciting needs to advising. It is a diverse position in which you can be active within each phase of a project. Where you're going to get started Within the Data area, we create sustainable value with our clients in the area of data. We help companies stay agile in transition by making data and technology part of both daily operations and also strategic decision-making. In doing so, we help our clients get ahead of the change using data. Our ambition is to help organizations excel with data. The area consists of 5 practices: Data Governance & Data Management, Data Visualization, Data Science & AI, Data Engineering & Data Migrations and Spatial Intelligence. Each with a clear signature and focus on content and associated solution. Within this area, over 170 professionals work in a content practice that is logical and appropriate for them. We believe in the power of multidisciplinary teams. Your expertise, personal ambitions and customer requirements are the basis for the composition of our High performance teams. You will become an indispensable link in a team of professionals, bringing out the best in each other. Everyone contributes from their own expertise and technology. This way you keep learning from each other and are therefore never alone. This is you a completed HBO or WO education; you have affinity with data, data structures and data mapping; you have knowledge and experience with modeling ontology or taxonomy; you work accurately and precisely; you have analytical thinking skills, communication skills and a practical attitude; knowledge of RDF, OWL, SKOS, SHACL, RML, Turtle and SPARQL; knowledge and experience with programming languages such as Python or R is a plus knowledge and experience with SQL is an advantage good command of the Dutch language Benefits part of our Data community with passionate and experienced peers; focus on working in one of our High Performance Teams (HPT) at renowned customers; you work in a high-tech environment with a focus on knowledge and innovation; an open no-nonsense corporate culture with room for own initiative; working with less travel time; remote & flexible; an environment where entrepreneurship and own initiative are encouraged; many opportunities for training, development and advancement; a culture where collegiality, knowledge sharing and cooperation are key; a pension plan, to which you are not required to contribute; 20 statutory days off and 7 additional days off via flex benefits; adapt your terms of employment to your personal wishes with flex benefits choice between a company car or a mobility scheme; Everyone is welcome to apply. Because we believe in the power of diversity and value inclusion. After all, the best ideas and smartest solutions arise in diverse teams. That is exactly why we pay so much attention to the composition of our high performance teams. So that you feel at home and can get the best out of yourself.

title: Data Coordinator
description: Note: This is a freelance position with a duration of 6 months, starting from January 1st, 2024. Only freelancers will be considered for this role. purpose We are committed to building and improving our Environmental Social Governance (ESG) data, reports, and programs to reduce our impacts and be fully prepared for the future. As an ESG Data Coordinator, you will play an important role within our ESG Team, contributing to the collection, analysis, and coordination of key ESG data. You will work closely with the ESG Analyst and report to the ESG Director and collaborate with teams across citizenM to achieve our sustainability goals. key responsibilities Collect, monitor, map and organize ESG data from various internal and external sources (utilities, waste, etc.) to ensure accuracy and completeness. Assist in analyzing and interpreting ESG data to identify trends, insights, and areas for improvement. Create data templates and full-fill internal and external ESG data requests. Support the preparation and reporting of ESG data to various external reporting frameworks and standards (e.g. GRESB, ISSB, GRI, CDP, CRREM, EU taxonomy, SFDR). Collaborate with the ESG analyst on maintaining and expanding the scope of citizenM’s greenhouse gas emissions inventory. Support the team in gathering information for third-party ESG data assurance. Structure and maintain ESG data documentation, ensuring data accuracy and integrity. Conduct market research and data collection on ESG trends, regulatory requirements, and best practices to support informed decision-making. Support social programs such as volunteering and employee engagement activities. qualifications / skills Bachelor's degree with a background in data analytics, sustainable finance, sustainability, or a related field. Applicable work experience, preferably in the real estate industry, finance or sustainability-related field. Proven detail-oriented analytical and problem-solving skills are essential, along with proficiency in data management, data visualization, and analysis tools such Excel and Power BI, to derive insights from complex data sets Familiarity with ESG reporting frameworks and standards (e.g. CSRD, GRESB, GRI, TCFD, CDP). Effective communication, presentation and interpersonal skills for sharing data and collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams and external stakeholders. Passion for sustainability and the drive to contribute to positive environmental and social impact. citizenM is an affordable luxury hotel chain for mobile citizens of the world. With a style that will knock your socks off, we offer citizens a real home from home, plus the world’s fluffiest pillows. Our typical guest is a frequent traveler who is quality and design-driven, and value-conscious. We currently have hotels in the Netherlands, France, UK, Switzerland, Denmark, USA, and Asia, with more to come soon. We are proud to put hospitality back into the hospitality industry and have received numerous awards for our groundbreaking approach. We like to do things differently. This means our hotels are not traditional… and neither are our support offices. We're open-minded, with kind hearts and global minds. We actively seek applications from qualified individuals and groups who are under-represented in the workplace, whether in relation to religion, ethnicity, age, gender identity, sexual orientation or disability. We’re also happy to make accommodations in the interview process and beyond to best suit the needs and strengths of disabled people and neurodivergent individuals. If you require accommodations, please add a note in your application and we will work together to find the best solution possible. #Li-hybrid #MS

title: E-commerce Specialist
description: Reference Code: 96557 E-Commerce (Data Analytics) Intern Richemont Amsterdam, NH, NL Trainee/Intern Richemont owns some of the world’s leading luxury goods Maisons, with particular strengths in jewellery, fine watches and premium accessories. Each Maison represents a proud tradition of style, quality and craftsmanship and Richemont seeks to preserve the heritage and identity of each of its Maisons. At the same time, we are committed to innovation and designing new products which are in keeping with our Maisons’ values, through a process of continuous creativity. Duration: 6 months Starting date: January 2024 Students have to be enrolled in a university for the entire duration of the internship. HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT? Are you passionate about e-Commerce? Are you inspired by the Maisons such as Cartier, IWC, Van Cleef & Arpels, Vacheron Constantin, Piaget, Panerai & Jaeger-Lecoultre? Are you driven by using data, analyzing data and creating insights from data? Then join our dynamic e-Commerce & CRC team! As our new intern, you will support the development of our e-Commerce business. 1. You will gather, validate and analyze data, to support the e-Commerce Data and Operations specialist in creating the best insights and analysis to improve the business. 2. You will collaborate with Brands e-com managers in collecting data to build operational plans. 3. You will be responsible for maintain and further developing existing dashboards 4. Your data insights will help making the right management decisions to develop the company. 5. You will gain understanding of e-commerce, improving and end-to-end mapping e-com processes. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES Prepare trend analyses and presentations. Analyze business performance and provide recommendations to the business on improvement opportunities. Support analytical requests for business cases. Provide data insights for defining annual KPIs and strategic targets. HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US? By being yourself and showing your passion for an exceptional customer experience, while demonstrating a pragmatic yet flexible attitude. You are currently enrolled in an Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in data science, Mathematics, E-commerce, Economics, Operations Management, Supply Chain or Business Administration, or related technical University program and are you available full-time, as of January/February, for a period of 6 or 12 months. You have strong written and verbal communication skills in English. With your strong analytical skills, you are an excellent organizer and enjoy driving change. Ability to manipulate and condense large volumes of data into succinct and powerful visualizations (graphs, charts, diagrams, dashboards, pivot tables). Excel and MS Office are second nature to you, BI/Data Analysis knowledge is a plus. Knowledge of a least one programming language (Python, R, etc.) While coordinating the different tasks, you like to take initiative and are pro-active. You are positive about your work and able to transmit this positivity to your colleagues, fostering a strong team-spirit. #Richemont #WeCraftTheFuture CONNECT WITH US Quick links Our History Home Page

title: Software Engineer
description: SUMMARY OF THE ROLE: Visualization & Software engineering Internship €500 gross monthly compensation Working at Schiedam, The Netherlands Are you looking for an internship where you develop VR presentations? To visualize projects with heavy-lifting equipment, which will be delivered in projects throughout the world? At Mammoet we set the bar high in developing the safest, most efficient solutions for our customer’s needs. Our department aims to create accurate presentations which give our clients optimal knowledge on the operations by Mammoet. Our goal is to provide our clients an inside look in our operations. By combining engineering drawings, 3D data, lidar scans and animations we aim to create a VR presentation for the project. Making sure complex data is visualized in a simple real-world scale overview. WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING: Research the possibilities of Virtual Reality (VR) to aid our projects. Be involved in all steps of the development project, from initiation to deployment. Promote VR within the company. Create training material that allows the user to interact within a digital environment. WHAT YOU’LL NEED: Engaged in a bachelor study in Programming, Graphics, Visualization, or IT. English, fluent proficiency verbal and written. Being familiar with Unity or C# is a bonus. WHAT YOU’LL GET: A dynamic working environment, identical projects do not exist. Improving your skills on the job. An informal and supportive internship environment who will help you grow. After the internship, opportunity to remain employed. WANT TO KNOW MORE?: Get in touch – email Ymke de Bijl Take a look at Mammoet.com #mammoetinternships #Engineeringinternships #madeformammoet

title: Data Warehouse Architect
description: Within the Van Oord organization we are professionalizing and strengthening our Data & Analytics teams, building new data & AI capabilities as well as reshaping the architecture competences to match with our company strategy: To become a fully data-driven enterprise, on the path to a digital future. Van Oord has started three major business transformation programs that aim to standardize and professionalize our core processes in areas of project estimation , project control , ship management , asset management and HR . These programs are crucial for our organization and will result in a fully cloud-based business system landscape, applying the open architecture that is prerequisite for further digital developments in data, insights, and solutions. In support of these major change programs, a ‘data foundation’ program has been started – providing the processes, governance, processes, standards and platforms to guide & support the data driven outcomes of ongoing transformational activities. The program is being developed and executed by a new and fast growing (25+ fte) Data & Analytics team. As these new business developments demand high quality data structure and governance, you will guide our business teams in further professionalizing our data management processes and standards - covering aspects like master data and data lineage, as well as the continued mapping and standardization of our data and information landscape. You will be guiding the selection, application, development, and evolution of services that together form our Microsoft Azure-based ‘COMPASS’ data platform. On this global platform we develop and run data pipelines, analytical models and provide an analytical exploration environment inside and across our business units– being ‘Offshore Energy’ and ‘Dredging & Infra’ – next to providing data services to our Survey, Engineering & Estimating and Corporate functions The COMPASS platform is of strategic importance to our businesses and is currently being defined & built. It will constantly be further developed, in close cooperation with the Data & Analytics team and business-side information analysts – supporting ongoing and future BI, IoT, ML, AI and algorithmic processing initiatives. You will have a strong role in defining/deriving the future-proof data and (to some extent) the integration architecture for new systems & platforms. You work closely together with business/IT teams in their (AGILE) projects and initiatives, aiming to maximize value from data, and supporting innovation & development of new business models - in line with our company strategy and vision. This position is available within the multi-disciplinary Enterprise Architecture team: Operating in an international enterprise environment, with members and stakeholders across the globe . The position is situated in our head office in Rotterdam – at a beautiful location, directly at the Maas. Key responsibilities are: Supporting the business-, staff and data & analytics teams towards an optimally designed & governed data and information landscapes Assisting in mapping out the business data and information landscapes, in relation to business processes and business applications Assisting other architects and analysts in addressing & resolving master data concerns Providing guidance, maintenance & development of standards, guidelines, patterns, and frameworks in data & information management Creating and maintaining data, information, data pipeline and data platform reference architecture Aligning with business-side information analysts and business analysts Data platform: Guarding quality of data pipeline ingestion, processing, model creation and delivery of data services towards downstream systems Guiding our Azure-based data, intelligence & analytics portfolio, and governing the standards around it Recognizing and bringing forward new ideas and technologies in intelligence, analytics & AI Providing input for integration discussions around IT projects, products, and other initiatives Maintaining overview and driving optimization of the Microsoft-centric data and intelligence landscape You are a passionate and analytical thinker with a solid background in information analysis and BI, and proven experience with advanced analytics. Your get energized from planning and optimizing the data landscape within an enterprise, working closely together with different business teams and their partners, enjoying work in a heterogeneous and sometimes hectic environment. With your background as senior information analyst, big data or information architecture background, you are an authority in structuring/modeling and visualizing data and information topics. You easily relate with business stakeholders on the relationships between processes, information, data, intelligence and value. You have experience with platforms that unlock business value by managing and turning data into information and insights. Topics like master data management, modeling and data transformation have no secrets for you, and you are looking forward to collaborating on streaming data and (further) discovering the strengths and value of data science and AI. You are aware of the fine balance between keeping a pragmatic approach and achieving academic correctness. You are a thought leader in data and analytics architecture, enjoy frequent interaction with the big technology vendors and do not mind the occasional travel. To be successful within Van Oord, we believe you will need the knowledge and education as described below. If you do not exactly meet these criteria but still think you are a great match: Let us know, we are happy to let us become convinced of your qualities. Bachelor or Master degree or work level experience; At least 5 years of senior software development experience; At least 2 years of tangible architecture experience in an international environment (note: non-infrastructure) ; Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, but driving for a practical outcome (!) Willingness / eagerness to drive change; Comfortable with creating visualizations, diagrams and communication materials; Excellent presentation and influencing/negotiation skills - convincing based on knowledge, personality, and seniority - rather than relying on the role itself; Strong familiarity with DevOps, automation and orchestration processes; Nontechnical skills: communication and collaboration, thought leadership; Tangible experience with the Microsoft suite of integration capabilities is a must-have ; Experienced in working in multi-disciplinary teams in a constantly changing environment; Strong English (CEFR C1/C2) written and verbal communication & presentation skills. Dutch is preferred but is not mandatory. We offer you a position in which you will have an important contribution to our mission 'building a better world for future generations'.
