title: Data Analyst
description: A Data Analyst is required for my client who work within the food industry. It is an exciting opportunity to work with a massive client on a annual contract with the intention to turn into a permanent role. To apply for this role, you must be fluent in Dutch & English.You will act as the middleman between the business stakeholders and the development team, Data engineers, Data modelers and Front-end specialists. You will work in an Active environment where you discuss requirements with business stakeholders, translate them into solution designs, plan the deliverables, and work as part of the development team towards a successful result. You will perform exploratory data analysis,identify, and perform data quality checks.Requirements2+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst.Knowledge of SQL, Python, Microsoft Azure and data visualization tools.Have experience communicating clearly in both English & Dutch both in speech and writing.You have experience solving and structuring both conceptual and concrete problems.You must have strong analytical skills.ResponsibilitiesYou will regulate, optimize and safeguard the processes and dashboard functionalities like designs, scripting, presentation choices, test findings, availability and authorizations in collaboration with the BI Team.You will Analyse onboarded datasets to identify inconsistencies and proactively resolve data issues.Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.You will gather requirements in the business for dashboards / reports and translate them into appropriate solution designs;What They OfferHighly competitive Salary - DOEEnd of year Bonus.Award winning training and development.Health InsuranceOpportunities for external training for your own personal development and growth.This is an exciting opportunity for a data analyst to join a leading company. If joining a company where you get a personal career development track, a substantial training budget, and regular training sessions sounds like a company you would be interested in, please apply with your full CV or drop me an email on dguinnane@leap29.com

title: Analytics Intern
description: We are looking for an Analytics Intern to join our team at VonWood and help us bring the wood industry into the 21st century.We are seeking a highly motivated and talented Analytics Intern to join our team. The intern will collaborate with various business units to understand product and business data and the underlying processes. They will be responsible for improving and updating our low-code application in Retool, building new workflows, identifying meaningful insights from large data sources, and designing, developing, testing, and implementing appropriate data-driven solutions. The ideal candidate will be proactive, open-minded, and have a strong interest in data analysis and visualisation.What wood you do?As an Analytics Intern you willCollaborate with various business units to understand product and business data and the underlying processes;Identify meaningful insights from large data sources; interpret and communicate insights and findings from analyses and experiments to product, service, and business stakeholders;Scrape, analyse and dashboard external data;Design, develop, test, and implement appropriate data-driven solutions through data analysis and visualisation.Why wood you?We are a fast-growing startup in Amsterdam. Besides being part of a young, fresh, and energetic team of over a dozen colleagues (you’ll be in good company), we can offer you the following:An international, ambitious startup culture with a sustainable touch;An inspiring environment of brilliant, fun, and creative professionals;Continuous learning and growth opportunities beyond your field of expertise;An internship compensation of €450 gross per month;Making a difference, by making the world more sustainable;Possibility to work from home;Convenient location near the business heart of Amsterdam (‘Zuid-As’) and Olympic Stadium.We are looking for ambitious individuals who thrive in fast-paced environments. We are building complex software solutions with a modern tech stack.Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business Information Management, Business Analytics and Management, Information Science, Data Science, Data Engineering, or related fields;Excellent communication skills in English (both verbal and written);Strong attention to detail and a structured way of working;Proactive, open-minded, and flexible personality;Proficient in SQL;Some programming experience in python or a similar language;Bias towards action - We learn by building things, not by talking about building things;

title: Medior Data Analist
description: Hey mid-career data analist! Heb je affiniteit met onderwijs, data én ben jij opzoek naar een volgende stap in je carrière, lees dan snel verder! Het gaat om een nieuwe functie waarin je veel vrijheid krijgt om deze vorm te geven. Wil je deel uitmaken van een team dat zich dagelijks inzet om bibliotheken door heel Nederland te ondersteunen? Dan is deze baan iets voor jou!Je komt terecht in een organisatie die aan het begin staat van data-gedreven werken dus jouw ervaring, kennis en kunde zijn van groot belang. Als Data Analist krijg je hier de ruimte om niet alleen de basis neer te zetten, maar ook je eigen inzichten te delen en uit te werken. De organisatie is maatschappelijk georiënteerd en is gericht op leesbevordering en -plezier, met een open en moderne werkomgeving. Je komt in een warm team met vier collega’s. Wat ga je doen? Basisprocessen verbeteren uit het nieuwe ERP systeem (CSI)Belangrijke datastromen inzichtelijk maken, middels dashboardingMeedenken over procesontwikkeling, waardoor je (in)direct aan de knoppen zitAdvies geven over data-analyse in samenwerking met het team Wie ben jij? Je hebt rond de twee jaar ervaring als data analistJe bent niet afwachtend en neemt initiatief om zelf in processen te duikenJe controleert bestaande processen en denkt mee over nieuwe processenJe bent een doorpakker die niet alleen data inzichtelijk maakt, maar ook met praktische voorstellen ter verbetering komt Wat biedt je werkgever jou? Een marktconform salaris van €3450-€5000 per maand, op basis van 36 uurEen eindejaarsuitkering na rato 4%25 vakantiedagen (op basis van 36 uur)Reiskostenvergoeding, laptop en mobielSportactiviteiten in eigen sportzaal, persoonlijk ontwikkelbudget en bibliotheekabonnementEen modern kantoor in Zoetermeer, met de mogelijkheid om op termijn hybride te werkenEen werkomgeving waar veel aandacht wordt besteed aan onboarding en persoonlijke ontwikkeling

title: Analytics Engineer (L5) - Globalization
description: At Netflix, our mission is to entertain the world by connecting our members to an extensive library of stories from all over the globe. We are revolutionizing international storytelling as we deliver billions of hours of movies and TV shows per month to 200+ million members across 190+ countries in 30+ languages.The Globalization Data Science and Engineering team is at the forefront of removing language barriers and providing a stellar member experience to all our members regardless of their language preferences. We are responsible for the translation and cultural adaptation of all aspects of member interaction, including beautiful localized user interfaces, subtitles, and dubbing of award-winning Netflix originals.EMEA is a significant center for our broader Studio and Creative Production teams. We are looking for an experienced Analytics Engineer based in our Amsterdam office to join our growing EMEA team. In this role, you will design and develop analytic tools and systems to create more member value via localization expansion and optimization. You will partner with a talented cross-functional team of engineers, scientists, product managers and domain experts to shape localization strategy and deliver business impact.ResponsibilitiesAct as strategic partner for stakeholders and cross-functional collaborators to identify business opportunities and enhance business strategies with automated data solutionsDrive the direction and execution of your work, which span from developing scrappy analytic tools to designing scalable analytic systemsPartner closely with other engineers and scientists to improve foundational data models and accelerate productization of data insightsShare your innovation and collaborate with the broader community to strengthen analytics enablementBecome a regional expert on Globalization Data Science and Engineering, helping educate and connect with regional officesAbout YouProven track record of designing and developing scalable analytic tools and systemsHigh proficiency in standard tech stack (e.g., Python, SQL, Spark) and common data visualization tools (e.g., Streamlit, Tableau)Familiar with fundamentals of Machine Learning and Statistical Inference as well as data engineering best practices5+ years of relevant experiences with building data products powered by big dataExceptional communication and collaboration skills coupled with strong business acumenComfortable with ambiguity; able to take ownership, and thrive with minimal oversight and processNetflix culture resonates with youNetflix cultureNetflix's culture is an integral part of what makes us successful, and we approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that bringing together different perspectives and backgrounds helps build stronger teams. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Analytics Engineer, Strategy and Competitive Intelligence
description: Brief info about VintedVinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with a growing member base of over 80 million registered members spanning 19 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Czech Republic, Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 1,800 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.Information about the positionAs a Competitive Intelligence Analytics Engineer, you will be responsible for developing, executing, and maintaining our competitive intelligence data processing and insight creation, gaining insights into the market landscape, growth and developments. You’ll be fueling our strategy with up to date market intelligence. This is a role that requires a strong understanding of data processing and data quality management, and we are looking for someone with an independent mindset, able to collaborate across functions and teams.Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines. Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making. Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithmsIn this position, you’llArchitect, build, and maintain automated scripts and data workflows to process web data into strategic insights. Monitor data pipelines, identify anomalies, and troubleshoot data quality issues in a timely manner with different internal and external stakeholders. Conduct root cause analysis to identify the source of data issues and work towards long-term solutions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Science, Engineering, and Strategy, to understand data needs and insights to be delivered, as well as managing external data providersPerform analysis to enrich the data with strategically relevant insights, creating data visualizations and reports to effectively communicate data quality insights to stakeholders, performing root cause analysis in case of issues in production processesDesign and maintain data quality metrics and KPIs, providing insights into data accuracy and completeness. Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies that may impact data quality. Ensuring that you and other end-users are able to optimally use the data models - drive optimization, documentation, training, and monitoring of best practicesAlso, we work with Looker to disclose our data to the teams, experience in Looker is a nice-to-have. Proactively identify and drive opportunities to make Data Science and Analytics within Vinted even more impactfulAbout YouProven experience: typically 2+ years (of working experience or alternative activities resulting in a similar level of proficiency) with data collection and monitoring as an Analytics Engineer, Data Engineer, Cloud Engineer or equivalentFluent in SQL and Python. Working experience in a programing language like Java, Scala or similarExperience with DBT (data build tool) and Google Cloud Platform (incl. BigQuery) are an advantageExperience developing and maintaining data processing systems at scale and being able to make architectural decisions taking into account aspects like scalability, efficiency and reliability. Experience with data modeling. Excellent attention to detail. We are looking for someone who understands the value of documentation and clean, tidy codeIndependent working, capable of setting up, running and maintaining data processes without much supportStrong communication & collaboration skills - able to build and maintain multi-functional relationships with various teams across the business as well as translate business needs into technical solutionsExcellent at communicating in spoken and written EnglishAdvantage: Interest and experience in competitive intelligence Work perksThe opportunity to benefit from our share options programme25 days of paid annual leaveNewest MacBook modelsMental and emotional health support through the Mindletic appFrequent team-building eventsHome office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furnitureA daily lunch allowanceClassPass (Gym Membership subsidy)Frequent team-building eventsPension plan with total contribution of 12%, 8% by the Company and 4% by employeeA personal monthly budget for shopping on VintedAn NS mobility cardThe opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workationA dog-friendly officeWorking at VintedIndividual Learning BudgetVinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.Hybrid WorkWe’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.Equal OpportunityThe Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.The salary range for this position is € 47,900 - € 64,860 gross per year.

title: Analytics Engineer
description: About us; iconic brand, tiny companyPolaroid was founded in 1937 by one of the most seminal innovators of the 20th century, Edwin Land. His motto was, “don't undertake a project unless it is manifestly important and nearly impossible.” In 2008, Polaroid shuttered its last factory, but a group of diehard fans came together as The Impossible Project to save instant film. Over 10 years later that start-up acquired what was left of Polaroid and today we’re again a small group of people passionate about empowering creators to change the world in the name of Polaroid.What we are building; tools for creatorsThroughout its 80-year history, Polaroid was at its best when we made tools for people to express themselves, push boundaries and move culture forward. In the next decade, we are getting back to this purpose. We're not solving small problems, and we're not addressing a small market; our goal is to make products that will make the world more meaningful and human.The roleWe are seeking a detail-oriented and technically skilled individual to lead our digital analytics implementation and manage our customer data platform (CDP) initiatives. This dual role requires expertise in setting up, maintaining, and troubleshooting web analytics tracking systems, along with engineering and integrating customer data platforms.Responsibilities:1. Implement, manage, and troubleshoot web analytics tracking systems using tools like Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.2. Collaborate with various teams to understand their tracking and data needs, ensuring accurate and effective implementation.3. Test, validate, and debug tracking setups to ensure data accuracy and integrity.4. Identify and resolve tracking, data integrity, and CDP-related issues.5. Design, deploy, and manage CDP systems to centralize customer data, ensuring it's accessible and actionable for marketing initiatives.6. Assist in setting up and maintaining Google Analytics accounts, views, properties, Google Tag Manager containers, tags, and CDP integrations.7. Create and maintain technical documentation related to web analytics tracking implementation and CDP processes.8. Assist in data analysis, report generation, and offer insights from both web analytics and CDP data.9. Train team members on tracking tool setup, CDP usage, and best practices.10. Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices.Requirements:1. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Marketing, or a related field plus 3 years commercial experience2. Proven experience in implementing and maintaining web analytics tracking systems and CDP platforms.3. Strong understanding of digital marketing, web analytics, and customer data management.4. Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSON, and relevant CDP technologies.5. Familiarity with data layer concepts, structures, and data integration methodologies.6. Strong problem-solving skills and keen attention to detail.7. Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences. Preferred:1. Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and major CDP platform certifications.2. Experience with other tag management systems, web analytics tools, and CDP integrations.3. Knowledge of SEO, SEM strategies, and data privacy regulations.If you apply for a position at Polaroid, we will process your personal data. Please see our Job Applicant Privacy Policy for more information about how we handle personal data of job applicants. https://www.polaroid.com/privacy-policy

title: Analytics Engineer
description: Wat je gaat doenIn deze rol werk je nauw samen met het hele data team en de rest van de organisatie. Binnen het data team werk je samen met Data Engineering, Data analisten en Data Scientists om te zorgen dat wij data zo effectief mogelijk in kunnen zetten. Voor de verschillende afdelingen binnen onze organisatie ontwikkel je de belangrijkste data modellen en data producten voor ieder domein, samen met data analysten en engineers.Je zorgt dat ons data platform best in class is op gebied van data kwaliteit en bepaalt, samen met het team, standaarden & implementeert best practices.Tot slot werk je aan educatie, je deelt in de organisatie deze standaarden en zorgt dat anderen hier efficiënt mee kunnen werken.In deze functie krijg je de mogelijkheid om analytics engineering binnen onze organisatie te ontwikkelen en jezelf te ontwikkelen als analytics engineer.

title: Analytics Engineer - Partner Analytics
description: How do you make our customers happy? At bol.com, we are dedicated to making daily life more convenient for our customers. We do that via our own retailer as well as via the 51.000+ selling partners. As Analytics Engineer, you build the data analytics foundation for the partner business of bol.com. That takes more than analytical and engineering skills; it also requires you to be a team player and understand a platform business. Right up your alley? Welcome aboard! The biggest challenge Bol.com excels at data-driven decision making. Analytics teams support product & business teams in providing direction, setting up experiments and monitoring processes. With state-of-the-art tools, processing power and high-quality data sources we transform Terabytes of data on a daily basis. The challenge we are facing is; how do we make sure all these data transformations are of high quality?The Analytics Engineer curates the data so that data analysts in teams can do their work more effectively. Analytics engineers improve data quality by bringing the rigor of software engineering to our analytics code while, at the same time, bringing a deep business understanding into the data transformation process.What You Do As Analytics EngineerAs Analytics Engineer, you’ll land in a central data & analytics team which is on a mission to make sure all decisions across our partner business teams are data-driven (>100 colleagues). Your team (~10 colleagues) focuses on several mission-critical topics such as building an integral view on our partners using different data sources, monitoring the quality of our partners, understanding and targeting our valuable partners at the right time and experimenting with new business solutions.You will support your colleagues in the analytics team to create high quality data pipelines. Clean Code principles such as test-driven development, meaningful names, small functions, DRY, are what you practise and preach. You ensure data transformations are tested, documented, monitored, logged, performant and adhere to our security & privacy policies. Next to that, you will be involved in some data heavy projects like developing and maintaining some of the bol.com KPIs. You use tools and concepts like; Git, CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes, Python, SQL, Airflow, dbt , data testing, monitoring and alerting, to create a state-of-the-art analytics environment that enforces quality standards. You develop, monitor and safeguard the partner business KPIs, and consult with colleague Data Analysts. You use your strong communication skills to train and support your colleague Data Analysts in the ways of the Analytics Engineer through pair-programming and workshops. You’re an ambassador for our analytics platform and help colleagues take a more data-driven approach, for example, by modelling and creating highly valuable datasets. Why you can make the difference Because you’re an enthusiastic team player who lives and breathes software engineering & analytics. You combine solid technical skills with the ability to translate abstract problems into specific code improvements. You enjoy discussing insights with colleagues and are open to feedback. You inspire your team to reframe challenges as opportunities.3 reasons why this is (not) for you - Passive You have a hard time forming and expressing your opinion. Your contribution in meetings is generally limited to shaking your head and nodding - Output over outcome Your work ends when you complete a feature – who cares how users experience it - Conservative You're not curious to new techniques and methods and rely on one-trick-pony power #safetyfirst + High quality code & data You have a background in software engineering and a deep interest in analytics (>2 years experience) + SQL, dbt, Git & Python SQL, dbt, Git & Python are your home away from home + Sharing is caring You like to share your knowledge and experiences with others It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

title: Analytics Engineer, Trust
description: Brief info about VintedVinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with a growing member base of over 80 million registered members spanning 19 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Czech Republic, Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 1,800 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.Information about the positionAs an analytics engineer in the Trust domain, you will be responsible for delivering a world-class ecosystem of tools and services to empower our Content Quality sub-domain. Content Quality is a critical function responsible for detecting and actioning malicious and unwanted listings.Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways, and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines. Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision-making. Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms. In this position, you’llBuild, and maintain efficient & reliable data models and pipelines for both external and internal data in partnership with data engineeringContinuously collaborate with the data and business stakeholders within the company to collect data needs - and translate this into functioning pipelines and data modelsEnsure our colleagues are able to optimally use the data models - drive optimisation, documentation, training, and monitoring of best practicesPerform root cause analysis in case of issues in data production processesContribute to our data migration from an on-premise-based data warehouse to a Google Cloud Platform basedAbout YouIntermediate work experience as an Analytics Engineer, ETL Developer, Data Analyst/Scientist, Data Engineer or alternative activities resulting in a similar level of proficiencyProficiency in SQL and ability to write SQL code which is easy to understand, simple to troubleshoot and highly performantFamiliarity with data modelling frameworks for analytical purposes, data access and data storage techniquesWorking experience in another programming language, e.g. Python, Java, ScalaStrong communication & collaboration skills - able to build and maintain multi-functional relationships with various teams across the business as well as translate business needs into technical solutionsAttentiveness to detailExcellent written and spoken EnglishAdvantage: You have experience with cloud data warehouses (e.g. Google BigQuery)Advantage: You have experience with dbtWork perksThe opportunity to benefit from our share options programme25 days of paid annual leaveMental and emotional health support through the Mindletic appFrequent team-building eventsHome office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furnitureA daily lunch allowanceClassPass (Gym Membership subsidy)Frequent team-building eventsA personal monthly budget for shopping on VintedAn NS mobility cardThe opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workationA dog-friendly officeWorking at VintedIndividual Learning BudgetVinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.Hybrid WorkWe’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.Equal OpportunityThe Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.The salary range for this position is €47,900 - €79,925 gross per year.

title: Data Engineer.
description: Do you want to make a difference and contribute to creating a better world? Are you interested in developing your skills and knowledge, while putting your ideals to work? Join us, we are a frontrunner in ethical banking and global impact investing, and we need people like you to make change happen.We believe that money can change the world for the better. In fact, our organisation was founded on this belief. Our mission is to create a society that protects and promotes the quality of life of all its members with human dignity at its core.Because more and more data are digitalized and the demand for information is rapidly increasing, especially in our bank environment, we are looking for aData Engineer (36-40 hours p/w)Providing insights to our positive impact. You make it possible.All our data is to be recorded and processed in a transparent manner. As a Data Engineer you know what to do with this. To meet the growing demand for BI and Data projects, you will work on the further development of our Enterprise Data Warehouses (EDW), Data Lake (Azure), data marts and Analysis & Reporting environments. Topics like "How do we provide insight into our positive impact?" or "How to channel new information through our data infrastructure?" will be on your to do list. We offer plenty of challenges and opportunities for you, as a Data Engineer, to contribute to our success and leave your own mark on our data environment in our evolving team.How Will You Make a DifferenceTranslate business requirements into SQL logic for ETL processing and reporting.Unlock new source systems and integrate the data into the model of our EDW (including data marts) and data lake platform.Configure and test data pipelines in our scheduling tool Airflow.Stimulate and improve data awareness and data literacy across the whole organisation.Contribute to a stable and high-quality data environment.ProfileWhat You Will BringWhile you were just working on the design and build of a data flow for the Dutch National Bank (De Nederlandse Bank (DNB)), a colleague asks you whether you could take a look at the data model for a new Know Your Customer data mart. You can easily switch from one project to another. And you love this dynamic without losing your focus. You know the best results are achieved together. Thanks to your clear way of communicating, you and your business and IT colleagues will quickly get to the core of every problem. This is complemented by:A Bachelor or Master degree (work / thinking level).Several years of experience in a similar role, such as Data Engineer or BI SpecialistHas advanced knowledge of SQLHas worked with standing and new generation BI and data toolsPreferably with experience in the financial and/or regulatory sectorSocially concerned. You share our mission to create and realise positive impact.Has affinity with Agile/Scrum way of working, Python and Big Data initiatives.Pro-active and communicative.Your future colleaguesFor our new Data Engineer, a (digital) desk is available at our Data Office team. The team currently consists of 15 data professionals, divided into 3 Scrum focus teams that work on specific topics. You will be part of a close-knit team that is attuned to each other. We do this in an informal and transparent manner, with plenty of room for own initiative and development. Therefore, we offer room for (personal) training and the opportunity to experiment.Company detailsOfferWhat We Offer YouAn inspiring work cultureThe most important thing about working with us is that you are part of community that is changing the world for the better. We are constantly improving our work culture to create conditions where every person can thrive, so you are able to:find a sense of meaning in your workcreate positive energy and impact with your co-workersbuild mutual trust and respect in working relationshipsenjoy fulfilment at a professional and personal levelA comfortable working environmentOur award-winning sustainable head office is based in Driebergen-Zeist, the Netherlands at the Reehorst Estate, just a 3 minutes’ walk from the train station. Combined with working from home, it is an inspiring place to work and connect with your colleagues. One of the interesting facts about it is that we can completely take the building apart and move it to a new location.And of course, great remuneration and working conditions:a salary appropriate to the position, our remuneration policy and your experiencean attractive pension policya mobility card (including free private travels)flexible working hours and the opportunity to work from homereimbursement of a company bicycle to the max of € 1,50030 holiday days with a 40-hour working week, plus the option of buying 2 weeks of extra holiday daysextra leave to contribute to voluntary worka range of education and training opportunitiesthe option to join our collective health insurancea working from home allowance per home office daysuitable home office equipment up to € 750 every 5 yearsSounds interesting?If you feel that you want to make a difference, don’t hesitate to join the Triodos community by applying for this role.Everyone is welcome and our culture is built with human dignity at its core. We believe in equity and diversity, and we know how valuable everyone’s individual perspectives are. We strive to create an environment in which all co-workers and our broader community can feel safe and included.The closing date for applications is: 15 December 2023If the role interests you but you still have some questions, please connect with us. If there are any additional adjustments you may need during the application process, please email: Coen de Winter, Talent Acquisition Expert, via [email protected] .We also don’t want to miss out on candidates who feel they don’t exactly match the job description, so if this is a role that sounds interesting to you, and you feel you could add value, please apply.Who we areTriodos Bank is a leading expert in sustainable banking, founded in 1980 in the Netherlands, with branches in Belgium, Germany, United Kingdom, and Spain.Triodos Investment Management is a globally recognised leader in impact investing, that currently manages 20 funds invested in both Europe and emerging markets.Triodos Regenerative Money Centre is our business unit launched in 2019 with the explicit goal of restoring and regenerating nature and society.We are a certified B Corp since 2015. B Corp is a growing global community of successful and sustainable companies that create positive social impact and change.We are also one of the founders of The Global Alliance for Banking on Values , a global network of independent banks using finance to deliver sustainable economic, social, and environmental development.www.triodos.com | www.triodos-im.com | www.triodosfoundation.nlLocationDriebergen-Rijsenburg (Nederland)Publication Date29 November 2023

title: Data Visualization Engineer
description: Optiver are looking for a skilled Data Visualization Engineer to design, develop and implement solutions for our trading teams in Amsterdam and globally. The successful Engineer will bring a strong technical capability as well as an approach that will enable them to integrate with our high-paced trading teams, collaborate with trading stakeholders to formulate requirements and create innovative visualizations and tooling on the trading floor.WHO WE ARE:Our Amsterdam office is where it all began. Over 35 years ago, Optiver’s business started with a single trader on the floor of Amsterdam’s European Stock Exchange. Since our 1986 founding, Optiver’s Amsterdam office has grown into one of the most dynamic and exciting trading floors in Europe. Our culture reflects the Dutch capital city’s progressive, innovative and inclusive nature. With its unique spirit, Amsterdam is the ideal hub for our teams to trade a wide range of products from listed derivatives to cash equities, ETFs, bonds and foreign exchange.WHAT YOU’LL DO:You will work on creating and maintaining data visualizations and UI applications that are used by traders to form trading decisions and to interact with other Optiver systems.The goal of the team is to provide users with highly responsive, flexible and reliable tools that can be used to monitor the state of global financial markets and to control our internal strategies. The impact of the work you will do spans across multiple different teams and levels of the organization. Apart from creating user interfaces and their backends, the UX team also owns and develops internal frameworks and standards describing how to create user interfaces within the company.As a Data Visualization Engineer you can expect to:Create web based data visualizationsWork closely with traders, developers and other stakeholders to discover requirements and design solutionsDesign and build data processing pipelines used during data pre-processing stagesContribute to the UI framework and ecosystem used across multiple teams within the companyBe involved in a very short feedback loop and see your products having actual impact on daily work of their usersWork on data and UI optimization problemsHelp members of other teams create and optimize data visualizationsWHO YOU ARE:Trading applications need to be reliable and robust, therefore we look for developers with a strong engineering mindset that can work in a highly dynamic environment while creating simple and solid solutions. Those solutions must integrate well with the broad ecosystem of Optiver data sources and backend services.In terms of skills and qualifications we're looking for:A degree in computer science or a related fieldStrong knowledge of PythonExperience with creating data visualizations and user interfacesExperience with creating web applications and working with distributed systemsFamiliarity with one or more of the following technologies: Plotly Dash, Bokeh, React.js, SQL, C++, JavaScript, HTML/CSSStrong communication skillsProblem solving mindsetEagerness to learn(including financial and trading knowledge)ProactivenessWHAT YOU’LL GET: The chance to start your career working alongside best-in-class professionals from over 40 different countries.Alongside this you will get great secondary benefits such as 25 paid vacation days, fully paid first-class commuting expenses, training opportunities, discounts on health insurance, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, Friday afternoon drinks and even weekly in-house chair massages. Being highly international, we are accustomed to guiding expats through their relocation, offering competitive relocation packages and providing visa sponsorship where necessary.HOW TO APPLY:If you’re interested in taking your career to one of the most exciting trading floors in Europe, please apply via the form below. While we love how bilingual our teams are, be sure to write your CV and motivation letter in English. We’re eager to learn all about your background and interests, which means applications lacking a motivation letter sadly will not be reviewed. But if we think you could be a good fit, you’ll hear from us sooner than you might expect!More information on how Optiver Europe processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy. In the event of questions, feel free to contact our Recruitment team at recruitment@optiver.com.Kindly note that we do not require any assistance from third-parties including agencies in the recruitment of this role. DIVERSITY STATEMENT: As an intentionally flat organisation, we believe that great ideas and impact can come from everyone. We are passionate about empowering individuals and creating diverse teams that thrive. Every person at Optiver should feel included, valued and respected, because we believe our best work is done together.Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is hardwired through every stage of our hiring process. We encourage applications from candidates from any and all backgrounds, and we welcome requests for reasonable adjustments during the process to ensure that you can best demonstrate your abilities.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description: 【About Tencent】Tencent is a world-leading internet and technology company that develops innovative products and services to improve the quality of life of people around the world. Founded in 1998 with its headquarters in Shenzhen China, our guiding principle is to use technology for good. We are not only a major video game publisher in the world, we also produce other high-quality digital content, enriching interactive entertainment experiences for people around the globe. We offer a range of services such as cloud computing, advertising, FinTech, and other enterprise services to support our clients' digital transformation and business growth.【About Level Infinite】 Level Infinite is a global gaming brand dedicated to delivering high-quality and engaging interactive entertainment experiences to a worldwide audience, wherever and however they choose to play. It operates from bases in Amsterdam and Singapore with staff around the world. To learn more about Level Infinite, visit www.levelinfinite.com, and follow on Twitter,Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.Responsibilities:1. Responsible for the development of the IEG Global advertising platform.2. Responsible for the design and implementation of the cloud data platform part of the advertising platform.3. Responsible for the technical support and technology exchange with game studios.Requirements:1.Bachelor degree or above, majoring in computer science, engineering or related fields.5+ years of working experience, 3+ years of data development experience.2.Experience in SQL and at least 2 programming languages: Python, Scala, Java, etc. and complies with coding standards and technical design.3.Deep understanding of big data tools: Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Flink, etc.Experience in Spark, Flink or related application development.4.Ability to build cloud data platforms on common cloud platforms such as Azure, GCP, AWS, etc. 5.Excellent communication skills and good teamwork spirit . Active learning and love of sharing. Experience in open source project maintenance is preferred.[DEI Statement] Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Tencent: Diversity, equity and inclusion are important, interdependent components of our workplace. As an equal opportunity employer, we firmly believe that diverse voices fuel our innovation and allow us to better serve our users and the community. We foster an environment where every employee of Tencent feels supported and inspired to achieve individual and common goals.

title: BI Engineer Industrial Automation
description: In het kortData intelligence, business intelligence en data science & analytics zijn niet meer weg te denken uit onze huidige samenleving. Door voortschrijdende technologie neemt de stroom van waardevolle data – en daarmee de mogelijkheden voor slim gebruik van data binnen organisaties – in hoog tempo toe. Als BI Engineer Industrial Automation zie je het als een uitdaging om stapsgewijs de datastroom te structureren en de behoefte van onze klanten te vertalen naar intelligente oplossingen. In deze functie ben je primair verantwoordelijk voor het opbouwen van rapportage mogelijkheden met behulp van data visualisatietools en dataplatformen (Bijv. Power BI, Tableau, Inmation, AVEVA Datahub), en de resultaten weergeven in gemakkelijk te begrijpen, interactieve dashboards. Je ontwikkelt ad-hoc query’s,rapportages en dashboards op basis van requirements. Met de resultaten ga je data-analyse gebruiken om samen met de key-users van de klant prestaties te meten, hypothesen te testen, inzichten te ontwikkelen en aanbevelingen te doenDit vind je leuk om te doenOphalen, uitwerken en ontwikkelen van vereisten voor KPI-rapportage en -analyse;Schrijven en onderhouden van ETL-processen voor het extraheren en voorbereiden van data;Creatieve en praktische oplossingen toepassen om rapportageactiviteiten te automatiseren;Effectief communiceren met alle niveaus van interne en externe stakeholders;Verzamel de benodigde data, koppel ze en visualiseer ze.Hier herken je jezelf inMinimaal 2 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie;Ervaring met het ontwikkelen van query’s en nieuwe rapportages;Bekend met Power BI, Tableau of Plantweb Optics, AVEVA Datahub;Kennis van datamodellering & -transformatie;Sterke communicatievaardigheden;Kennis van Asset Administration Shell, AutomationML is een pre;Ervaring binnen het industriële werkveld is een pre;Certificering als Certified Data Professional (iccp) is een pre.Wie zijn wij?Als ervaren leverancier van oplossingen voor industriële technologie wil ICT Netherlands de wereld elke dag een stap slimmer maken. Onze toegewijde technische professionals voorzien klanten van diensten op het gebied van consultancy, softwareontwikkeling, projectmatige oplossingen en managed services.Wat bieden wij?13e maand: elk jaar een extra maandsalaris;29 vakantiedagen: met de vrijheid om dagen toe te voegen of te verkopen;Hybride werkwijze: een goede balans tussen thuis en kantoor;Pensioenregeling: een goede regeling voor uw oude dag;Leaseauto: of een vergoeding voor uw eigen auto;Onkostenvergoeding: een netto bijdrage in de werkkosten;Training: houd je kennis op peil in onze ICT Academy;Boekbudget: koop een boek of hard- of software voor jezelf.Heb je interesse in deze vacature, neem dan contact met op met Esther Blok via esther.blok@ict.nl of 088-9082000. Wij maken alvast een bureau voor je vrij!

title: Junior Data Engineer
description: Wat je gaat doenAls Junior Data Engineer bij de Bijenkorf word je onderdeel van één van de grootste en meest data-geïnformeerderetail organisaties van Nederland. Jouw toekomstige team is verantwoordelijk voor de ontwikkeling en het beheer van het data platform van de Bijenkorf. Deze omgeving biedt ondersteuning aan alle door data gedreven beslissingen binnen de Bijenkorf organisatie. Jij zal meebouwen aan eenâ¯best in class-oplossing, die ervoor gaat zorgen dat de Bijenkorf de meest data-geïnformeerde e-tailer van Nederland wordt en blijft.Het Data Engineering team is verantwoordelijk voor het fundament van ons Data Platform op GCP.Dit houdt in:Het ontwikkelen van betrouwbare en schaalbare data pipelines (ETL/ELT in Python). Het definiëren van standaarden voor ons Data Platform. Het ontwikkelen van hoogwaardige data producten en tooling kijkend naar performance, code kwaliteit, data validatie en data governance. Het bouwen van dataproducten en -tooling volgens kwaliteitsprincipes zoals codekwaliteit, datavalidatie, data governance en vindbaarheid.Het delen van learnings en best practices met het data team. Samenwerken met interne teams rondom data vraagstukken. Spotten van kansen voor het verbeteren van ons data platform en deze implementeren. Er is veel ruimte om mee te beslissen binnen het domein van Data Engineering over standaarden, manier van werken en met welke technologieën. Je bent een sparringpartner voor Data Analisten, Data Scientist en andere stakeholders voor de beste aanpak voor diverse Data vraagstukken. Je werkt aan het data platform voor de gehele organisatie en werkt met een breed scala aan domeinen zoals o.a. supply chain, winkels, ecommerce, marketing/sales, klantdata ect.Je gaat werken met Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Cloud Composer/Apache Airflow), Python, Terraform

title: Senior Data Engineer
description: At Henkel, you can be a game changer and craft your career. Unleash your entrepreneurial spirit by bringing your ideas to life within a global team. Our leading brands and technologies, along with our high-performing businesses will provide you with countless opportunities to develop your skills and explore new paths. Your career at Henkel will contribute to a more sustainable future, while you grow within our vibrant, diverse culture of trust and belonging. If you're up for challenging the status quo, join our team of pioneers and make your mark on the future with us.Do you dare to make an impact? Your Role Act as lead analytics engineer designing & developing analytical solutions and datasets for end users. Data modeling experience in a way that empowers end users. Organize and transform data in a meaningful way and provide additional context so that it is ready for analysis. Design, develop and use tools, algorithms, and processes for data analysis and data visualization to generate reports to be used in decision making of end users. Write production-quality ELT code with an eye towards performance and maintainability. Live software engineering best practices (e.g., building testing suites and CI pipelines). Design, build, and enhance tools and techniques for our DataOps approach such as automatic code generation, automatic data validation and maintenance of development, test and production environments. As an Architect, be part of a team of data professionals in the Data & Analytics department, guide the team with your expertise and extend and deepen your knowledge by strong collaboration within the team. Actively participate in cross-functional teams using agile methods to deliver high quality data products at a fast pace. Ensure documentation related to datasets and analysis is maintained as well as ensure that everyone on the data team uses the same language and definitions. Collaborate with our platform team to discover opportunities to improve our systems, enterprises, and processes to have high-quality data. YOUR SKILLS Master’s degree in computer science, software engineering or a related subject. Minimum 5 years of working experience in cloud data ecosystems; covering data ingestion, data modeling, and data provisioning to consumers and downstream systems. Experience in ETL/ELT design, data and interface specifications, quality assurance and testing methods. Experience in building robust, scalable, high-quality data products in iterations and integrating them into existing and new data-pipelines. Power BI design experience (e.g. Dashboard building; Adhoc reporting etc.). Experience with agile methodologies in a professional development environment (CI/CD) and code versioning tools, such as Git, SVN, etc. Excellent coding skills in relevant languages for Microsoft Azure environment (e.g. SQL, Python, DAX) Azure DevOps knowledge would be an advantage. Fluent in English. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Henkel is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to gender, origin, culture, mindset, generation, disability, religion and sexual orientation.

title: Senior - Data Engineer (Opportunity based in Barcelona)
description: Please Note: Great opportunity to relocate for a role based in Barcelona, Spain.About Gartner IT:Join a world-class team of skilled engineers who build creative digital solutions to support our colleagues and clients. We make a broad organizational impact by delivering cutting-edge technology solutions that power Gartner. Gartner IT values its culture of nonstop innovation, an outcome-driven approach to success, and the notion that great ideas can come from anyone on the team.About the role:Gartner is looking for a Senior Data Engineer focused on development of integrations/infrastructure leveraging Data Factory/Synapse for our People Technology Projects. The role would primarily focus on conducting data analysis, developing/supporting high performance data ingestion pipelines, data modelling, dashboarding and collaborating with business teams to create scalable solutions as per business requirements.What you will do:Design, test and implement high performance data ingestion pipelines from multiple sources using Data Factory, DatabricksCollaborate with architects and business/data science teams to create scalable Azure based solutions as per business requirements. Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency, and workload management. Develop data models and schemas in our data warehouse that enable performant, intuitive analysis. Provide expertise and leadership regarding cloud Architecture for infrastructure in Microsoft Azure. Recommend best practice methods for improvement and optimization of current infrastructure. Create specification documents for designs, testing and support processes. Analyze business requirements and prepare development project schedule, tasks, and estimates. Collaborate with project team members to identify issues and risks associated with the design, implementation, and delivery of project assignments. What you will need:Strong IT professional with 4 – 7 years of experience in software development for data engineering using Python, Azure/ GCP / AWS. The candidate should have strong problem-solving skills along with high on ownership and accountability. Must have:4 years of experience in Solution, Design and Development of Cloud based data models, ETL Pipelines and infrastructure for reporting, analytics, and data science. Experience working with and creating databases and Power BI dashboards using all relevant data to inform decisions. Experience working with both structured and unstructured data. Strong understanding of OOPS, Design principles and Distributed systems and experience of Data Structures and algorithmsExperience working in different programming languages (Java, python, scala) and version control tools (Git, Subversion)Experience working with Spark/ Hive/HDFS Experience using automated build systems (CI/CD)Good to have:Knowledge of different database technologies (Relational, NoSQL, Graph, Document, Key-Value, Time Series, etc…). This should include building and managing scalable data modelsKnowledge of TDD/BDD Experience working with different flavors of SQL and relative database systemsExperience in DevOps is good to haveWho you are:Graduate/Post graduate inExcellent communication and prioritization skills. Able to work independently or within a team proactively in a fast-paced AGILE-SCRUM environment. Owns success – Takes responsibility for successful delivery of the solutions. Strong desire to improve upon their skills in software development, frameworks, and Don’t meet every single requirement? We encourage you to apply anyway. You might just be the right candidate for this, or other roles.What you’ll get:Competitive Compensation Packages23 days annual holiday, and additional days off for your birthday, 24th & 31st of December. Private Medical and Dental Care. Life and Disability Insurance. Public Transport Subsidy. Ticket Restaurant Card. Childcare Vouchers (Ticket Guarderia). IncentiFit - annual reimbursement for health-and-wellness-related activities. Spanish lessons. Pension Scheme. Tuition Reimbursement. Employee Stock Purchase Plan. Employee Assistance Program. Gartner Gives Charity Match. Relocation Assistance - a specialist to help you with all the appointments and paperwork. Please Note:Applications must be submitted in English. A valid EU visa/passport is required for this position. #Technology#HybridWho are we?At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE: IT), we deliver actionable, objective insight that drives smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization’s mission-critical priorities. We’ve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have over 19,500 associates globally that support over 15,000 client enterprises in more than 100 countries.What makes Gartner a great place to work?Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations. We believe that a diversity of experiences makes us stronger—as individuals, as communities and as an organization. That’s why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year. We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index. Looking for a place to turn your big ideas into reality? Join What we offer:Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1. When you join our team, you’ll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well. These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities. Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you.The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.Job Requisition ID:72859By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policyFor efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

title: Analytics Engineer
description: What are you going to do?Are you ready for a data challenge? Enza Zaden is currently on a mission to be the most data savvy and data driven breeding company in the world and therefore we’re looking for you, an Analytical Engineer. You will be responsible for building and maintaining data models and helping the data consumers to create value with data.Inside Enza Zaden, we are working with the Azure stack, so it’s important that you are know you’re way around with the Azure services. You will design, develop, build, test and maintain a stable analytical data platform and data products that reside on the Enza zaden data platform (e.g., data models, common dimensions, reports and dashboards). Your challenge is to standardize and automate data service and products as much as possible. This we do at Enza with an Agile mindset and approach.Furthermore, you will continuously improve the analytical data services to guarantee the optimal usage of the platform (e.g., data reliability, efficiency and quality) and make sure the products stay future proof (life cycle management). Next to that, you’re monitoring and reporting the usage and costs of the analytical data products. In close contact with other analytical engineers within Enza you make sure the analytical data products applies to security (e.g., user and data access management) and design rules of Enza Zaden together with the architecture department.Moreover, you are communicatively strong to give support and advice to the data consumer about the optimal usage of the analytical data products and possibilities. You define, communicate and support best analytical & reporting best practices across Enza Zaden. As analytics engineer you communicate with the Data, Reporting and Analytics Teams and other stakeholders to meet the business requirements that you translate to a solid solution. Finally you like to share, educate and inform other data professionals and stakeholders about the data platform, data services and available tooling.In this role you will work closely in an agile environment with our Data, Analytics & Reporting (DAR) managers and DAR/ SDP Data & Platform team members. Together you will share knowledge, best practise and ensure all requirements are aligned.Sometimes you will work together with external partners to possibly review and asses external vendors with solutions that are relevant to the assigned domain and of course to ensure keeping up to date with trends and developments.Your powerIn our professional team full with passionate engineers we are looking for an Analytics [MB1] Engineer who has multiple years’ experience with data modelling and data transformation. You know how to build and manage reports and dashboards too. You also now how to communicate well with stakeholders to translate their requirements to actionable pieces of work.To Meet The Job Requirements, Youhave a minimum of 3 years of relevant working experience with data modelling and transformationexperience with managing Business Intelligence environments and know how to use the software and develop best practices like versioning, testing and continuous deployment.team focused approachproficient in English and Netherlands, both written and verbalare currently living in the Netherlands. Working from home is possible, but we expected you to work at Enza Zaden office in Enkhuizen for at least two days per weekTechnologiesMicrosoft Certified: Azure Fundamentals (AZ-900)Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Fundamentals (DP-900)Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate (DP-203)SQLDatabricksData Build ToolData VisualisationDAXGitOur powerEnza Zaden is a vegetable breeding company that develops vegetable varieties. And produces and sells its seeds all over the world. We have made an animation to explain to you properly (and as briefly as possible) what we do.The purpose of our work? To offer everyone worldwide access to healthy and varied vegetables. With more than 2500 passionate colleagues all over the world, we work together every day on the vegetables of tomorrow.Would you like to know more about Enza Zaden as an employer? Then take a look at the Careers & Learning or visit our profile page on LinkedIn.ContactPlease, send your application to our Recruitment department, via the Apply now! button.More InformationSander Schoe, Recruiter, tel +31 6 2136 8907, s.schoe@enzazaden.nl

You know how to build and manage reports and dashboards too. You also know how to communicate well with stakeholders to translate their requirements to actionable pieces of work.To Meet The Job Requirements, You have a minimum of 3 years of relevant working experience with data modelling and transformation experience with managing Business Intelligence environments and know how to use the software and develop best practices like versioning, testing and continuous deployment. team focused approach love to brainstorm with your team and stakeholders on the ideal designs proficient in the English and Netherlands, both written and verbal are currently living in the Netherlands. Working from home is possible, but we expected you to work at Enza Zaden office in Enkhuizen for at least two days per weekTechnologies Microsoft Certified: Azure Fundamentals (AZ-900) Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Fundamentals (DP-900) Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate (DP-203) SQL Databricks DBT Power BI DAX GitOur powerEnza Zaden is a vegetable breeding company that develops vegetable varieties. And produces and sells its seeds all over the world. We have made an animation to explain to you properly (and as briefly as possible) what we do.The purpose of our work? To offer everyone worldwide access to healthy and varied vegetables. With more than 2500 passionate colleagues all over the world, we work together every day on the vegetables of tomorrow.Would you like to know more about Enza Zaden as an employer? Then take a look at the Careers & Learning or visit our profile page on LinkedIn.ContactNick van DijkCorporate Recruiter+31 6 1544 5587n.vandijk@enzazaden.nl

title: Data Engineer
description: Working at the heart of the energy transition and supporting the terminals to become a data-driven organization.is well underway to become a digital and data-driven organization. We are investing heavily in the data foundation as well as speeding up the utilization of data. For years, we have been standardizing our business processes across our terminal network, modernizing our application landscape, started governing and modelling our data, and implementing new cloud-based integration-, and data analytics platforms. More and more data is utilized in customer portals, data sharing platforms with partners in the logistic supply chain, and for advanced analytics & AI.In a brand new department within Global IT, the Data and Analytics Office, all data capabilities needed to support the data journey are centralized, ranging from Data Engineers & Data Scientists to Data Quality experts and Data Architects.As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for expanding and optimizing the preparation and delivery of our data towards our data consumers, including collection/ingestion and integration of data from various internal and external data sources, into the different data stores and systems optimized for reporting and analytics. Examples are our cloud-based data lake (AWS S3), enterprise data warehouse (Snowflake) and data virtualization & catalogue (data. world).Furthermore, we are in the process of implementing an ambitious data analytics architecture, where we are translating our business strategy and requirements to new data technologies.One of your first assignments will be the migration of our current data integration solution into a modernized data integration technology.We are looking for a (medior) Data Engineer to help us in our journey towards becoming a data-driven company.RequirementsAs a data engineer, you will:Develop and maintain data pipelinesManage our data lake for reporting purposesBuild collectors (Lambda, DMS, Spark or Glue) and processes in AirflowConfigure and manage tools like Cloudformation (CDK)Use support tooling such as Gitlab (CI/CD)Focus on the technical implementation of use cases and required tools on a new data platformBe involved in the data standards and initiatives that we have set for our customersIn this role, you have the autonomy to, together with your team, decide how to maintain the data lake as you want it. You will be working with a variety of use cases and different data sets and will be continuously working on maintaining and keeping the platform alive. The report that you will deliver have an impact: they are used for sales and forecasting reports and enable our colleagues to work efficiently. You will be taking on various cases, as well as finding answers to questions like these:How can we incrementally develop a data platform that enables the most optimal development of use cases?How can we most efficiently develop a use case on the data platform and incrementally enhance the data platform to accommodate new use cases from our colleagues and our organization?

title: Data analytics engineer Circular Economy | Utrecht
description: What will be your role?Data may be collected from a wide variety of public and commercial databases, literature and internet sources. The needed data sets will be specified, curated and constructed in close contact with the other colleagues who will be using these data, often in various modeling and evaluation projects. Processing, storage and visualization of the results of these evaluations may also be part of the activities.Together with the integral team of data and modeling experts this data will translate into mathematical models to make statements about the circularity of society, incl. products and processes, thus making a crucial contribution to the transition to a circular economy. These are socially relevant issues that TNO investigates in projects and consortia.We are looking for a data analytics engineer who has a keen interest in sustainability and circular economy, and has an interest in understanding the connection between the qualitative and quantitative world. Together with internal and external parties, you will shape the development and expansion of a database structure. This also means that part of your work involves writing high-quality project proposals and scientific articles with others and working closely together with scientists from the areas of circular plastics, microplastics, circular electronics and critical raw materials.What We Expect From YouEffective communication both internally and externally. With members of the project team, business consultants, and pioneers in the field at TNO. You are grounded and practical. What else do you have to offer? You hold a Msc or PhD degree in a relevant discipline, such as data science, physics, chemistry, statistics, computer science with relation to sustainability. You have proven experience with retrieving, harmonising, organising and storing large datasets. You can help to manage and set-up a data infrastructure for the data and modelling team. You are a proficient programmer, preferably in R and Python, with expertise in distributed (cloud-based) computation. Experience with agile working (Scrum & Gitlab) is a plus You have strong collaboration and networking skills and know how to connect people. You have excellent command of the English language, both spoken and written. Knowledge of the Dutch language is appreciated. What You'll Get In ReturnBesides offering a full time position (32-40 hours per week), TNO understands that every employee has different needs. TNO offers flexible terms of employment “a-la-carte”, in which you can exchange various terms of employment against each other on a monthly basis. With flexible working hours (e.g. 4x9 hours) and different leave arrangements you can create a package that serves your needs. TNO believes in the importance of both your personal and professional development. There are many possibilities to shape your own development Conferences, educations, workshops, intervision and mentoring. At TNO you are in the lead of your own career.Challenging and varied work with a real impact. And plenty of opportunities as, at TNO, you are in charge of shaping your career. We offer a gross monthly salary between € 3.124,- and € 5.522,34 (based on your knowledge and experience), 8% holiday pay, a 13th month bonus of 8.33% and a flex budget (5.58% + € 180). In addition, you will be given every opportunity to develop yourself.TNO offers optional employee benefits, enabling you to tailor your benefits package to match your personal situation. You may also expect A good pension scheme. A modern mobility policy including 100% public transport reimbursement for commuting and business travel using a Mobility Card. An extremely professional, innovative working environment where colleagues are leading experts in their field. 28 days annual leave and 5 compensation days under the reduction in working hours scheme (ATV, arbeidstijdverkorting) on a full-time basis. Great social events with your team and other TNO colleagues . That’s how you will get to know a lot of people really quickly. Flexible working hours and the possibility of working from home. The opportunity to attend courses, workshops and conferences, and to receive training and coaching based on your needs. Networking opportunities and great activities organized by Jong TNO . Extensive relocation package for international candidates. Read More About Tailoring Your Benefits Package.TNO as an employerAt TNO, we innovate for a healthier, safer and more sustainable life. And for a strong economy. Since 1932, we have been making knowledge and technology available for the common good. We find each other in wonder and ingenuity. We are driven to push boundaries. There is all the space and support for your talent and ambition. You work with people who will challenge you who inspire you and want to learn from you. Our state-of-the-art facilities are there to realize your vision. What you do at TNO matters impact makes the difference. Because with every innovation you contribute to tomorrow’s world. Read more about TNO as an employer .At TNO we encourage an inclusive work environment, where you can be yourself. Whatever your story and whatever unique qualities you bring to the table. It is by combining our unique strengths and perspectives that we are able to develop innovations that make a real difference in society. Want to know more? Read what steps we are taking in the area of diversity and inclusion .Within TNO, you will work in the Circularity & Sustainability Impact department. This is a versatile department with nearly 50 passionate researchers, consultants, and mathematical wizards in the field of life cycle assessments (LCA) and other impact methods. They have domain knowledge of the recycling and chemical industry and extensive knowledge of analyzing and predicting the impact of human actions on the climate and planetary boundaries. Additionally, this team helps policymakers in governments and decision-makers in companies in the transformation to a more sustainable and cleaner economy. The team you will be a part of is based in Utrecht but collaborates extensively with other teams (e.g., in The Hague, Amsterdam, Geleen and the Eindhoven region).The selection processPlease apply before December 4, 2023. The selection process comprises two interview rounds. The preliminary interview takes place on December 13, 2023. The second interview round has yet to be scheduled. In a final meeting we will discuss the terms of employment and your tailored benefits package. We aim to finalize the entire process within four weeks.The selection process may include an online assessment and a reference check.Has this job opening sparked your interest? Then we’d like to hear from you! Please contact us for more information about the job or the selection process. To apply, please upload your CV and covering letter using the ‘apply now’ button.

title: Junior Data Engineer – Young Engineering Professional Program
description: Interested in a job in IT and contributing to a better world? Discover your best self with the Young Engineering Professional Program.You and your futureDuring the Young Engineering Professional Program (also known as YEPP) at Rabobank you work on your career one day a week by following a technical track, or you work on your personal development. You develop talents you didn’t know you had and we are given the space to discover for yourself what you are good at and what you like. And then? Everything you learn in the training courses can immediately be put into practice, because the other 4 days you work in your starter position as a Junior Data Engineer. Under the guidance of experienced colleagues, you will become a specialist in your field in no time. In addition, in the program you will work together with the team on 2 business challenges on themes such as sustainable agriculture or the cooperative energy transition.In the Working Capital & Trade Finance area you will help Rabobank to become "The global F&A connector" in the integrated value chain. You will develop a platform where we can plot prospects and clients in the value chains and can directly see the peer analyses with the main competitors.
