title: Data Scientist, Den Haag
description: Als Data Scientist kom je te werken bij een overheidsinstantie die verantwoordelijk is voor het beleid en de uitvoering van diverse aspecten van de gezondheidszorg, sociale voorzieningen en sport. Het speelt een cruciale rol in het waarborgen van de gezondheid en het welzijn van de burgers en het bevorderen van een gezonde en actieve levensstijl.Betrouwbare informatievoorziening is essentieel in hun dienstverlening. Daar zet de Programmadirectie nafase COVID-19 zich sterk voor in. De Coronacrisis geeft extra druk en uitdaging op het organiseren van de informatievoorziening voor onder andere Woo-vragen en informatieverzoeken ten behoeve van onderzoek en verantwoording. Met behulp van data science en automatiseringstechnieken optimaliseren ze de keten van openbaarmaking van COVID-19 gerelateerde documenteren.Ter ondersteuning van team Data Science & Automatisering zijn ze op zoek naar een Data Scientist met aantoonbare ervaring met Python en machine learning of kunstmatige intelligentie. Als Data Scientist werk je in een gedreven en gezellig team van drie mede Data Scientist. Gezamenlijk ondersteun je teams binnen en buiten NC-19 door te helpen met optimaliseren en automatiseren van diverse processen binnen de openbaarmaking van COVID-19- gerelateerde documenten. Je gaat met name werken met Azure en Databricks. Inzichten worden bijvoorbeeld via Databricks of via geautomatiseerde Power BI dashboards zo helder mogelijk weergegeven en gedeeld binnen en buiten NC-19.StandplaatsDen Haag, op kantoor en gedeeltelijk hybride vanuit huis.SalarisSalarisindicatie van €3.000,- tot €4.500,- bruto per maand. Afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring.Wij zoekenJe bent in het bezit van een master in data science, kunstmatige intelligentie of vergelijkbare richting;Je hebt minimaal 3+ jaar werkervaring als Data Engineer (stage voldoet ook);Je hebt kennis van- en ervaring met Microsoft Azure, Databricks, Power BI, Python en bij voorkeur met PySpark;Je hebt ervaring met supervised learning en NLP;Je hebt uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.Wij bieden25 vakantiedagen op basis van een fulltime dienstverband;8% vakantiegeld;Pensioen;Progressieve bonusregeling;Status Pro Vitaal; waarbij je abonnement bij de sportschool of sportvereniging wordt vergoed ten tijde van het dienstverband.Als Data Scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor verschillende taken, waaronder het implementeren van ETL-processen die data van de bron tot de productielaag in het data-lake brengen om verdere analyse en dashboarding mogelijk te maken. Je voert ook ad hoc analyses uit om inzichten te genereren voor andere teams en om effectieve besluitvorming te ondersteunen. Daarnaast is het belangrijk dat je de gevonden inzichten en resultaten op een duidelijke manier communiceert, zowel intern als extern. Je zult onder andere Azure Web Apps inzetten om handmatige stappen in het proces te automatiseren en onderzoeken hoe kunstmatige intelligentie kan helpen om de werklast te verminderen. Je zult samen met het team snel en wendbaar moeten reageren op diverse vraagstukken, vaak met spoed en gepaard gaand met grote hoeveelheden te verwerken informatie.Reageer direct!Ben je enthousiast geworden over de functie Data Scientist? Graag ontvangen we je motivatiebrief en cv. Je kunt deze sturen naar via de button "Solliciteer nu" op deze pagina.. Voor meer informatie kun je bellen naar Masora Lilipaly, bereikbaar op 020-2117610.Functie-voorstelAls Data Scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor verschillende taken, waaronder het implementeren van ETL-processen die data van de bron tot de productielaag in het data-lake brengen om verdere analyse en dashboarding mogelijk te maken. title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: Over de organisatieDeze organisatie is gespecialiseerd in het oplossen van high-tech AI vraagstukken. Hierbij vertakken zij zich in het optimaliseren van automatiseringsprocessen in de logistieke sector, helpen ze bij het bouwen en verbeteren van fysieke robots in een productielijn, het efficiënter maken van de business en het reduceren van kosten en risico’s. Zo passen ze Computer Vision en Artificial Intelligence dagelijks toe om robots nog beter te laten werken voor hun klanten. Het is een internationale startup waarbij je voornamelijk in het Engels werkt. De opdrachtgevers en opdrachten komen allemaal vanuit een duurzame hoek zodat ook dit bedrijf zijn steentje bij kan dragen aan een betere toekomst.Je werkt vanuit een multidisciplinair team in een Agile werkomgeving, waarbij je samen grootschalige projecten aanpakt. De AI-Engineers zijn breed opgeleid en je hebt echt een passie voor Robotics en AI. Het bedrijf heeft twee vaste locaties in Delft en Eindhoven. Op de locaties werken 20 collega’s. Daarbij is er een prettige informele sfeer en voldoende ruimte om ook jou verder te kunnen helpen in jouw ontwikkeling.Binnen deze functie ben je vooral bezig met:- Het schrijven van algoritmes met voorkeur in Python;- Het bewerken en genereren van gestructureerde datasets;- Het implementeren van algoritmes in software van klanten;- Het valideren van software systemen voor de functionaliteit en prestatie;- Het identificeren van de behoeftes van klanten en hier Software modellen voor maken;- Up to date blijven met de nieuwste technieken van Machine Learning (je passie blijven volgen);- Sparren met collega’s om de AI-oplossingen te realiseren voor klanten.De functie-eisen:- Een hbo of universitaire opleiding zoals: Master/ bachelor AI, Computer Science, Technische Informatica, Mechatronica of een gelijkwaardige IT-opleiding- Je hebt hbo of universitair denkniveau;- Je hebt oog voor detail en kan zowel in teamverband als individueel werken.- Tools om professioneel te kunnen werken ((Python, Java, C++, GO, Libraries als Scikit, Tensorflow, Pytorch, Caffe, Machine Learning en Keras. Pré wanneer je ervaring hebt met Reinforcement Learning;- Duurzaamheid staat bij jou hoog in het vaandel.- Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift.Wat we bieden:- Salarisrange 3050 – 5500;- Werkweek tussen de 32 – 40 uur met flexibele werktijden;- 8% vakantiegeld;- 25 vakantiedagen (2 dagen betaald verlof erbij als je vrijwilligerswerk doet voor een goed doel);- Hybride werken is mogelijk;- Extra winstuitkering op maat over een behaald project;- Reiskostenvergoeding of OV van de zaak- Gemiddeld Leasebudget van €750, loopt uiteen met junior, medior en senior;- Netto onkosten bij aanvraag;- Bring your own device €20 per maand telefoon, bij eigen computer €200 per maand;- Trainingsbudget gemiddeld €1000 van externe coach;- Veel ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling en begeleiding intern.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description: Hey there! 👋Are you an ambitious Senior Machine Learning engineer? Do you want to use your data science and engineering skills to help fast-growing tech scale-ups by means of ML? Furthermore, are you ready for the adventure of expanding Enjins together with our ambitious team? Then keep reading!Why? 🤔At Enjins we want to make Machine Learning solutions that are here to stay. Our mission is to become the go-to ML engineering company in the world of tech scale-ups. for both talent and customers.How? 🚀We are driven by impact, and so is our vision on Machine Learning. We don’t want a data scientists’ laptop to be a graveyard for brilliant models. That’s why we created an approach that allows us to actually implement Machine Learning that realises business value. This approach demands our ML engineers to stand out in engineering, data science and consulting skills.What? [You'll be doing] 👀As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll work within our growing Machine Learning team, comprising of 15 other equally amazing Machine Learning Engineers.In this role, there is plenty of room for your ideas. Our team is growing fast and we'll support your growth ambitions as much as possible. We're flexible, and as long as you're proactive and take responsibility for your own work, we'll be a great match!Some of the responsibilities [but not limited to;]You become a full member of our fast-growing ML Engineering teamYou’ll work in small teams on ML projects for innovative Dutch & foreign clients (industries from sharing economy clients to MedTech)You’ll develop and implement robust ML applications for these clientsYou’ll apply your data engineering, computer science and machine learning knowledge on projects and you work with the latest technologies such as Kubernetes, Airflow and KafkaYou’ll translate the the to business stakeholders and focus on the human aspects to increase the impact of our ML applicationsYou’ll manage a growing set of projectsTogether we will keep building our young company Enjins, in which you will play a more and more important role!Within 1 month you'll:Finish the Enjins ML Engineering onboarding program, in which you will understand how Enjins work, be trained in our approach and become a certified cloud practitioner in AWS/Azure or GCPStart your first customer project!Within 3 months you'll:Develop and implement robust ML applications for your client, working on building new solutions and ironing out any old integration problems. This way laying the foundation of your ML engineering skillsHad multiple feedback moments with your project team before and after client meetings, to help you to improve your consulting and project management skillsWithin 6 months you'll:You'll identify new tools / methods / processes that work bestHave helped in the interview process for additional ML Engineers to join Enjins’ growing teamHave helped your client move along rapidly - their velocity has increased significantlyRequirementsMinimum Qualifications:🚶‍♀️You have a relevant background with respect to Machine Learning Engineering and a minimum of 2 years of relevant working experienceYou are ambitious, pragmatic and proactive and you like to work in small teams for innovative clientsYou are not afraid to connect with our clients on board level (CTO, CFO, CIO, etc) to achieve maximum resultsYou know your way around Python, SQL and GitPreferred Qualifications: 🏃‍♀️You have experience with at least one cloud platform (AWS, Azure or GCP) and its data engineering componentsYou have experience with the world of containerization (Kubernetes & Docker), networking, ETL/ELT-tools and understand the basic concepts of MLOpsYou are a passionate engineer who loves discovering new programming languages, frameworks or cloud services. After all, our world is changing continuously!You are fluent in both Dutch and English and are eligible to work in the NetherlandsBenefitsWhat to expect from us: ⚡️We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:A young, close and ambitious team of ML engineersDiverse and challenging projects and clients in The Netherlands and Berlin, read more about it here!A dedicated training program to improve your technical skillsOther knowledge sharing sessions ranging from project discussions to (room for) learning on the job1-on-1 coach for your personal growth and developmentA brand-new office in the city center (Oudegracht) of Utrecht!And last but not least, lots of fun! We promise!Have we spiked your interest? 🌎Let’s have a talk! In the first meeting you talk directly to one of our Lead ML engineers, so ask everything you want to know. If you want to reach out to us before applying with any questions, drop us an email at work@enjins.com

title: Data Scientist
description: Join us and help us structure the global webDo you have strong analytical skills to break down complex problems and identify relevant data solutions? Are you open-minded, curious and comfortable working in a dynamic environment? Then this might be the position for you!What We DoEvery month, our advanced proprietary software indexes hundreds of millions of web pages and processes and structures this information into more than 200 relevant data fields, grouped into categories such as geolocation, e-commerce, marketing, technical aspects, hosting and much more. PayPal, GoDaddy, M Science, Dun & Bradstreet, Statistics Netherlands are just a few of the leading companies in the payment, financial, domain and brand protection industries that are using our data. And our data is also used by Governments and statistical offices for in-depth research and tracking and measuring the digital economy.What You'll DoWe gather a massive amount of data each month. Due to the wide breadth and complexity of our product, we perform continuous data quality analyses, and we help our customers understand our data. As part of the data science team, you’ll be responsible to ensure the data in our extensive database meets our high standards in accuracy, reliability, credibility and integrity. You will also be creating definitions that meet our standards for new data fields.Next to that, you’ll communicate highlights and shortcomings and create digestible, accurate and timely reports and impact analyses for both internal and external use. Furthermore, you will collaborate with multiple teams and present your findings internally with charts and graphs. As we’re building our own product, you’ll have freedom in doing research. Precision and quality are key at Dataprovider.com, and they are more important than speed and deadlines.Who You AreYou thrive in a fast-paced environment and nd have experience with collecting, transforming and analyzing data. In addition:Proven experience (preferably 3 years or more) with (big) data analytics;A good and proactive communicator;Solid statistical knowledge;Programming skills (ability to work with Python and Jupyter is a plus);Experience with databases (experience with Elasticsearch is a plus);Keen attention to detail and analytical mindset;You have legal rights to work in the Netherlands;You live in the vicinity of Groningen: this isn’t a remote job but we offer the flexibility to work from home some of the time.What We OfferThis is your chance to join a dynamic tech company where you’ll be part of a very ambitious and smart team on a mission to structure the global web. You’ll get all the benefits of working for an agile scale-up such as a relaxed work environment, the possibility to work from home part of the time, easy-going colleagues and freedom in your work.Additionally, We Offer YouA salary based on your skills and experience25 days of paid annual leave*A holiday allowanceA good pension insuranceAn annual budget of €1.200 to spend on professional or personal developmentThe best hardware of your choice: Apple or LinuxHybrid work model: a mix of working from home and in the officeA lounge room, an in-office pool table and a fully equipped canteenHealthy and delicious buffet breakfast, lunch and a filled refrigerator in the officeEverything you need to work from home: a screen, keyboard and mouse€78 budget for a lease bike including maintenance**A €50 internet reimbursement*A monthly Thuisbezorgd budget of €50 to enjoy a meal with your colleagues or family*A monthly sports budget of €40 to stay healthy and in shape: get a gym membership or buy a pair of new tennis shoes*A mobile phone and a monthly mobile phone subscription reimbursement of €35*A compensation fee of €2 per day when you work from homeFun events with colleagues: 4 Mijl van Groningen, Startup Weekend Groningen, Thursday Drinks, Board Game Nights, Pub Quizzes, Pizza Knowledge Sessions, Ping-Pong Tournaments and our memorable Dataprovider.com OutingsRefer a friend for one of our jobs and get a nice bonus Based on a 40-hour contract ** Additional conditions applyDataprovider.com transforms the internet into an ever-growing structured databaseThe web is the world’s greatest information source - literally and figuratively. It contains more valuable information than all annual reports and trend analyses rolled into one. However, the web is also the world’s greatest source of information chaos: that’s why it’s difficult to extract qualitative data.Founded in Groningen in 2012, Dataprovider.com has been structuring relevant digital actions into concrete insights that are used worldwide by leading organizations such as PayPal, Statistics Netherlands, United Nations, GoDaddy, Mollie, Takeaway.com and the investment industry. We’re growing fast and we’re always on the lookout for new talent!Our teamOur team consists of a wide range of professionals: data scientists, data support engineers, developers, designers, account managers and the list goes on. Most of the people at Dataprovider.com have been working here for long: they started while they were students and have been an inseparable part of the team ever since. Our slogan is “Work hard, work together and help each other out, always.” When we aren’t working hard, we’re eating ice cream (anytime of the day or year) and playing board games, ping-pong or American pool.Join us and help us structure the global web If you have any questions about working at Dataprovider.com or about the selection process, don’t hesitate to contact our recruiter Elizabeth for more information.We’ll appreciate it if recruitment agencies don’t respond to this job opening.Our selection process Application If you’re interested in this job opening, click on the Apply button and send us your resume. Coffee If your application is successful, you’ll get invited to an initial meeting or a phone/video call with our recruiter Maaike. You can ask her anything you want to know about the job. Interview In the second interview you will show your knowledge and skills and meet some of the people in the team. Offer Congratulations! We’re making you an offer to join our team and help us structure the global web. Welcome! You’re signing a contract and meeting your colleagues: nice to meet you!

title: Data Scientist
description: At Peaks we're looking for a Data Scientist to join our team.Do you love to analyse data and create valuable insights? Do you love saving and investing? Do you love to work in a fast-paced ambitious international scale-up? Well then, please, keep reading. There’s a big chance you and Peaks are a perfect match! Let us introduce ourselves first.About PeaksWe’re Peaks, a fast growing, innovative Dutch fintech scale-up on a mission to help 1 million Europeans build wealth with investing and feel better about their financial future.Since the launch of our app in November 2017 we have grown to one of the largest investment platforms in The Netherlands and Germany and serve more than 100.000 customers.We serve these customers with a team of 40 very ambitious talents. To help Peaks fulfil its mission and growth ambitions, we are looking for a (Marketing) Data Scientist.What You Will Be DoingAs our (Marketing) Data Scientist, you will look into our growth challenges from a data perspective and help to transform data into valuable insights for marketing, product and management, with a strong focus on improving our most important KPIs (customer acquisition retention, product use, customer satisfaction, referrals and revenues).You guide the team with your analysis and ensure they make the right decisions and help setting priorities.You build and maintain data dashboards and deliver reports to the finance team to track KPIs.You identify improvements and spot tracking issues on app and web across all our acquisition channels.You set-up and participate in projects that range from analysing our customer onboarding funnel for conversion improvements to analysing user behaviour (deposit- and withdrawal behaviour, the use of products, etc.).Own your product end-to-end from scoping them together with colleagues, to integrating it into the product with the engineering teams, and monitoring their results on an ongoing basis.You will be working in the marketing department and report to the head of marketing. Next to this, you will collaborate with the product and finance team.What You Will Need To ApplyMaster (MSc) degree in econometrics, quantitative finance, statistics or an equivalent degree.1-3 years work experience in data analysis; preferably in a B2C, scale-up environmentKnowledge and experience in implementing Analytics, Reporting and BI toolingKnowledge of unit growth metricsTechnical Expertise in Data Science: Proficiency in data mining, machine learning, and statistical analysis. Familiarity with programming languages like Python or R, and tools such as SQL, TensorFlow, or similar platforms.Experience with Large Datasets: Ability to work with and extract insights from large volumes of data. Experience with big data technologies and cloud computing platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure could be beneficial. You are eager to learn, you never settle with what you haveExceptional interpersonal and communication skills, both with engineers and business stakeholdersTeam player who thrives on helping and enabling others in a small, fast-paced teamLive in The Netherlands (Peaks is located in the heart of Amsterdam)What We Offer YouA good salary and participation in our employee stock participation planThe opportunity to develop yourself quickly within an ambitious and results driven fintech scale-upNo bureaucratic hassle: a flatter than flat organization and no-nonsense culture;An international environment with a great team of very talented peopleAn office in a prime location in the center of AmsterdamLots of social activities.Apply for the jobDo you want to join our team as our new Data scientist? Then we'd love to hear about you!

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: Senior Data Scientist @ client in AmsterdamCandidate NEEDS to live in the Netherlands at this moment.CONTRACTING JOB / NO REMOTE40 hours per weekStart: 02-01-2024End: 31-12-2024Possible extension: YesHybrid working (1x per week in office)Job descriptionWe have an exciting position for a Senior Data Scientist to join the Advanced Machine Learning Team which forms part of the GM-ship of Artificial Intelligence in the VP-ship of Computational Science and Digital Innovation in the company’s Projects and Technology organization. Our team works on developing Advanced Machine Learning solutions for various business problems across the company's lines of business, in particular gas and power trading, new energies and windfarm optimization.As a Senior Data Scientist, you will work across project teams providing high-level guidance and oversight, as well as stepping in hands-on when needed. As a senior member of the team, you will be responsible for ensuring that we apply best practices in research and development and deliver solutions that deliver value to the end-users. You will be working with the stakeholders and subject matter experts of the various businesses as well as external strategic partners, both commercial and academia. You will also contribute to further grow the capabilities and broaden the expertise in the team. On a day to day basis, you will work closely with the Principal AI Researcher of the team. This role provides an interface and liaises between the power trading business and the Advanced Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence team.You will:• Translate complex business problems into projects with clearly defined scope• Use innovative research to influence relevant products and partner teams across the company, and to have company and societal impact• Design, implement and deliver Advanced Machine Learning solutions to solve a wide variety of business problems• Mentor junior Data Scientists and guide them in project delivery• Provide subject matter expertise in Machine Learning• Build relationships with internal project stakeholders and external partners, both commercial and academia• Be a proactive communicator who is excited to share your work and present the insights and findings• Be articulate and compelling in describing your ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences and back up your message with visualizations• Stay current on state-of-the-art approaches and new Advanced Machine Learning techniquesRequirementsQualifications:• Master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science or Operations Research• PhD in relevant domain is an advantage• Candidates ideally have some prior work experience as a quant / energy trading analyst in the power markets, and / or experience with modeling and scheduling of batteries and renewables• Experience across the project life-cycle from ideation to delivery• Hands-on experience of building Machine Learning models in Python• Experience working in AzureML and / or AWS SageMaker is an advantage• Ability to work on complex problems and deliver business critical solutions• Track record of delivering on and leading projects• Excellent communications skills and experience working in agile teams• Track record of conference / journal publications is an advantagePlease do not hesitate in case you tick all the boxes!

title: Data Scientist
description: Your ImpactAs a Data Scientist at Ordina, you’ll dive into the world of Artificial Intelligence (AI). You’ll apply your skills to real scenarios and in different domains, such as the discovery and investigation of payment flows at governmental entities, fraud detection at banks, the development of recommendation systems in the retail sector, and the optimization of supply chains.We are active in themes such as Natural Language Processing (NLP), Computer Vision, Machine Learning Operations (MLOps), AIOps and Explanable A.I. (XAI). You’ll carry out development and implementation of solutions with Machine Learning & Deep Learning at our clients and assess the quality and performance of existing predictive models through to bringing and keeping them into production.Where you're going to get startedWe create sustainable value for our clients through data within our Data area. We help companies stay agile while in transition by making data and technology part of both daily operations and strategic decision-making. We use data to help our clients stay ahead of change. Our ambition is to help organizations excel with data.The area consists of five practices: Data Governance and Data Management, Data Visualization, Data Science and AI, Data Engineering and Data Migrations, and Spatial Intelligence. Each with a distinct focus on content and the right solution. Over 170 professionals work in a content practice that is a logical fit for them.We believe in the power of multidisciplinary teams. Your expertise, personal ambitions and customer requirements are the basis for the composition of our High Performance Teams. You’ll become an indispensable link in a team of professionals so together you can all bring out the best in each other. Everyone contributes from their own expertise and technology so we all keep learning from each other and no one is ever alone.This is you Master's degree or the equivalent in experience in a Data Science field as a Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps, or Software Engineer Experience in some of the following Data Science techniques:supervised and unsupervised learning algorithmsdeep learninganomaly detectionrecommender systemsnatural language processingcomputer vision and reinforcement learningautoencoders, transformers, forecasting Experience in one of the following languages:PythonRExperience in bringing Data Science solutions/software to production (Azure, AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, Docker, etc.)Experience in building and implementing advanced analytics solutions and you can provide some reference casesIn-depth knowledge of open-source software and libraries in Python and/or R for machine and deep learningExperience in big data and platforms such as Azure Machine Learning Services and Amazon SageMaker is an advantageGood command of the Dutch languageBenefitsPart of our Data community with passionate and experienced peers;focus on working with one of our High Performance Teams (HPT) at renowned clients;you work in a high-tech environment with a focus on knowledge and innovation, an open no-nonsense corporate culture with room for own initiative;working with less travel time; remote & flexible;an environment where entrepreneurship and own initiative are encouraged;a culture where collegiality, knowledge sharing and collaboration are key;a pension plan, to which you are not required to contribute;20 statutory days off and 7 additional days off via flex benefits;adapt your terms of employment to your personal wishes with flex benefitschoice between a company car or a mobility scheme;Everyone is welcome to apply. Because we believe in the power of diversity and value inclusion. After all, the best ideas and smartest solutions arise in diverse teams. That is exactly why we pay so much attention to the composition of our high performance teams. So that you feel at home and can get the best out of yourself.

title: Data Scientist (Spark Optimization)
description: Data Scientist (Spark Optimization) As a preferred supplier to one of our biggest Financial Client, I am seeking for a Data Scientist for a position in Utrecht, Netherlands. The successful candidate will be responsible for the following:Build functionality into our data model (TDM) while continuing to combine all (30+) data sources required for Transaction Monitoring in an computationally efficient way. Our sources contain event data [e.g., transaction data and logging data from sources like CNA, AZS, PEX, RASS] and enrichment data (e.g., customer data and cash data from sources like Siebel, Omnikassa, Geldmaat, VCM)]Ensure model component design enables the company to comply with all regulatory, audit and other internal requirementsSet-up the model components to function as solid building block that can function on its own, and can be leveraged by other (KYC/TM) projects as wellEnsure the computational performance of the Transaction Monitoring solution is sufficient for daily batch scoring and for one-off runs on multiple years of data (using (Py) Spark)Core Requirement: Academic degree (MSc / Phd) in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics or a related field (required)Software development skills such as Git, bash scripting and release management and proven success in bringing analytics models to production (required)A minimum of 5 years of experience in advanced analytics / modelling / artificial intelligence activities working with large data sets (required)Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English (required)Highly skilled in working with Python, PySpark and Spark (required)Contract: 12+ monthRates: ExcellentLocation: UtrechtInterview: 2 stagesNick ChinweerapuntAccount ManagerGazelle Global ConsultingTel +31 85 111 0171Tel +44 203 588 7747Mob +44 7377 403 773nick@gazellegc.com

title: Machine Learning Graduate
description: Wil jij de theorie van machine learning in de praktijk toepassen? Tijdens deze opdracht bij Zonneplan krijg je de kans om daadwerkelijk het verschil te maken voor de organisatie. Jij gaat aan de slag met ons geavanceerde dak inmeetsysteem waarmee wij binnen 1 minuut een volledig dakplan kunnen maken. Met meer dan 100.000 klanten hebben wij een gigantische database opgebouwd met informatie en data over de daken in Nederland. Deze dataset bestaat nu uit meer dan 40.000 dakplannen. Deze gegevens zijn van onschatbare waarde en we zoeken een ambitieuze stagiair om ons te helpen ze nog verder te benutten. Hiermee maak jij meteen impact op onze werkwijze en ons systeem!Wat wij doenOp het gebied van zonnepanelen zijn wij de absolute nummer 1 van Nederland: op meer dan 120.000 huishoudens liggen zonnepanelen van Zonneplan. In 2020 was het tijd voor de volgende stap; Zonneplan Energie. Een energiecontract met dynamische uurprijzen. Dit is nog maar het begin van de energietransitie, want in 2022 hebben wij onze eigen laadpaal ontwikkeld. We werken hard aan nieuwe, baanbrekende energieproducten om Nederland nog meer te laten profiteren van de energietransitie. Zo zijn we op dit moment bezig met de ontwikkeling van onze thuisbatterij.Daarnaast zijn wij uitgeroepen tot stagebedrijf van 2023 door Studentenbureau! Wil je daar meer over weten? Check dan onze blog.Team DevelopmentWe werken in het development team met veel specialisten. Samen met je 21 collega’s (software: en hardware developers, product owners, softwarearchitect, systeem: en data engineers) bevraag je graag de business en werk je aan de beste oplossing. We werken agile in sprints van 2 weken. Iedereen is intensief bezig met elkaars code, niet om te controleren, maar om elkaar beter te maken. Benieuwd naar de tech:stack?Backend oplossingen en API’s ontwikkelen we vooral in Laravel (PHP) en Node.js (Typescript);Frontend oplossingen ontwikkelen we vooral in React; Native mobiele oplossingen zoals de Zonneplan App en de app voor onze monteurs worden gebouwd in React Native; Alle servers hebben wij in eigen beheer via Amazon Web Services. Onze productie: en development omgeving lopen synchroon via Ansible; Voor oplossingen op het gebied van data gebruiken we vaak Python; Daarnaast werken we projectmatig door middel van Scrum. Jouw opdrachtIn deze stageopdracht breid je het dakplansysteem Foton uit om zoveel mogelijk relevante gegevens te verzamelen. Je houdt je niet bezig met het handmatig tekenen van bounding boxes, maar eerder met het omgekeerd ontwerpen van de exacte posities van objecten die al zijn ingetekend. Met deze gegevens creëer je een machine learning model dat automatisch objecten op het dak kan herkennen, zoals luchtpijpjes, dakramen, dakkapellen en airco units. Als laatste integreer je dit model met Foton, waardoor de tool de objecten automatisch kan in tekenen. Doordat de daken automatisch worden herkend, kan een adviseur nog sneller en efficiënter aan de slag met een dakplan.Volgens de query die we recent gedraaid hebben, zijn er op dit moment 40,812 dakplannen met Foton opgesteld. In onderstaand screenshot van Foton is te zien hoe het werk. Links onderin heeft de adviseur (of in dit geval de developer, het is geen briljant plan) punten geplaatst op het 3D model van het huis. Deze punten worden omgerekend naar de locatie op de obliekfoto (links bovenin) en naar de locatie in het dakplan (rechts). Aan de hand van deze punten geplaatste punten kan de adviseur handmatig de schoorsteen intekenen. De truc die je dus eerst uitvoert, is het terugrekenen van de geplaatste pijpjes in die 40.000+ dakplannen naar bounding boxes op de foto. Dit kan je op dezelfde manier doen als we momenteel met de panelen doen. De panelen die de adviseur intekent in het dakplan worden eerst teruggerekend naar 3D en daarna getransformeerd naar de juiste plek in 2D op de foto.Zodra het machine learning model af is, doen we hetzelfde trucje weer andersom. We herkennen iets op de foto en plaatsen het terug in de dakplantool. Het herkennen van obstakels is de eerste stap richting geautomatiseerde plannen klaarzetten!Over jou:Jij doet een bachelor of master Computer Science, AI of iets in de richting;Sterke programmeervaardigheden, vooral in Python;Ervaring met Machine Learning en objectherkenning is een pluspunt, maar niet verplicht;De Nederlandse taal ben je vaardig om in te werken;Proactieve en autonome werkhouding, met de mogelijkheid om complexe problemen zelfstandig op te lossen;Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en de bereidheid om in teamverband te werken;Wij bieden jouEen stagevergoeding van €450,00 per maand;Kom je met het openbaar vervoer? Dan krijg je een fiets van ons, zo kan je makkelijk van het station naar kantoor fietsen;Ruimte om bezig te gaan met je onderzoek;Gezelligheid op de werkvloer, met onze vrijdagmiddagborrels en leuke evenementen;Begeleiding door ervaren Development en Data collega’s waar je veel van kan leren;Een stage bij één van de snelst groeiende bedrijven van Nederland, en misschien kan je na je stage of studie wel blijven. Veel van onze stagiaires blijven plakken voor een bijbaan of zelfs hun eerste baan!Heb je nog vragen over deze opdracht? Stel ze aan Arend:Jan via 088 020 3012 of arendjan.noordam@zonneplan.nl

title: Data scientist
description: Data ScientistAls Data Scientist bij Zonneplan maak je echt impact op de energietransitie! We bevinden ons in een tijd waar de energiewereld in beweging is en moet zijn. Terwijl de energiebehoeften verschuiven, ben jij degene die met innovatieve oplossingen komt. Door gebruik te maken van de nieuwste data:analysetechnieken en slimme algoritmen, help je ons de energie van de toekomst te begrijpen en te optimaliseren. Wij hebben zelf al meer dan 150.000 IoT devices online staan in slimme meters, laadpalen en zonnepanelen, deze zijn elk moment uit te lezen. Deze data bricks verander je om naar waardevolle inzichten en goede modellen. Samen zorgen we ervoor dat onze klanten niet alleen energie besparen, maar ook bijdragen aan een duurzamere wereld!Over ZonneplanZonneplan, opgericht in 2012, is een pionier in de integratie van IT en data binnen de energiemarkt. Samen met meer dan 260 toegewijde collega's streven we dagelijks naar het versnellen van de energietransitie. We begonnen met het efficiënt inmeten van daken met behulp van satellietbeelden en het geven van nauwkeurige verbruiksvoorspellingen voor zonnepanelen. Maar door de introductie van zonnepanelen ontstond een nieuwe uitdaging: het gelijkmatig verdelen van energie over het netwerk. Daarom hebben we ons ontwikkeld tot een energiebedrijf met dynamische energieprijzen en hebben we onze assets aanstuurbaar gemaakt. Met onze controleerbare en aanstuurbare assets optimaliseren we het energieverbruik om echt voordeel te genereren voor de consument.Jouw rolIn ons team van data werk je aan het Zonneplan Smart Power Platform. Ons doel is het digitaliseren van de energiemarkt en dat realiseren we. Jij zorgt met jouw data:modellen voor real:time inzichten in energiehandel. Jouw voorspellingen sturen aan wanneer onze energiebronnen moeten worden ingeschakeld of uitgeschakeld.Je houdt je bezig met:Het optimaliseren van energievoorspellingsmodellen;Zonnepaneel output voorspellingen gebaseerd op weersdata;Prijselasticiteitsmodellen voor energieklanten;Optimaliseren van inkoop energie op de verschillende markten;Optimalisatie van energiebronnen zoals zonnepanelen, batterijen en laadpalen;Zelfs modellen maken om de ideale planningssystemen te hebben voor onze monteurs en logistiek;Prijspredicatie voor diverse energiemarkten en arbitragemogelijkheden onderzoeken.Wat verwachten we van jou?Expertise in data:analyse en machine learning modellen;Een WO:opleiding in data science, econometrie of vergelijkbaar;Ervaring met Python en SQL;Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden en teamspeler;Kennis van de energiemarkt is een pré;Proactieve houding en daadkrachtig;Vloeiende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.Wat biedt Zonneplan jou?Werken bij Zonneplan betekent deel uitmaken van een IT: en data:gedreven organisatie met een focus op de klant en een passie voor duurzame ontwikkelingen. We dagen onze mensen uit om net dat stapje extra te zetten. We zijn innovatief waar mogelijk en altijd persoonlijk. Voor jou betekent dit:Een competitief salaris, afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring;Je werkt samen met 260 professionele collega's die de energietransitie willen versnellen;Duurzaamheidskorting op onze producten voor jou en je familie;Je draagt dagelijks bij aan een echte duurzame energietransitie;Jouw producten hebben direct impact op grote schaal;Er zijn geen grenzen aan wat mogelijk is; onze focus ligt echt op het beste product;We ontwikkelen alles intern, wat zorgt voor korte communicatielijnen, snelle besluitvorming en de mogelijkheid om ad hoc te kunnen werken;We zijn eerlijk, vriendelijk, informeel en loyaal naar elkaar en de organisatie;Reiskostenvergoeding; reis je met het OV? Dan krijg je van ons jouw traject vergoed en een échte Zonneplan fiets. Reis je liever met de auto? Dan krijg je een kilometervergoeding;Geweldige collega's en sociale evenementen met het hele bedrijf, zoals vrijdagmiddagborrels en speciale evenementen.Voor verdere informatie of vragen betreffende de vacature voor Data Scientist, gelieve contact op te nemen met Arend:Jan via 088 020 3012 of Arendjan.noordam@zonneplan.nl. We zien uit naar uw sollicitatie.

title: Data Scientist
description: Spektrum have a wide range of exciting opportunities in several global locations.We are always looking to add great new talent to our team and look forward to hearing from you.Spektrum supports apex purchasers (NATO, UN, EU and National Government and Defence) and their Tier 1 supplier ecosystem with a wide range of specialist services. We provide our clients with professional services, specialised aerospace and defence sales, delivery, and operational subject matter expertise. We are looking for personnel to join our team and support key client projects.Who We Are SupportingThe NATO Communication and Information Agency (NCIA) is responsible for providing secure and effective communications and information technology (IT) services to NATO's member countries and its partners. The agency was established in 2012 and is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium.The NCIA provides a wide range of services, including:Cyber Security: The NCIA provides advanced cybersecurity solutions to protect NATO's communication networks and information systems against cyber threats.Command and Control Systems: The NCIA develops and maintains the systems used by NATO's military commanders to plan and execute operations.Satellite Communications: The NCIA provides satellite communications services to enable secure and reliable communications between NATO forces.Electronic Warfare: The NCIA provides electronic warfare services to support NATO's mission to detect, deny, and defeat threats to its communication networks.Information Management: The NCIA manages NATO's information technology infrastructure, including its databases, applications, and servers.Overall, the NCIA plays a critical role in ensuring the security and effectiveness of NATO's communication and information technology capabilities.The program Assistance and Advisory Service (AAS)The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency) is NATO’s principal C3 capability deliverer and CIS service provider. It provides, maintains and defends the NATO enterprise-wide information technology infrastructure to enable Allies to consult together under Article IV, and, when required, stand together in the face of attack under Article V.In order to provide these critical services, in the modern evolving dynamic environment the NCI Agency needs to build and maintain high performance engaged workforce. The NCI Agency workforce strategically consists of three major categorises: NATO International Civilians (NIC)s, Military (Mil) and Interim Workforce Consultants (IWC)s. The IWCs are a critical part of the overall NCI Agency workforce and make up approximately 15 percent of the total workforce.Role Duties And ResponsibilitiesUnder the direction of the Section Head, they will perform duties such as:Applies existing data science techniques to new problems and datasets using specialised programming techniques to meet needs of the Agency and its customers;Selects from existing data sources and prepares data to be used by data science models;Evaluates the outcomes and performance of data science models. Identifies and implements opportunities to train and improve models and the data they use;Publishes and reports on machine learning model outputs to meet customer needs and conforming to agreed standards;Supports review of data science and AI activities, processes, products or services;Support development and maintenance of data pipelines for structured and unstructured data;Support maintenance of the Agency's data lakes, implementing updates and working with system owners to ensure data is available for analysis;Contribute to machine learning initiative across the Business Area with suggestions for ML approaches and implementation, including the processing of training data and performance assessment of machine learning techniques on datasets;Contribute to new/modifications to data science toolsets and metrics;Remain up-to-date with new developments in data science and AI to bring innovative ideas into implementation;Deputize for higher grade staff, if required;Perform other duties as may be required.Professional Contacts:They are responsible for:Active engagement with colleagues across the Agency;Supporting engagement with stakeholders, including industry and academia.Essential Skills And ExperienceUse of data science tools to support data analytics and data visualisation;Experience involving supporting data focused operations in a technical organisation. Such experience should encompass at least 2 skills listed below:Experience of working within a Big Data ecosystem, with tools such as DataBricks, Spark etc;Planning, executing and maintaining data pipelines;Knowledge of Machine Learning, statistical and mathematical models and ability to effectively explain them to both technical and non-technical colleagues;Proven ability to effectively communicate orally and in writingEducationA minimum requirement of a Bachelor's degree at a nationally recognised/certified University in a relevant discipline (such as; Data Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science or Engineering) with 3 years of post-related experience;Desirable Experience and Education:A Master's degree or higher at a nationally recognised/certified University in a relevant discipline (Data Science, AI engineering);Experience in data presentation tools e.g. Microsoft Power BI,Spotfire, Tableau; Kibana; Dash; Streamlit;Knowledge of DevOps best practices (git, Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery pipelines etc)Experience with Cloud ComputingCompetencies or Personal Attributes:Creating and Innovating –Produces new ideas, approaches, or insights; creates innovative products or designs; produces a range of solutions to problems.Achieving Personal Work Goals and Objectives –Accepts and tackles demanding goals with enthusiasm; works hard and puts in longer hours when it is necessary; seeks progression to roles of increased responsibility and influence; identifies own development needs and makes use of developmental or training opportunities.Delivering Results and Meeting Customer Expectations –Focuses on customer needs and satisfaction; sets high standards for quality and quantity; monitors and maintains quality and productivity;works in a systematic, methodical and orderly way; consistently achieves project goals.Language ProficiencyA thorough knowledge of one of the two NATO languages, both written and spoken, is essential and some knowledge of the other is desirable.Working LocationThe Hague, NetherlandsWorking PolicyOn-SiteTravelBusiness travel to NATO and national facilities as well as frequent travel between the NCIA offices;Contract DurationJan 2024 – Dec 2024Security ClearanceValid National or NATO Secret personal security clearanceWe never know what new opportunities might be just over the horizon. If this opportunity isn't for you please feel free to send us your resume anyway and be the first to know if something suitable for your skills and experience comes up.

title: Software Engineer in Machine Learning
description: Just as every tooth is unique and requires precision in its care, our AI solutions demand precision in their design and implementation. At Promaton, we're revolutionizing dental healthcare with AI, and we need your expertise. See our company page to learn more about what we do.As a Software Engineer in Machine Learning you will be working closely with our platform and product teams, enabling fast iterations and scalable ML solutions.As part of our dynamic team, you will be:Making our AI pipelines work smoothly by solving complex problems.Implementing MLOps best practices.Working with an accomplished team of machine learning researchers and engineers that already have 8 patents on their name.Helping researchers launch new products and help maintain products already used by customers. Some initiatives on our MLOps roadmap for the next months: Improving speed and robustness of multiple machine learning products Continuous monitoring of incoming data in productionThe challenges you’ll face:All our products process large data points, ranging from 5 up to 700MB. This means that a lot of off-the-shelve tooling doesn't work for us, and we need to invent our own to process and manage our data. We are a cloud-native company, and cloud-native ML frameworks are still in their early days. You'll help us navigate the ever evolving ecosystem of tools, to make sure we find the right balance between off-the-shelf and home-grown tooling. Medical AI has to comply with the highest quality standards. While in other industries failing to predict for example a recommended product has little consequence, in the medical field you really don't want to be wrong.The perks of working at Promaton:💰 Attractive salary package, and excellent employment terms🏡 Excellent work/life balance. Freedom to work from home or anywhere you like (and any time you like). We only have a few touchpoints👩‍🔬 Dedicated time for hackathons and growth, to explore new ideas of your own. Every quarter we have a hackathon week where you can work on anything you like to expand your skill set!🙌 Staying up to date with the latest happening in the ML field can be hard. That is why we organize monthly paper review sessions to discuss the latest developments in the field to stay up to date with the current state-of-the-art. Next to that we regularly hold “ML Sparring Sessions” where you can spar with other MLRs in the company on potential directions for projects you are working on.🎓 Real training budget for books and conferences or anything else you need to grow🚀 Work with the latest technology, at the forefront of a rapidly developing field in medical imaging AI💪 Loads of responsibility and autonomy (we hate micromanagement) and a chance to make a real impact🏖 Awesome yearly company retreat, and quarterly team events⛺️ 32 days of annual leave💻 Top-notch gear, and even bigger servers to play with🏄‍♂️ Promaton is funded for many years to come, meaning you can have the impact you only get at a startup, but with the job security of an established company🛬 For international engineers, based in the NL (already relocated to the Netherlands) we are able to offer visa sponsorship🎈Inclusive environment, we value and celebrate diversity3+ years experience working with PythonSolid understanding of software development best practices, including:proficiency in Git understanding system design conceptstesting Experience with AWS/GCP/Azure or Kubernetes deploymentA passion for growing and expanding your skillset Experience with iterations on live productsGood collaboration and communication skillsBonus points:Interest or experience in MLOps Experiment and data versioning Knowledge of machine learning fundamentals Experience working asynchronously with a distributed teamPrevious experience in medical or other regulated fieldWe're excited to see how you can make a difference in our team. If you're passionate about making a tangible impact in healthcare through AI, we'd love to hear from you!Good to know:It goes without saying that we love the power of AI, but we believe the human touch is irreplaceable in recruitment. We are looking forward to your personalized answers to our screening questions, not ChatGPT's insights!Wondering if you should you apply if your experience doesn't fit all of the job requirements? In general, we are aiming for an 80% match, so please go ahead if you got excited by the role and by the idea of joining our team! Not the right role? You can still send us an open application!Read our blog about How to be successful in our selection process for more tips and tricks!

title: Applied Scientist
description: The Impact You Will Make:As an Applied Scientist within our ADAS/ADS unit, you will be at the forefront of translating recent scientific advancements and cutting-edge technologies into real-world applications and products. Your impact will encompass: Collaborating closely with a multidisciplinary team of Engineers, Data Scientists, and Applied Scientists to transform scientific breakthroughs into Advanced AI software solutions. Utilizing your analytical skills to develop automated approaches that harness the full potential of data streams, optimizing the quality and efficiency of our mapping processes. Taking a leading role in designing and implementing advanced (AI-enabled) systems that leverage multisensory data and multimodality models, with a specialized focus on autonomous driving and real-time map generation. Applying deep learning methodologies and machine learning algorithms to develop pioneering systems that empower the capabilities of our real-time map creation. Adapting and fine-tuning deep learning and machine learning models for seamless deployment on low-power embedded devices, ensuring enhanced performance and operational efficiency. Driving transformative changes by taking ownership of your responsibilities, contributing to the elevation of team performance and successful project outcomes. Demonstrating adaptability through embracing iterative development methodologies and addressing evolving technical challenges head-on. Leading the initiation of new projects, positioning yourself as a key technical influencer within the unit and departments, and guiding strategic technology decisions. Balancing intricate technical decisions with their broader business and operational impacts, making well-informed trade-offs to effectively meet the company's overarching objectives. Crafting code and designing structures that promote collaborative teamwork and facilitate enhanced productivity and engagement among team members. Facilitating the resolution of contentious technical discussions by building consensus and showcasing your adeptness at leading through influence. What You Will Need:A PhD or MS degree in computer vision, machine learning, or a related field, complemented by multiple research publications in top AI conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, CVPR etc.) or journals, or equivalent industry experience solving intricate AD and Mapping challenges. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and/or C++, enabling the seamless development and implementation of your solutions. An in-depth understanding of sensor data processing and multimodal sensor fusion, especially in working with Cameras and LiDAR. Prior experience with GIS and RADAR is a plus. Extensive expertise in various computer vision approaches and deep learning methodologies including image / point cloud registration and structure from motion, 2D / 3D object detection and segmentation, self-supervised learning, active learning, uni-/multi-modal foundation models etc., allowing you to continually innovate and adapt in response to evolving ADAS technologies. Keep abreast of related literature and a documented history of successfully steering ML research projects from inception to completion, covering problem formulation, experimentation, iteration, and eventual publication or product integration. Effective communication skills, encompassing both written and verbal proficiency, to clearly articulate complex technical concepts and collaborate harmoniously within a diverse team. Familiarity with programming tools and deep learning frameworks, including Git, OpenCV, PyTorch/TensorFlow etc. Nice to have:Proficiency in map-related technologies such as SLAM, HD mapping, and geospatial data processing. Familiarity with Data Science and Machine Learning tools: Pandas, Scikit-learn, SciPy, NumPy, Databricks, Spark, MLFlow, Hyperoptetc. General software tools: Docker, Azure/AWS, GIS softwares like QGIS etc. What we offerA competitive compensation package, of course.Time and resources to grow and develop, including a personal development budget and paid leave for learning days, as well as paid access to e-learning resources such as O’Reilly and LinkedIn Learning.Time to support life outside of work, with enhanced parental leave plus paid leave to care for loved ones and volunteer in local communities.Work from home, the office, or even abroad – each team has the flexibility to choose how they work based on business needs.Improve your home office with a setup budget and get extra support with a monthly allowance.Enjoy options to work from your home country and abroad for a set number of days each year, to visit family and friends, or to simply explore the world we’re mapping.Take the holidays you want with a competitive holiday plan, plus an extra day off to celebrate your birthday.Join annual events like our Hackathon and DevDays to bring your ideas to life with talented teammates from around the world.Become a part of our inclusive global culture and have the chance to collaborate with a diverse community – we have over 80 nationalities at TomTom!Find out more about our global benefits and enjoy additional local benefits tailored to your location.Meet your teamWe're Product Unit Automation. We develop and operate map production systems for high-quality map data. This data goes on to power ADAS speed control, localization for L2+ robotics driving and more, helping TomTom on its mission to create the smartest, most useful map on the planet. In our team, you'll build data-oriented systems that leverage the freshest data through various sources, utilize machine learning techniques and improve themselves with quantitative and qualitative feedback.At TomTom...You’ll help people find their way in the world. In 2004, TomTom revolutionized how the world moves with the introduction of the first portable navigation device. Now, we intend to do it again by engineering the first-ever real-time map, the smartest and most useful map on the planet.Work with a team of 3,800+ unique, curious and passionate problem-solvers. Together, we’ll open up a world of possibilities for car manufacturers, enterprises and developers to help people understand and get closer to the world around them.After you applyOur recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout your journey with us, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews all the way through onboarding. To find out more about our application process, check out our hiring FAQs.TomTom is an equal opportunity employerTomTom is where you can find your place in the world. Every day we welcome, nurture and celebrate differences. Why? Because your uniqueness is what makes you, you. No matter your culture or background, you’ll find your impact at TomTom. Research also shows that sometimes women and underrepresented communities can be hesitant to apply for positions unless they believe they meet 100% of the criteria. If you can relate to this, please know that we’d love to hear from you.

title: Data Scientist
description: Voor een van de grootste bedrijven van Nederland, met een jaaromzet van meer dan € 8,1 miljard en meer dan 16.000 medewerkers wereldwijd, zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Scientist. Met enkele honderden vestigingen in 65 landen staat de organisatie midden in de samenleving en spelen in op trends als verstedelijking, elektrificatie, duurzaamheid en digitalisering. Daarnaast ondersteunen zij verschillende maatschappelijke initiatieven en nemen we actief deel aan maatschappelijke sponsoring. Een werkgever die werkt met topmerken, duurzaamheid actief omarmt en in jou investeert en mooie kansen biedt.Onlangs is de organisatie de trotse mede-eigenaar geworden van Europcar Mobility Group. Nu zijn zij op het moment aangekomen om deze overname verder uit te bouwen. Hiermee zet men een belangrijke stap voorwaarts om marktleider te worden in duurzame mobiliteit. Onze ambitie is om tev groeien tot een toonaangevend mobiliteitsplatform. Hierbij moet je denken aan een hoogwaardige, duurzame en innovatieve aanbieding van mobiliteit voor 1 minuut tot 24 maanden. Met dit initiatief kunnen we ervoor zorgen dat we centraal staan in de wereld van ‘’nieuwe mobiliteit”. Denk hierbij aan rental, car subscription en (car) sharing. Voor de vormgeving van de organisatie die hier aan bij moet gaan dragen, zijn wij het team aan het samenstellen.Data ScientistWij zoeken een Data Scientist die het als uitdaging ziet om het proces te ontwerpen en te realiseren waarmee we komen tot het optimaal verzamelen, integreren en analyseren van waardevolle data en informatie voor de rental business. Dit moet de nieuwe organisatie in staat stellen om optimale besluitvorming en digitalisering van processen te realiseren met behulp van Advanced Analytics. Dit doe je door jouw deskundige kennis en ervaring in te zetten en daarmee bij te dragen in het team van de Business Information Manager. Dit team is in ontwikkeling en zal zich vormen tot een team met een Data Scientist een Business Information Analyst en een Application manager.In dit team zorg je voor betrouwbare en bruikbare analyses die worden voorgelegd als waardevolle inzichten aan de gebruikers. Door het ontwikkelen van analytics tools voor eindgebruikers in de business maak je de informatie bruikbaar en verzorg je Data Science oplossingen (op basis van statistische modellen en/of algoritmes). Je levert een proactieve bijdrage in projecten om continue meer data driven te worden. Tevens ben je onderdeel van het netwerk bestaande uit verschillende data science functies binnen de organisatie.De Data Scientist bezit:Een afgeronde HBO/WO Business Analytics, Data Science, Econometrie en/of elk ander exacte wetenschap / STEM opleiding; Ruime ervaring (5+ jaar) als Data Science specialist; Uitstekende kennis van relevante software; Een visie op het gebruik van data science en ervaring met van fleet/yield management; Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse- en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift; Een initiatiefrijk karakter en zoekt naar nieuwe invalshoeken en andere mogelijkheden voor verbeteringen/oplossingen.

title: Data Scientist
description: Data ScientistDo you want to contribute to predicting conversion probabilities for a million households as a Data Scientist? If this speaks to you, you'll feel at home at the International Analytics Hub. And every day at work, you’ll be doing your part for all the charities we support. So it won’t be just your job that’ll inspire you – so will the impact you’ll be helping to make. Maurits van den Brand, Data Scientist: “Every day we aim to identify, discover and implement new possibilities based on data intelligence in order to keep on raising ever more funds for social organisations and causes across the world.” As a Data Scientist, you’ll:Build, maintain and automate statistical models while also developing machine learning solutions.Use data-driven reasoning to provide informed advice and make optimal decisions.Conduct comprehensive research to better understand current and potential customers.Collaborate with marketers, product owners and other stakeholders to design and assess research and experiments.Advise management and stakeholders on analysis results and strategic recommendations.You’d describe yourself as follows:Holder of a master's degree in econometrics, mathematics, business analytics or a related field with 3+ years working as a Data Scientist.Extensively experienced in building and maintaining statistical models and machine learning algorithms using SQL and Python.Knowledgeable about AWS and tools like SageMaker and Docker, and familiar with or eager to learn about MLOps processes.A skilled communicator and collaborator, adept at working in cross-functional teams.Proactive, with a penchant for innovation and strategic, creative thinking.About us: The Postcode Lottery Group is a marketing-driven international non-profit organisation. We operate lotteries to raise funds for a fairer, greener and healthier world. Our players win with their neighbours and generate money for charities together – it’s a win-win!We’ve raised more than €12.6 billion for thousands of good causes since 1989. We’re the third-largest private charitable donor in the world. Working alongside more than 1,500 fellow team members in Great Britain, the Netherlands, Sweden, Germany and Norway, you’ll be helping to build a better world every day!About the department: The Postcode Lottery Group is building an International Analytics Hub to provide our lotteries with the right models, tools, tech and best practices to help realise our growth ambitions. In the hub you’ll work with the business to identify value-adding business cases for advanced statistical analytics. You’ll work on exciting and challenging BI, data and AI projects that will create real impact for the lotteries and our beneficiary organisations.This will make you happy:A monthly salary between €4,800 and €6,500, a variable year-end bonus, an excellent pension scheme, and 28 days’ holiday a year based on a 40-hour week and flexible working hours.We believe it’s important that you’re able to keep developing professionally and personally, so we support ongoing training. The Lottery Academy offers a wide range of courses. And there are plenty of opportunities to grow within the organisation.You’ll work in our sustainable building within walking distance of Amsterdam Zuid station, and you'll get an NS Business Card, which lets you travel for free all over the Netherlands, even outside working hours!We like to celebrate our successes with our colleagues and charity partners at well-attended monthly drinks and parties.We know exercising and relaxing are good for you. So we offer free boot camp, Pilates and kickboxing classes, and some of our employees are training together for a half-marathon. And you’ll enjoy free entry to more than 145 museums, plus theatre and cinema discounts.You’ll receive your full salary (100%) during childbirth and parental leave.To help you get involved in our charity partners’ work, we offer project visits and talks in our on-site auditorium. You can also volunteer three days a year during working hours, potentially with colleagues.Join us:We believe an inclusive organisation is the ideal breeding ground for creativity, collaboration and innovation. Employee solidarity is important to us, too. Each of us has a part to play in that – we are the organisation, after all. We strive to make everyone feel at home. That means keeping an open mind and paying attention to each other’s welfare.Can you see yourself as part of the team? We encourage you to apply – whatever your roots, religion, age, ability to work or life philosophy.Send your CV and covering letter to our Recruitment Business Partner Maria-Christina Kool through werkendoejebij.nl. Do you want more information? She’ll be happy to help at +31 (0)6 57307901.Please note that this is a direct search led by the Recruitment team. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.

title: Data Science Specialist AI / Gen AI
description: Synechron is seeking an entrepreneurial Data Scientist that helps shape the AI and GenAI solutions for our clients. You have strong technical skills to engage with business data consumers and translate their needs into feasible solutions. You have strong communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams within Synechron around topics such as: Know Your Customer & AML, Sustainable Finance, Compliance etc. At Synechron your role will be to design and implement systems with in-built financial domain knowledge.If you are passionate about AI and eager to make a difference in the digital landscape of financial services, we invite you to join our team at Synechron.About SynechronSynechron is a leading consulting firm the specializes in digital transformation of financial services. . Synechron has a global workforce of 14,500+, and has 44 offices in 19 countries such as USA, India, Singapore, UK, France and Serbia. We provide services for world’s top banks and other financial services providers. Through research and development initiatives in our FinLabs we develop cutting-edge systems including blockchain and AI technologies. Over the last 20+ years, our company has been honored with multiple employer awards, recognizing our commitment to our talented teams. For more information on the company, please visit our website or LinkedIn community.In the Netherlands you will work alongside 150+ colleagues in the Amsterdam office, which is considered as a center for global excellence in business consulting. We are committed to delivering cutting-edge solutions to our clients by finding a good match between what is needed and what can be built. We solve complex business challenges through a combination of Business Consulting, Design, Cloud, Data, and Engineering, servicing an array of top Dutch banks. We embody the “work hard, play hard” spirit through social events organized through the year.Responsibilities:Collaborate with Synechron’s (international) practices to understand client requirements and identify (Gen)AI opportunities;Engage with clients to understand their data-related challenges and translate these to data-driven solutions;Analyze and/or clean data sets to make data ready for usage in data science solutions;Build and train AI models using various techniques, algorithms and frameworks;Deploy AI solutions and provide ongoing support to ensure optimal performance;Engage with learning techniques;• Experience with cloud platforms (especially Azure but also AWS, GCP etc.) and big data technologies (Databricks) is a plus;What we Offer You:Synechron offers a competitive salary and benefits package, a vibrant work environment, and the opportunity to be a part of a global team that is shaping the future of the digital world.• An office next to the Johan Cruijff Arena as well title: Senior Data Scientist
description: Incipias, a leading financial compliance firm, is offering an extraordinary opportunity for Data Scientists to join our dynamic team. This role is for one of our esteemed clients, a major player in the banking sector, committed to fighting financial crime.Role Overview:As a Data Scientist, you will play a crucial role in combating money laundering and terrorist financing. This is an opportunity to make a significant impact in society and within our organization. Your primary focus will be on optimizing our current Transaction Monitoring (TM) system, preparing it for future advancements such as the integration of Machine Learning techniques.Key Responsibilities:Optimize TM Systems: Enhance our TM system that processes millions of transactions daily. You'll ensure optimal performance within set computational limits.Data Model Building: Integrate functionality into our data model (TDM), combining over 30 data sources for efficient Transaction Monitoring.Compliance and Quality Assurance: Design model components to ensure compliance with regulatory, audit, and internal requirements.Performance Management: Guarantee computational performance for both daily batch scoring and extensive data runs, using tools like PySpark.The Ideal Candidate:Motivated by Impact: Focused on creating models that have real-world impact in detecting and preventing criminal activities.Structured and Precise: Brings a methodical approach, paying close attention to detail and excelling in a fast-paced, high-impact environment.Strong Communicator: Effective in collaboration, thriving in a diverse team setting.Proactive and Business-Oriented: Aims to make a difference in the field of financial crime prevention with a can-do attitude.Requirements:Advanced Degree: MSc/PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related field.Technical Expertise: Proficient in Python, PySpark, Spark, with experience in Git, bash scripting, and analytics model production.Professional Experience: At least 5 years in advanced analytics, modeling, or AI, dealing with large data sets.Communication Skills: Excellent proficiency in English, both verbal and written.Preferred:Azure Databricks Experience.Join Incipias and take part in an impactful journey to uphold financial integrity and combat financial crimes. If you are passionate about making a difference and possess the required skills, we encourage you to apply for this exciting Data Scientist role.Don't miss this chance to be part of a team that values your expertise and offers opportunities for professional growth!
