title: Power BI Developer / Engineer (HR)
description: At a glanceAre you passionate about working with HR data, do you have hands-on experience with data engineering techniques, and do you want to help us increase the happiness and effectiveness of our employees? Then we believe we have a great opportunity for you.We are looking for a Power BI Engineer to join our HR Analytics team. HR Analytics is a team of 14 professionals who support fact-based HR via dashboards, workforce planning, surveys and statistical (machine learning) analyses. Together with you we want to deliver high quality Power BI insights and bring our data management to a higher level, by migrating our local data model to ABN AMROs Azure platform (Databricks). We need the help of an experienced data solutions expert to support this migration, and help us develop new data pipelines on which we can re-build our statistical models and dashboards.Your jobWe are looking for a liaison person between the Power BI front-end developers and the IT data supplier. You are responsible for the monthly data runs in order to refresh all of our Power BI dashboards as well as the maintenance of the Power BI workspaces, data pipelines and data flows. In a short period of time you are able to obtain extensive knowledge of our large and complex data model to be able to make the necessary future changes to support production or to support new requirements.Additionally, you can help existing data engineers in refactoring our current local Python data pipelines onto Databricks by using PySpark and SQL, based on business requirements from the dashboard team and data science team.Your ability and willingness to work with others is crucial for your success in this role. You are naturally someone who takes initiative, structures and organises work well and is keen to work with others to deliver tangible results. You are practical, have an analytical approach and good communication skills. You are a strong team player and you take responsibility for your work. In the dynamic environment in which you operate, you have the ability to get all stakeholders on board.Working environmentYou will be working as a Power BI Engineer within the human resource domain in a dynamic, energetic team of professionals who all are critical thinkers and share the same passion: helping HR become more evidence-based. In this job, you focus on high-impact cases on top of our business agenda. You will join a team recognized inside and outside the bank as a front runner in people analytics. We are ambitious and learning every day. We offer an exciting and dynamic work environment with many opportunities for innovation. We provide personal development opportunities and encourage co-working on other HR analytics products like survey management, advanced analytics, organizational design, and strategic workforce planning.As a business data modeler you work closely with the HR Analytics and the IT department. You represent the business in the delivery and therefore hierarchically you report to the team lead of HR Analytics.Your profileYou are up to date with the latest developments in Power BI and data. The job requires excellent analytical skills and an eye for detail.You have an affinity with HRStrong analytic skills and affinity with Power BI development, data analytics, (pre)processing, and data handling;Experience in Power BI Platform, in particular: DAX, M/PowerQuery, Tabular Editor (c#), DAX Studio is a mustExpertise in Python, Notebooks and Pandas is a mustExpertise in Azure Databricks, Python, PySpark, SQL Experience handling structured and unstructured datasets (must)Experience in data modelling and Kimball methodology (must)Experience in stakeholder management / alignment with IT as data supplierExperience in migration of data backendsExperience with batch, streaming and APIExperience with data management, data governance, DQ, and meta dataPro-active attitude and an excellent team player. We are offeringWe are offering a role within a global leading people analytics team in a challenging environment. Additionally we offer you:The opportunity to develop yourself on hard as well as soft skills. A good work-life balanceThe opportunity to be the best you can be, work flexible hours and lots of room to grow both personally and professionallyA hybrid way of workingA salary based on your experience*A supplementary benefit budget of 11%, which you can spend on additional fringe benefitsA personal development budget of EUR 1.000 per yearAn annual public transportation pass A solid pension planInterested?If you find this vacancy interesting and it fits your expectations and qualifications, you can apply online. If you have questions, please contact jaap.veldkamp@nl.abnamro.com (Lead HR Analytics) or marc.henselmans@nl.abnamro.com (PO HR Reporting and surveys).Equal opportunities for allThe success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.Disclaimer external recruitment agenciesExternal recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.Wij vragen Een creatief brein Wij bieden Analytische skills

title: DATA ENGINEER ( SQL , UML, ETL, NL /EN )
description: You will create, maintain and support data pipelines; You will take care of the design and maintenance of data models, together with the team; You’ll architect data solutions and develop a roadmap for the data & analytics landscape; You will create and/or improve our reporting standards; You’ll provide the data analytics team the right tools and framework. To gather all necessary details and define requirements for the business, you will collaborate closely with data engineers, data scientist and report developers; You will be working cross departmental on various data driven projects and enable our business, together with the team to create value by using data; You will be working with on-premises as well as cloud-based data architecture and technology and help shaping this modern data landscape.You will create, maintain and support data pipelines;You will take care of the design and maintenance of data models, together with the team;You’ll architect data solutions and develop a roadmap for the data & analytics landscape;You will create and/or improve our reporting standards;You’ll provide the data analytics team the right tools and framework.To gather all necessary details and define requirements for the business, you will collaborate closely with data engineers, data scientist and report developers;You will be working cross departmental on various data driven projects and enable our business, together with the team to create value by using data;You will be working with on-premises as well as cloud-based data architecture and technology and help shaping this modern data landscape.You have a result-driven and hands-on mindset and prefer to work in an agile environment.You are a team player and good communicator.You have experience with SQL or other data-oriented development languages (Python, Scala, PySpark etc. .. ).You have experience with UML modelling and ER modellingYou are familiar with the concept of data pipelines and have some development experience on them.You have a master or bachelor‘s degree in the field of engineering or computer scienceYou like to iterate quickly and try out new thingsIdeally, you have experience with a wide variety of data tools & data like geospatial, time series, structured & unstructured, etc. ..Experience on Microsoft Azure is a plusExperience with machine learning and AI is a plusExperience with reporting tools is a plus (Grafana, Power bi, Tableau)Having a healthy appetite and open mind for new technologies is a plus

title: Senior Data Engineer
description: At TBAuctions, we use data as the guiding principle for our online auction platform. We aim to gain a deeper understanding of our key factors and evaluate the effects of modifications. We also strive to predict future trends and use this information to drive improvements and innovation. As a result, working at TBAuctions requires not only technical skills but also strong business acumen and the ability to communicate your ideas effectively.What you will doThe Data Engineer is responsible for building, implementing and supporting Microsoft BI solutions to meet our Data requirements. You will apply your knowledge of technologies, applications, methodologies, processes, and tools to support our online auctioning platform.You will collaborate with the product teams in defining and structuring the tables/data we need to ingest. Together with the team, you will define the best structure for our data warehouse. Furthermore, you will work closely together with our Data Analysts as they are highly depend on your contributions to the data models for the data available for them.In addition, you will have a crucial role in implementing new data initiatives to help us reach our ambitious goals for the future.What will do you?You will bring our data together on all levels and build the new data platform.Build an agile, resilient digital infrastructure. Together with colleagues, you will evaluate and improve -where needed- the ETL process.Make sure the ETL process is implemented and maintained.Work closely with our Data Analysts to define the best data structures for their needs and tools.Work closely with our product teams to make sure the data we need is available in the right way.Set up data structures for various applications like Power BI.Work towards new solutions to support our business in the future.Share your expertise with colleagues, helping them improve their ability to work with data.What you will bringUniversity Educated with 3-5 years of experience as a Data Engineer, Python Developer, or SQL Developer.You can create data pipelines, ingest new data sets, and orchestrate them (preferably using the following methods: Azure Data Factory, Python APIs, or third-party API tools);You have experience working with the Microsoft Azure ecosystem (Azure Data Factory, Azure Storage/Data Lake, Azure Devops, Databricks, and Power BI);You do not stop by developing a data solution but continue with setting up the monitoring, release pipeline, operation, and automation; simplifying the solution.You know how to use data in a commercial environment.You are able to share your knowledge with the teams to strengthen their skills and help them in their tasks.You have experience with building solutions using dimensional modeling;You are an experienced programmer in Python, SQL, and Spark;You have strong experience with source control and CI/CD;Tools that you can useAirflow TerraformAzure Data FactoryAzure DevOpsPythonSQLDatabricksDBTPysparkgitCI/CDWhat we offer you 🥳Independent and varied role within an entrepreneurial and innovative organizationSalary of 6.000,- - 7.100,-Good pension schemeBonus scheme (up to 1 gross monthly salary per year)25 vacation daysLaptop and iPhoneTraining opportunitiesWorking in a team of professionals, where hard work is well combined with humor ✨This is TBAuctionsNothing of value should be lostIn a world where overconsumption is a threat, TBAuctions finds it important to extend the life of products as long as possible. So, nothing of value should be lost. Our online intelligent auction platform makes this happen. By using data and a smart system we match supply and demand of used industrial products. Together with our auction brands (Troostwijk Auctions, Klaravik, Auksjonen, British Medical Auctions, PS Auction, Vavato and Epic-Auctions) we bring sustainable trade to a higher level. With buyers and sellers all over the world millions of products are auctioned every year.Auctioning is trendy and the way to buy and sell. We are fascinated by technology, with a love for user-friendliness and the drive to preserve value. Do you share this drive and do you want to work for a company that has the ambition and the firepower to become the largest online auction platform in Europe? Apply for this vacancy!

title: Data Analist Unilever
description: Ben jij gek op het analyseren van data? Voor Unilever zoeken wij een Business Analist!wat krijg je?Een eerste contract van 12 maanden met de intentie om nog veel langer samen te werken;Een salaris rond €3200 bruto o.b.v. 40 uur op basis van jouw werkervaring;Een OV vergoeding van om van jouw huis naar het kantoor in Rotterdam te reizen.Verder zorgen we ervoor dat jij je functie zo goed mogelijk uit kunt voeren. We regelen dus een tablet en telefoon voor zakelijk gebruik, 25 welverdiende vakantiedagen, 8% vakantiegeld over je salaris en goede begeleiding in je functie.Als Business Analist ben je onderdeel van de binnendienst van de Field Sales afdeling bij Unilever. De binnendienst faciliteert de ruim 60 buitendienstmedewerkers, die zorgen voor de optimale aanwezigheid en zichtbaarheid van de Unilever producten op de winkelvloer. Het verzamelen en analyseren van data staat aan de basis van de dagelijkse besluitvorming.Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen en verspreiden van inzichten uit data over onze promoties, de markt en ontwikkelingen hierin. Deze inzichten zal je presenteren aan het management en de relevante teams. Ook houd jij je bezig met data opschoning en het optimaliseren van de kwaliteit.Jij bent analytisch ten opzichte van de data, proactief in je advisering en bent flexibel in snel veranderende werkomstandigheden. Je zorgt voor een optimale structuur binnen alle datasystemen en bent in staat om aan de hand van scherpe analyses concrete acties aan te dragen.herken jij je hierin?Naast een afgeronde hbo/wo opleiding heb je ervaring in het uitvoeren van analyses. Jouw omgeving omschrijft je als dé persoon die out-of-the-box denkt wanneer problemen moeten worden opgelost. Je baseert je mening op feiten en weet dit duidelijk over te brengen op anderen. Ook heb je ervaring in het uitpluizen van grote databestanden; jij raakt jouw focus niet kwijt! Samen met het binnendienstteam werk je 2 dagen per week in Rotterdam op kantoor.Verder zijn wij in de rol van Business Analist op zoek naar iemand die:Ervaring in het werken met data via een stage of afstudeerscriptie;Je bent gestructureerd, accuraat en analytisch;Kennis en ervaring met visualisatie tools als Power BI is een pre;Kennis en ervaring met SQL en/of PySpark is een pre.do you feel the vibe?Laten we dan snel eens een kop koffie drinken! ☕ Solliciteren kan via de button. Heb je vragen? Neem dan contact op met Harriëtte via 0610137281___________________________________________________________________________________werken bij hamilton bright betekentWerken aan jezelf. Kansen grijpen. Bouwen aan je carrière. Om verder te komen dan je ooit had gedacht. Het gaat ons er niet om wat je doet, maar om hoe je het doet. Alleen met de juiste mindset kun je pas écht meters maken. Wij hebben vertrouwen in jou. Daarom krijg je bij deze baan flink wat verantwoordelijkheden en vrijheid. Uiteraard sta je er niet alleen voor: met een op maat gemaakt trainingsprogramma helpen we jou groeien! Of dat nou naar een baan bij een van onze klanten is of een volgende stap binnen hamilton bright.

title: Data Analyst Internship
description: Welcome to SkillLabAt SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has equal career opportunities. We enable and lead a radical change - a focus on skills instead of titles and degrees. Our AI-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient labor markets. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 25+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.Your opportunityYou will experience the culture of a technology start-up company with a social missionYou will work in an international team with team members from +25 countries and clients across the globeYou will work closely with the the data science team to provide data-driven insights to every part of SkillLab and its clients. Your teamYou will work closely with Rihab is one of our Data Scientists at SkillLab. Rihab is specialised in taxonomies. Her responsibilities include developing and maintaining our taxonomies' data structures, as well as training and evaluating NLP models.Aaron leads the data science team and has many years of experience in multiple industries in data science and AI. Anna is a data scientist specialised in recommendation systems.We are proud of the people we work with and excited to work in a company with a social mission. We hope you will be too!What You Will DoYou will support our monitoring and reporting processes like finalising their delivery method and expanding the indicators for monitoring and automating reporting pipelinesYou will work with our Solution Delivery team on impact trackingYou will assist our data scientists in user & project segmentation and experimentationYou will cooperate with the developers and the UX team to improve data visualisations and insights in the productRequirementsIs this you?You studied in a field with quantitative analytical skills such as data science, statistics, physics, computational social science, computer science, etcYou are comfortable using SQL to retrieve and manipulate dataYou are comfortable in Python for performing data analysisYou have knowledge of essential statistics and data visualisationsYou are eligible to work in the Netherlands. We don’t support visa applications for applicants from outside the EUYou are currently enrolled as a student in your final year or graduated within the last 12 monthsYou are able to commit to a six month internshipExtra awesomeKnowledge of statistical tests (for example, hypothesis tests, factor analysis)Experience using PowerBI and integrating with cloud data warehousesStrong knowledge of Python and visualisation tools like StreamlitComfortable using a cliCompensation, start-date & locationThis is a paid internship. If you live in Amsterdam or relocate to Amsterdam during your internship, then the monthly reimbursement is will be 1.000 EURYou can do the internship by living in another city in the Netherlands and commuting to the office 1-2 days per week. If you do the internship remotely, then the monthly reimbursement will be 700 EUR. SkillLab covers your train commuting expenses to AmsterdamWe accept applications on rolling basis and we envision a start date in January/February 2024BenefitsYou will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional developmentYou will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator)You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Yourcampus app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online storesYou will join our bi-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like Belgium, Germany etcOur selection procedureYou apply for the role and we review your profileWe will invite you for a short screening callWe will invite you for a 60min interview if we find that you are a good fit. The interview will involve a live coding testWe will offer you the internship and discuss logistics, if we think that you are the ideal candidate for the roleWhat else to know?This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the internship position and may be subject to change based on the organization's requirements and prioritiesIf this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who might be a good fit. Send them this job posting! Get 3 tips for your application: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/skilllabjobapplication SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality, and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds

title: Power BI Developer
description: Job Overview:As a Power BI Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data visualizations and reports using Power BI. Your primary focus will be on creating data-driven solutions that empower decision-makers and enhance business performance, with a particular emphasis on the semiconductor industry. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 8 years of experience in data analysis and visualization, with a strong understanding of Power BI and excellent communication skills.Key Responsibilities:Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and translate them into effective Power BI solutions.Develop and maintain interactive dashboards, reports, and data models using Power BI.Optimize and streamline data sources for efficient data retrieval and analysis.Implement data security and access control to protect sensitive information.Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decision-making.Troubleshoot and resolve any technical issues related to Power BI reports and dashboards.Keep up-to-date with the latest developments and best practices in Power BI and data visualization.Communicate effectively with clients and internal stakeholders, presenting data insights and recommendations.Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).8+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, and data visualization.Strong proficiency in Power BI, including DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and M Query.Experience working with semiconductor clients is a significant plus.Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken, for effective client interactions and team collaboration.Proven ability to work independently and as part of a team, with strong problem-solving skills.Strong analytical thinking and attention to detail.Project management skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.Powered by JazzHRcd1mowl9WY

title: Quantitative Analyst / Prism
description: About UsCryptology is a full-featured next-generation asset trading platform. With us one can easily and efficiently sell, buy, exchange and invest cryptocurrency. What is special about us? Reliability. This is the most important criterion in our every-day-changing world. You can trust us. Trust us with your assets, accounts, financial plans and your future.Job purposeMore and more people rely on Cryptology. We are growing, improving our team, and now we are looking for an experienced Quantitative Analyst.Duties and responsibilitiesData mining and analysis from different sources, development and optimization of mathematical models based on timeseries structures.Perform analytical research within the supervised project.Statistical hypotheses testing and processing ad-hoc requests.Visualization and interpretation of the research results.Assessment with internal data processing and reporting. Find anomalies and proposals for their elimination.QualificationsBSc in STEM subjects - Maths, Statistics, Physics or Computer Science preferred.Proficiency in SQL and data manipulation of large data sets is a must.Good knowledge and deep understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, probability analysis, linear algebra.Familia with base ML approaches and techniques. Experience with time series analysis, feature engineering, interpolation / extrapolation, dimension reduction etc.Knowledge of financial markets microstructure and trading environment.Programming experience in Python / R /Julia. Familia with visualization tools like Tableau, MS BI, Grafana, Plotly, Shiny etc.Terms and benefitsRemote, full time work;Competitive salary based on qualifications and experience;Truly flexible schedule;Paid holiday;Continuous professional development.We at Cryptology stand for equal opportunities, fairness and diversity. Therefore, the selection of candidates takes place regardless of race, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, religion, age, civil and marital status, and health condition. So, evaluate only your professional knowledge and experience, and apply.Powered by JazzHRcNunu43RpS

title: BI Specialist
description: Wat maakt het zo interessant om als Business Intelligence Specialist bij HSO te werken? Data & Analytics is een snelgroeiende serviceline binnen de internationale organisatie HSO; Microsoft Gold Partner en onderdeel van de Microsoft Inner Circle. Large enough to serve, small enough to care! Groei met ons mee en geef zo je eigen carrière vorm. Jij bent: Een samenwerker! Een goed resultaat bereik je niet alleen: in een hecht team werk jij samen met hoogopgeleide professionals die altijd voor elkaar klaar staan en elkaar graag intellectueel uitdagen. Werken met mensen geeft jou energie! Een verbinder! Je weet wat nodig is om de gebruikers van data optimaal te bedienen. Je inventariseert de eisen en wensen van onze klanten door de gebruikers actief te benaderen. Zo breng je businesseisen en de oplossing bij elkaar. Je bekleedt een spilfunctie en weet tegelijkertijd inhoudelijk waar je het over hebt. Een sterke gesprekspartner! Je bent communicatief vaardig op verschillende niveaus. Je hebt consultancy skills en bent sterk in het managen van de verwachtingen van eindgebruikers. Jij hebt begrip voor wat gebruikers wensen en speelt daar praktisch en pragmatisch op in. Een innovator! Jij blijft op de hoogte van de nieuwste Microsofttechnieken. In jouw vak zie je jezelf als ondernemer die graag buiten de gebruikelijke denkkaders denkt. Wat ga je doen?Je start met je klantopdracht; Je vertaalt (management) informatie en rapportagebehoefte van de afdelingen naar een te implementeren oplossing met PowerBI.Je maakt data vindbaar, begrijpelijk en toepasbaar in één loket. Je vertaalt de wensen van de business naar functionaliteit. Je toetst fits en gaps aan de integrale informatievoorziening van onze klanten.Je beoordeelt en implementeert verzoeken voor aanpassingen of verzoeken tot scopewijzigingen op de informatievoorziening.Met je collega's houd je je bezig met het visualiseren van data en je ontwikkelt managementinformatieoplossingen waarmee bedrijfsinformatie op een efficiënte en veilige manier ontsloten en gebruikt wordt.RequirementsJe hebt minimaal een HBO-diploma in de IT of Bedrijfskunde;Bewezen werkervaring als Data Analist; Dashboard Ontwikkelaar of Management Informatie DeskundigeAantoonbare kennis van SQL;Kennis van principes van de Database structuur, Data Modelling, Data Warehousing (extract, transform en loading);Ervaring met Azure Data & Analytics producten en services (SQL en NoSQL Databases en PowerBI);Bewezen analytische vaardigheden;Probleemoplossende en pragmatische houding;Ondernemend en innovatief denkvermogen;Ervaring met werken met data in een technische en commerciële omgeving;Beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal om goed te kunnen communiceren in onze internationale (klant) omgeving. BenefitsEen goede beloningWerken bij HSO is uitdagend, we willen je daar graag een goede beloning voor teruggeven. Naast goede primaire voordelen bieden:Een contract voor onbepaalde tijd;Jaarlijkse bonus op basis van bedrijfs-, team- en individuele prestaties;25 Betaalde vakantiedagen per jaar (met de mogelijkheid om tot 10 extra vakantiedagen per jaar te kopen);Mogelijkheid voor workation;Pensioen van Be Frank;Mobiliteitsvergoeding waarbij je of een auto kunt leasen of het bedrag toe kunt voegen aan je salaris. Daar bovenop krijg 100% betaald van de ov-kosten;EUR 65,- Netto vitaliteitsbudget - we vinden het belangrijk dat we gezond blijven en een veilige werkplek hebben, zowel op kantoor als remote;Telefoonabonnement & standaard telefoon of CYOD met bijbetaling of EUR 10,- netto per maand voor eigen telefoon;Je kunt deelnemen aan het leasefietsplan;En vooral een leven lang leren. Al vanaf dag één begin je aan je onboarding programma en vanaf dan heeft onze Academy een hele leerreis voor je. Je ontvangt ook een GoodHabitz accountVrijheid, flexibiliteit en funHSO heeft een ondernemerscultuur met veel ruimte voor initiatief. Zie je kansen? Wij geven je de mogelijkheid om ze te realiseren. Je hebt veel vrijheid en flexibiliteit om je werkdagen in te delen, maar vooral om je eigen carrière vorm te geven.Je werkt in een internationale omgeving en werkt met bekwame mensen met verschillende nationaliteiten die worden aangemoedigd om verder te denken. Werkweken van 40, 36 of 32 uur behoren tot de mogelijkheden omdat wij van mening zijn dat de manier van werken bij jouw levensstijl moet passen. HSO heeft professionals in dienst die plezier hebben in hun werk en klaar staan voor elkaar. We omarmen een cultuur van bedrijfsgerichte activiteiten zoals twee keer per jaar bedrijfsfeesten en wekelijkse zomerborrels op ons dakterras en er zijn allerlei sportinitiatieven.Enthousiast? Heb je vragen vooraf?Neem dan contact op met onze recruiter Joseph. Hij helpt je verder met al je vragen. Voldoe je niet aan één van de eisen. Dan gaan we nog steeds graag met je in gesprek (jyoussef@hso.com).

title: Data Quality Analyst
description: My client is looking for a Data Quality Analyst to join the growing team at a very exciting time. If you have an interest in working for an organisation that is currently building out their Enterprise Data Office, this could be an opportunity for you. My client is looking for someone that has hands on experience with implementation of Data Quality Frameworks in a Banking environment, involving yourself in: Data Quality Metrics setup Data Quality Dashboards design and creation Data Profiling and Reporting. This role is all about having great communication skills, being analytical and being pivotal for the success of the Enterprise Data Office and wider data team.If you are interested in finding out more, please apply today or get in touch with nk@orbitiongroup.com

title: Project BI Analyst
description: Gennep (Heijen) | Full-time | Day shifts | €2.500 - €3.718 What will you do as a Project BI Analyst at Arvato? Do you feel there's always room to improve? Would you love to take part in a high-tech, challenging and dynamic work environment? Are you up for a key position, with room for initiative, like-minded colleagues and interesting growing opportunities? Then we are looking for you!In this role, you are working as a Project BI Analyst within the Project Analyst team. You are responsible for implementing, optimizing and customizing our Power BI reporting and support with other data/reporting inquires. You work closely together with our national BI team, Project Analysts and operations. You will be the person in lead for the customers in our scope. You will have a leading role in transitioning from various types of reporting towards Power BI.You are someone with a strong personality, have a good customer focus and are constantly looking for opportunities and optimization. You might act on (internal) client / business requests or make your own proposal for improvements, based on your observations and analysis. You understand and identify the needs of users.You report directly to the project manager and work together with other project analysts. Together you form a small and close team that is of great importance to the customer - and the organization. Your changes can make the difference. Working with fun is very important within the team. Humor is much appreciated, as is bringing coffee for your colleagues.You have a relevant bachelor or master degree (logistics, supply chain management, business administration) and you are highly experienced in data analysis, reporting and Power BI. You are also experienced in SAP, SAP BO and if you have experience in data modelling, this would be a pre. Qualifications you bring with you as a Project BI Analyst Strong knowledge and experience with Power BI; Advanced experience with MS Office (Excel, Power Point, Visio, MS Teams) and SAP; Very strong analytical skills; Knowledge on logistics / warehousing is a strong pre; Good communications skills; Customer focused; Strong entrepreneurship competences; You master the English language. What We OfferWe offer you a challenging and independent full-time position, for 40 hours a week. We have a non-contributory pension, which means that on average you have a higher net salary compared to other companies!In Addition, We Offer A competitive salary; A bonus based on performance and organization results; Travel allowance; 8% holiday payment; 25 vacation days, possibility to build up to 28 vacation days; Up to 40% discount on your fitness subscription; Telephone and laptop; Collective health insurance; ANW Insurance and WIA Hiaat insurance, fully paid for by Arvato. About ArvatoArvato is a fast-growing organization with an informal and transparent corporate culture. We are open to ambition, personal development and initiatives. Arvato is specialized in logistics solutions. In collaboration with the customer, we determine the most effective logistics process that meets their needs. Our DNA is built upon Customer Obsession, Ownership and Continuous Improvement. We achieve our goals by means of experience, state-of-the-art technologies, creativity, passion and a commitment to quality, innovation and having fun!In the Netherlands, we serve our customer from four locations: Heijen, Venlo, Venray and Schiphol-Rijk, within these locations approximately 1.000 employees are working for Arvato. In addition to classic logistics services such as; warehousing, picking, transport management and comprehensive value-added services, we also offer tailor-made solutions for companies from sectors such as consumer products, high-tech and healthcare. For various customers we take the entire logistics process out of their hands. Are you the new Project BI Analyst we are looking for? Then apply directly via the “Apply” button and upload your CV and motivation letter. Our Recruitment department will contact you for the further process. Contact details Anne de Bie, Corporate RecruiterT: +31(6) 39625117E: anne.bie@arvato-scs.comCountry: NetherlandsCity: HeijenJob ID: 266283Date: Nov 29, 2023Location:Heijen, LI, NL, 6598MHJob Segment: Logistics, Supply Chain, Supply Chain Manager, SAP, Supply, Operations, Technology

title: Junior Data Analist
description: Verzamelen, structureren en controleren van data. Altijd met het doel: hoe kunnen we daar nog meer impact mee maken? Verder helpen van onze organisatie, door nog slimmer, beter, sneller of gewoon anders data te benutten of te combineren; Ontwikkelen van datamodellen en bijdragen aan datavisualisatie. Hoe complex ook, jij maakt het inzichtelijk; Schrijven van rapportages waarin je de bevindingen uit je onderzoek opneemt; Onderzoeken en stroomlijnen van diverse processen; Geven van advies aan senior management. Jouw werk maakt verschil en doet er echt toe. Een brutomaandsalaris van minimaal € 2.800 tot maximaal € 3.400; Een uitdagend tailor made leerpad; 1-op-1-begeleiding en career counseling door een fieldmanager; Toegang tot de Bright Academy en een online leeromgeving. 22,5 vakantiedagen op basis van 36 uur. Ten minste een hbo- of wo-opleiding, bijvoorbeeld Data Science, Quantitative Finance, Computer Science, Econometrie, Wiskunde of een vergelijkbare studie; Ervaring met data modellering, procesoptimalisatie, visualisatie tooling en het verkrijgen van praktische inzichten; Een sterk analytisch vermogen. Daarnaast ben je pragmatisch en creatief; Interesse in (complexe) datavraagstukken; Basiskennis van ten minste 1 programmeertaal, zoals Python, SQL of R.

title: Data Science Specialist
description: Our client is a top player in the Dutch finance market, providing their clients with data models and predictive analyses on investments, risk mitigation, security/fraud and environmental impact. They work with most big banks and financial institutions in the Netherlands, where they have their teams build the necessary models (usually of the complexity the clients cannot solve themselves). Sometimes the complexity is translating of business problems to the actual data solutions, sometimes the complexity is in the solution itself, the mass of the data, the regulations, etc.We are looking for Seniors and Managers, experienced Data Scientists / Consultants that can bring something extra. Of course, your bread and butter will be in the projects and working on Data Science challenges as described above, but next to this there is a variety of roles/domains where you can contribute within the organization. Think about managing a small team, taking on project management tasks, helping to scale the organization, inspire/mentor juniors, etc.The sky is the limit, and the company can create roles accustomed to the interests you have as a senior in the field!We are looking for experienced people who bring:At least 5+ years’ experience within the Data Science field.Strong Python and SQL skills as a bare minimum on the technical side.Education background in Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Astronomy,Computer Science, etc.Strong communication and commercial skills, you are client facing after all.Go getter, pragmatic, analytical and positive.So, are you pragmatic and analytically strong? Do you like client facing work, creating out of the box data models for clients? Do you like to do something extra in your work on a variety of topics (leadership, PM, growth, etc.)? Please apply!Location: Amsterdam, client side and remote (hybrid, unpredictable)Salary: up to 120kRelocation: possible

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description: We are looking for a Data Analyst with experience in Marketing roles, to join our client, a sustainable mobility startup. The role can be developed onsite at their new Amsterdam offices, or on a hybrid solution (1 day / week for meetings and team building).Their team is young and international, which is why we seek someone who is fluent in English, comfortable with tech and likes to stay up to date with the latest trends and tools.We look for someone who is passionate about sustainable mobility, has experience in a role that also mixed marketing and data analysis, and demonstrable knowledge of:MarketingSQLRArcGISQGISMicrosoft PowerBIMicrosoft Excel (power user)FigmaCanvaSlackJiraGoogle AnalyticsAccounting and / or financial knowledge (reports, performance, etc).Solid understanding of sustainable mobility concepts, technologies, innovations, research, will be highly valued.

title: Analytics Intern
description: We are looking for an Analytics Intern to join our team at VonWood and help us bring the wood industry into the 21st century.We are seeking a highly motivated and talented Analytics Intern to join our team. The intern will collaborate with various business units to understand product and business data and the underlying processes. They will be responsible for improving and updating our low-code application in Retool, building new workflows, identifying meaningful insights from large data sources, and designing, developing, testing, and implementing appropriate data-driven solutions. The ideal candidate will be proactive, open-minded, and have a strong interest in data analysis and visualisation.What wood you do?As an Analytics Intern you willCollaborate with various business units to understand product and business data and the underlying processes;Identify meaningful insights from large data sources; interpret and communicate insights and findings from analyses and experiments to product, service, and business stakeholders;Scrape, analyse and dashboard external data;Design, develop, test, and implement appropriate data-driven solutions through data analysis and visualisation.Why wood you?We are a fast-growing startup in Amsterdam. Besides being part of a young, fresh, and energetic team of over a dozen colleagues (you’ll be in good company), we can offer you the following:An international, ambitious startup culture with a sustainable touch;An inspiring environment of brilliant, fun, and creative professionals;Continuous learning and growth opportunities beyond your field of expertise;An internship compensation of €450 gross per month;Making a difference, by making the world more sustainable;Possibility to work from home;Convenient location near the business heart of Amsterdam (‘Zuid-As’) and Olympic Stadium.We are looking for ambitious individuals who thrive in fast-paced environments. We are building complex software solutions with a modern tech stack.Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business Information Management, Business Analytics and Management, Information Science, Data Science, Data Engineering, or related fields;Excellent communication skills in English (both verbal and written);Strong attention to detail and a structured way of working;Proactive, open-minded, and flexible personality;Proficient in SQL;Some programming experience in python or a similar language;Bias towards action - We learn by building things, not by talking about building things;

title: BI Analyst
description: Who We AreWe are on a mission to make mental wellbeing accessible to everyone. At OpenUp, we support companies, their employees and the families of employees with mental well-being. Via our OpenUp platform, employees and their families receive direct access to health checks, self-help programs, group sessions and webinars, mindfulness training and a large team of recognized psychologists. In our company we build high performance teams in which people develop themselves to their fullest potential. We enjoy raising the bar and making it to the next level.Open Up is part of the LinkedIn Top Startups 2022 and is rapidly growing. We are expanding our international teams and we search for like-minded talent. We are already helping over 1000+ (international) companies and their employees, e.g. Rituals, Deloitte, Decathlon, Miele, KPMG, Adyen and McDonalds. We are the Dutch market leader. But that's not enough to achieve our mission: We aim to become the number one mental health partner in the whole of Europe.Your jobAs a BI Analyst in the Business Intelligence team, you will be supporting all the different OpenUp teams (e.g. commercial, product, psychologists) with data-related topics. You will work closely with colleagues from these teams to find new data insights, define key metrics and create data structures that could provide them with even better insights. You will also create and present reporting environments and dashboards to show the results of your analyses. At the same time, you need to be able to understand the bigger picture, be creative and always think a step ahead to proactively help your stakeholders take the best data-driven decisions. In return, we will give you the flexibility and trust to choose how to best solve and implement data solutions.In summary, you will:Design metrics according to the different business needs together with your stakeholders;Maintain, build and improve SQL/DAX queries to prepare relevant and optimized datasets;Build dashboards and reports around business priorities and strategy;Manage the relationship with key stakeholders in order to gather and guide reporting and data needs;Collaborate with colleagues from cross-functional teams with different expertises. Such as: commercial, product, tech, psychologists, HR and finance;Proactively translate the insights from your analyses and reports to actionable points that help stakeholders make the correct decision to improve their business;Be responsible for the long-term quality and maintenance of the data solutions implemented. About you:Bachelor or master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or any related field of study. 3-5 years of relevant work experience. Curiosity and motivation for solving data challenges, understanding business stakeholder and customer needs, and exploring the complexity of data. Excellent communication skills. You can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiencesExcellent written and spoken EnglishExcellent stakeholder and relationship management skills. The ability to propose and build new data solutions, and at the same time guarantee the quality and stability of existing solutionsProficiency in SQL/DAX and working with relational databasesExperience with data visualization tools (e.g. Metabase, PowerBI, Tableau, etc.)Plus: Programming experience (Python/Spark/Scala/R)What We OfferOpenUp is fast growing and you have the chance to become part of this challenging journey. Your high impact role in this early-stage scale-up offers a lot of great opportunities and chances to grow with us.You are working in a diverse and international environment from our offices in the heart of Amsterdam. you work in our international commercial team but also closely with our Psychologists, Tech and HR teams. We regularly have (virtual) team events which make our work dynamic and challenging! We like to have fun together with a lot of team building activities like our weekly 'borrels', after work sport classes, the yearly ski-trip and our Paddle tournament. Which makes our work fun, challenging and dynamic. Next to that:Opportunities for personal and professional development. Competitive salary and compensation package. Flexibility to work from the office or your home office. We provide you with the hardware you need to work comfortably. Daily healthy and vegetarian lunch. Free and unlimited access to our mindfulness courses and psychologists. Next stepsExcited about this role at OpenUp? We love to learn more about you. Send us your application through our website and we will be in touch with you soon.At OpenUp, everyone is welcome to apply - regardless of color, age, gender, nationality or any other label. We embrace what makes you unique and we believe that a diverse team is crucial to success. If you are ready to OpenUp, join us!Our OpenUp and iPractice ventures help people become and stay mentally and physically healthy. We continuously develop our practice and online platform for mental well-being. Users can start directly with various online programs and connect face to face with a psychologist. All programs are evidence-based, result-oriented and short and sweet. Sustainable results come from daily practice and users are supported by an accessible system and network of psychologists. We offer our services all over Europe, in various languages. We help hundreds of people every day and the number of users is growing fast.

title: BI Consultant
description: Kan jij van ruwe data chocolade maken en ben je op de hoogte van de nieuwste BI-ontwikkelingen? Dan heeft Conspect de perfecte uitdaging voor jou!Je bent niet bang om je mening te geven, boekt graag resultaten en wilt de beste zijn in jouw vakgebied. Binnen Conspect staan wij achter jouw ambities en samen zorgen wij dat jij die waar kan maken. Dit betekent dat jij jezelf blijft uitdagen. Bijvoorbeeld door het neerzetten van een BI-strategie, het opbouwen van een effectieve informatievoorziening of een opdrachtgever ondersteunen om een nog betere data-gedreven organisatie te worden. .Je weet als geen ander de opdrachtgever mee te nemen in de toegevoegde waarde van data door het opzetten van een Datawarehouse, het optimaliseren van een ETL-proces of het bouwen van dashboards waardoor de data nóg inzichtelijker wordt. Jouw kennis wordt dus binnen opdrachten in de breedste zin ingezet!Wat krijg jij?√ Geld√ Vast contract√ Fijne werksfeer√ Uitdagende projecten√ Leaseauto of mobiliteitsregeling naar keuze√ Device-budget (laptop / telefoon)√ Thuiswerkbudget√ Trainingen en kennissessiesWat vragen wij? √ HBO diploma √ Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring in Business Intelligence √ Bekend met Data Vault en/of Kimball √ Kennis van Microsoft technologie als SQL server, Azure Data Platform, Power BI √ Sterke analytische vaardigheden √ Goede communicatie skillsOver Conspect: Wij verbinden de wereld om ons heen met elkaar, door middel van onze kennis en onze kernwaarden; namelijk Plezier, Passie en Partnership. Een optimale samenwerking in een uitdagende, moderne en vooral plezierige omgeving zal leiden tot fantastische prestaties. Daarnaast sta je er bij ons nooit alleen voor. Er zijn altijd collega’s bereid om hun kennis en ervaring met je te delen. Heb je het gevoel dat je nog meer kan en wil leren? Ook hier is ruimte voor. Bij Conspect staan onze medewerkers op nummer één. Ook werken wij met z’n allen hard en willen we uitstekende kwaliteit leveren. Maar wij vinden het net zo belangrijk dat jij plezier hebt in zowel je werk als daarbuiten. Daarom organiseren we vrijmibo’s en regelmatige bedrijfsuitjes. Denk hierbij aan een duiktrip naar Malta of skiën in Oostenrijk. Ook bieden wij een mooi salarispakket met goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden. Wil je nog meer weten over de Conspect cultuur en identiteit? Collega’s vertellen graag over hun persoonlijke ervaringen bij Conspect. Of lees meer over de unieke cultuur bij het leukste ICT bedrijf van Nederland.

title: Research Data Analyst
description: A fantastic opportunity has arisen with a Asset Management organisation within their R&D department.The role of analysts in this department is to learn and apply the company principles to investments and support the asset class specialists for the operation of the models.As an Analyst you will gain multiple opportunities to learn in depth end-to-end investment processes for multiple asset classes and grow into becoming a specialist over time.As a Research Data Analyst, Amsterdam, You WillPerform key tasks related to data management and analysis of financial indicators and operating the models for the assigned class.Carry out research run models for portfolios and securities trading and compute performance.Provide the data in clear format to be utilised by the business.The Successful Data Analyst Will HaveDegree in Business, Finance, Engineering, Economics of Mathematics (Master's are advantageous)Prior professional work experienceExperience with Python/ SQL/ Matlab/ R or other math based programming languagesWillingness to be on-site 5 days per week.As The Data Analyst, You Will ReceiveCompetitive Base salary up to €60,000BenefitsBonusMorgan McKinley is acting as an Employment Agency and references to pay rates are indicative.BY APPLYING FOR THIS ROLE YOU ARE AGREEING TO OUR TERMS OF SERVICE WHICH TOGETHER WITH OUR PRIVACY STATEMENT GOVERN YOUR USE OF MORGAN MCKINLEY SERVICES.

title: Data Visualization Specialist
description: Als Data Visualization Specialist ben je verantwoordelijk voor de kwaliteit van alle bruikbare visuele inzichten binnen jouw domein(en). Je adviseert en traint anderen in het optimaal gebruiken van onze data visualisatie tooling, zodat de visualisatie van onze data leidt tot nieuwe inzichten en acties die Coolblue elke dag een beetje beter maken.Wat doe je als Data Visualization Specialist bij Coolblue?Wil jij jouw team helpen met datagedreven besluiten nemen en is het maken van dashboards helemaal jouw ding? Lees dan gauw verder!Dit vind je leuk om te doen Jij bent dé data visualisatie expert. Jij begrijpt hoe data jouw stakeholders het beste kan helpen om meteen te zien wat hun resultaten zijn en wat zij moeten gaan doen vandaag.Je legt resultaten van je collega’s vast met goede visualisaties en bruikbare inzichten. Denk aan de efficiëntie van onze fietsbezorgers, procesverbeteringen, klanttevredenheid en nog veel meer!Trainen van en advies geven aan analisten en dashboard specialisten die zelf met de visualisatie van de data uit jouw domeinen aan de slag gaan.Je houdt ervan pragmatisch te zijn voor dashboards die snel opgeleverd moeten worden. Tegelijkertijd ben je nauwkeurig in het volgen van richtlijnen als het gaat om structurele rapportages.Mensen in beweging krijgen door projecten te initiëren om het niveau van data visualisatie binnen je domein te verhogen. Je vindt het leuk om veel verschillende mensen te ontmoeten en ze te helpen. Zo ken jij snel al jouw stakeholders, op de werkvloer en bij de kantoorborrels.Hier herken jij jezelf inJe bent behulpzaam, servicegericht en goed in complexe onderwerpen in begrijpelijke taal uitleggenBij het zien van een cirkeldiagram bedenk je meteen hoe dat visueel beter kanJe vindt het gaaf om te zien hoe data elke dag nieuwe inzichten kan opleverenJij werkt na elke pubquiz je eigen statistics uit om te zien of je elke keer een beetje beter wordtKennis van één of meerdere visualisatie tools zoals Tableau, Looker, Data Studio, Qlikview of Excel.Minimaal hbo-werk- en -denkniveau.Dit zoek jij verder in een baanGeld.Hybride werken. We werken zowel vanuit huis als op kantoor.Ongekend goede werksfeer. Met collega's waar je blij van wordt, epische feesten, pubquizzen en andere teamactiviteiten.Reiskostenvergoeding, pensioenregeling en een vergoeding voor als je thuiswerkt.Met meer dan 30 trainingen in onze eigen Studiefabriek word je elke dag een beetje beter.Een kantoor op een toplocatie. Vanaf Rotterdam Centraal is het 3 keer vallen voor je er bent. Oké, het is 2 minuten lopen.Met nieuwe initiatieven en ideeën maak je ons blij. Of je nu een week, maand of een jaar bij ons werkt.Uitdagend werk om helemaal in op te gaan. Je vergeet af en toe dat je aan het werk bent.Korting op alle spullen die we verkopen.

title: Data Scientist
description: Deadline Date: Monday 5 December 2023Time On-Site: 100%Required Start Date: 3 January 2024End Contract Date: 31 December 2024Required Security Clearance: NATO SECRETDuties and Role:Under the direction of the Section Head, the incumbent will perform duties such as:Applies existing data science techniques to new problems and datasets using specialised programming techniques to meet needs of the Agency and its customers;Selects from existing data sources and prepares data to be used by data science models;Evaluates the outcomes and performance of data science models. Identifies and implements opportunities to train and improve models and the data they use;Publishes and reports on machine learning model outputs to meet customer needs and conforming to agreed standards;Supports review of data science and AI activities, processes, products or services;Support development and maintenance of data pipelines for structured and unstructured data;Support maintenance of the Agency's data lakes, implementing updates and working with system owners to ensure data is available for analysis;Contribute to machine learning initiative across the Business Area with suggestions for ML approaches and implementation, including the processing of training data and performance assessment of machine learning techniques on datasets;Contribute to new/modifications to data science toolsets and metrics;Remain up-to-date with new developments in data science and AI to bring innovative ideas into implementation;Deputize for higher grade staff, if required;Perform other duties as may be required.Travel: Business travel to NATO and national facilities as well as frequent travel between the NCIA offices;Professional Contacts:The incumbent is responsible for:Active engagement with colleagues across the Agency;Supporting engagement with stakeholders, including industry and academia.RequirementsSkill, Knowledge & Experience:The candidate must have a currently active NATO SECRET security clearanceA minimum requirement of a Bachelor's degree at a nationally recognised/certified University in a relevant discipline (such as Data Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science or Engineering) with 3 years of post-related experience;Experience with state-of-the-art data science, analytics and data integration tools;Use of data science tools to support data analytics and data visualisation;Experience involving supporting data focused operations in a technical organisation. Such experience should encompass at least 2 skills listed: Experience of working within a Big Data ecosystem, with tools such as DataBricks, Spark etc; Planning, executing and maintaining data pipelines; Knowledge of Machine Learning, statistical and mathematical models and ability to effectively explain them to both technical and non-technical colleagues;Proven ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing.Desirable Experience and Education:A Master's degree or higher at a nationally recognised/certified University in a relevant discipline (Data Science, AI engineering);Experience in data presentation tools e.g. Microsoft Power BI, Spotfire, Tableau; Kibana; Dash; Streamlit;Knowledge of DevOps best practices (git, Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery pipelines etc)Experience with Cloud ComputingLanguage Proficiency:A thorough knowledge of one of the two NATO languages, both written and spoken, is essential and some knowledge of the other is desirable.

title: Internship Data Analyst
company: Stoov® | We warm people, not the planet.
description: What We’re All AboutAt Stoov we want to warm people, not the planet. That’s why we flipped heat on its head and made it personal. Like, really cosy and snuggly and warm and wonderful. Now people can turn down the thermostat and take warmth with them wherever they go. That is our heritage, and we are very curious to see where we go from here, together.What You’ll Be DoingYou will join the Data & Tech department as an intern, where you get the opportunity to take a look behind the scenes of a fast-growing scale-up. You will learn from your colleagues and perform analysis on a broad range of topics. The Data & Tech team supports all teams within Stoov and therefore works with all kinds of different data, e.g. sales and marketing, but also reshipments and customer service. You’ll help to build dashboards, but also perform ad-hoc analysis based on the business needs at the moment.You enjoy a role as data analyst intern, in which you;Perform data analysis on a broad range of topicsVisualize the data to translate it into useful and actionable insightsLearn to recognize chances: where can data be used to help the organization further? How can we start this?Check the quality of our data and make it transparent for your colleaguesWE’D LOVE IT IF YOU’DBe as dedicated to the planet as we are;Are in your 3rd or 4th study year of Commercial Economics, Business Administration or other business-related courses studies;Are eager to learn, proactive, analytical and add a daily dose of fun to your work;Like to work in a team, but can also act independently if needed;Enjoy the agility of a scale up. Can deal with change: no day is the same at Stoov®;Enjoy learning different aspects of Data & Tech.THE PERKS OF AN INTERNSHIP AT STOOV Working together with a team of ambitious and fun colleaguesA lively, informal and warm working environment;Delicious coffee, healthy lunches and plenty of after work drinks and activities;Many learning and growth opportunities;Contributing to building a fast-growing international brand;An internship allowance of EUR500 per month.WELLBEING & SUSTAINABILITYWarming people not the planet, is something we take very seriously at Stoov. We do everything with sustainability in mind and are hard on our way to becoming B corp. When we’re not thinking about mother earth, we’re thinking about you. It’s really important to us that you feel safe, welcome and appreciated. We’re a brand built on positive energy.WE WANT TO BE THE PLACE TO DEIBWe welcome everyone with wide open arms. We create an environment where everyone feels safe and welcome. And free to share the best version of themselves. No matter how they identify, who they love or what culture they feel at home in. For us, different people bring different experiences, perspectives and backgrounds. And we need all of those to grow as a company, and as individuals.GET IN TOUCH!If you are what we’re looking for and like the prospects of working in a fun, free spirited company that puts people first and takes great care of them, then maybe, just maybe, this is your sign to give us a call.

title: Full Stack developer Data Visualization – Eindhoven
description: FunctieomschrijvingWe receive allot of data from our software, this software needs to be visualized. We do this to provide our client with more detailed information regarding their data. you will work on translating data into engaging graphical user interfaces.Front end developmentUser experienceWeb DevelopmentContinuously improve our product’s front-end code structure and architectureFunctie-eisenBSc. Or MSc. In Computer Science, Informatics, or in a technical fieldExperience with HTML5 / CSS3 / JavascriptExperience with Angular 2+ and ReactExperience with Git and Unit TestingTypescript and Selenium is a préUnit Testing and automation systems is a préPro-active and willing to take initiativeStrong communicatorReal team playerGood knowledge of EnglishArbeidsvoorwaardenWithin our company you have many possibilities to develop yourself professionally and personally;We train and educate our employee’s with the latest techniques, next to this our employee’s are always willing to help;A competitive salary;Nice extra's such as discount on your health insurance

title: Business Intelligence Specialist
description: About the companyOur client is a company, where innovation meets data science consultancy! Where the forward-thinking data specialists infuse a human touch into the realm of data-driven environments. The team serves as catalysts for inspiration and focus in Big Data projects, swiftly delivering structured and valuable insights. These insights are instrumental in facilitating decision-making that propels businesses forward.What Are You Bringing?We are seeking a talented Business IntelligenceSpecialist for our client in 's-Hertogenbosch to play a pivotal role in shaping strategic decisions through advanced data analysis and insights and also contribute to developing and implementing customized BI solutions, aiming to optimize information flows and create added value for the team, the customer, and society.What will you do?Collect, analyze, and visualize data to generate actionable insights for informed decision-making.Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business challenges and implement data-driven solutions.Design and implement data analysis processes, encompassing data modeling, ETL processes, and data visualizations.Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities within the data and effectively communicate findings to stakeholders.Work collaboratively in multidisciplinary teams to develop and implement comprehensive data strategies.Competences:Strong technical skills, with expertise in data modeling, SQL, ETL processes, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).Experience with statistical analysis and data warehousing is a plus.Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.Fluent in Dutch (written and spoken).What's in it for you?Expenses reimbursement, travel allowance or a lease car, plus pension.;Possibility to work partly from home (40%);Full-time employment (40 hours per week);Personal development program with training budget.If you would like to discuss this role further, please send an email to:✉ anhelina.zaliska@eclectic.eu📱 +31 6 12 89 5781

title: BI Developer
description: Are you an experienced Google Cloud Developer who can connect the dots between organizing and analyzing first-party data and the communication channels that companies are using? Then we would love to meet you!Your roleActively participate in communications with the client and the teams with the frequency agreed on the projectPerform business analysis for the full cycle of work with requirements based on knowledge areas and project methodologyBreak down key business data by gathering, cleaning, and analyzing business dataGenerate business insights and share insights by visualizing them using different BI toolsIdentify opportunities for data-driven business decisions, improvement and spot trends using gathered business data.Recognise potential issues and offer solutionsYour profileRequired;English speaking & writing, speaking Dutch is a plusA minimum of 3 year of experience in business analysis or a related fieldExcellent listening, communication, interpersonal and presentation skillsStrong documentation skillsWorking knowledge of SCRUM methodologyWorking experience of data base and data warehouse managementUnderstanding of Big DataWorking knowledge of ETL processesSQL knowledgeExperience creating detailed reports and giving presentationsWorking knowledge of Data Visualization tools (Data studio, Looker, Power BI, Tableau)Ability to contibute both independently and as part of a teamBonus;Knowledge and experience with Google Cloud PlatformWorking knowledge of Python, Java or R languagesWorking knowledge of Big DataAbility to read code and support applications, reports and processesWorking knowledge of different project methodologiesWorking expierence of participation in discovery phasesUnderstanding of BI consultingMaster degreeWhat we offerCompetitive salary with an interesting bonus and pension schemeExcellent work/life balance and up to 28 days of annual leave Freedom to work from one of our offices in Rotterdam, Amsterdam or other "Spaces" locations across the Netherlands and join Spaces' events and workshops.Flexibility to work from home or abroadA laptop and first-class travel arrangement by public transportAn opportunity to develop yourself through different (technical) coursesAn international environment with a start-up vibe - no need for a suit at the office!About CrystalloidsCrystalloids was founded in 2006 and as a team of qualified data specialists we help organisations innovate and grow their business by building solutions in Google Cloud. We have been an official Google Cloud partner since 2011. At Crystalloids, the foundation for a successful solution is based on three dimensions: the people, the processes and the technology. We always take these three dimensions into account when we build solutions for our customers.We gained a very respectable client portfolio over the years. Our clients operate in market segments like retail, e-commerce, CPC, media, telecom, finance and insurance and are based in the Netherlands and in other European countries: Rituals, PVH, Swiss Sense, KNVB, Body & Fit, CoolBlue, FD Mediagroep, de Bijenkorf, HEMA, ACSI and others.What's next?Are you interested in the above vacancy for BI Developer? Crystalloids is looking forward to receive your application! By clicking on the 'apply' button in this job listing, you'll be directed to the original posting where you can take a few effortless steps to submit your application for BI Developer.

title: Junior Data Consultant
description: Als Junior Data Consultant krijg je bij ons de kans om in een tot twee jaar tijd te ontdekken waar je kennis, kunde en interesse ligt qua data-innovaties en toepassingen in de zorg. Zo bieden wij je uiteenlopende projecten en ga je ontdekken of je wilt specialiseren in de techniek, de zorgprocessen of juist aan de stakeholderskant.Ga je bijvoorbeeld de wensen van stakeholders op het gebied van informatieproducten omzetten naar technische requirements? Of vind je het interessant om data uitgiftes te doen en datasets te maken voor wetenschappelijk onderzoek? Of word je juist enthousiast van het maken van informatieproducten zoals PowerBI dashboards?Hoe ziet dit er concreet uitAls onderdeel van een scrum team werk je samen met BI specialisten en data developers aan een nieuw datawarehouse waar alle bronsystemen in het ziekenhuis worden geïncludeerd zodat data op een juiste en veilige manier benaderbaar is voor de eindgebruikers. Je rol in dit projectteam is het analyseren hoe data vanuit de bronsystemen – denk aan het elektronisch patiëntendossier of IC-monitoring - in het huidige datawarehouse terechtkomen. Het resultaat van deze analyse is een datamodel waarmee bijvoorbeeld gegevens kunnen worden uitgewisseld met een ander ziekenhuis. Daarnaast zijn er ook andere projecten:Zo assisteer je onderzoekers door gestructureerde data uit ongestructureerde vrije tekst te halen;Help je onze klanten - meestal ziekenhuizen - met waardevolle, data gedreven toepassingen;Ben je betrokken bij het omzetten van medische gegevens uit verschillende bronnen tot bruikbare en uitwisselbare datasets (ofwel klinische bouwstenen);Functioneer je als de brug tussen de business en de ICT om klinische bouwstenen te modelleren.Als startende Junior Data Consultant bouw je aan je kennis en netwerk. Zo hebben we daar ook een Young Professional Programma voor opgericht. Gedurende het gehele traject word je begeleid door een buddy. Furore Conclusion is specialist in de inrichting en het beheer van elektronische patiëntendossiers (EPD) en je werkt regelmatig samen met collega’s uit dit team.Bekijk onze website voor meer informatie en voorbeelden van onze dataprojecten. Bekijk dit filmpje om te horen wat onze collega doet.Over Furore ConclusionFurore Conclusion is een specialist. Met opdrachtgevers in de zorg en de wetenschap zijn we onderscheidend in informatietechnologie en marktkennis. Als partner in informatisering zijn we betrokken bij de totale cyclus van informatiesystemen. Van de definitie tot de implementatie, en van support tot vervanging. Ons team bestaat uit 91 medewerkers die staan voor vakmanschap en plezier, met een focus op innovatieve oplossingen. Professionaliteit staat bij ons voorop, daarom blijven we onszelf ontwikkelen. Met flexibele werktijden zorgen we voor een goede werk-privébalans.We zijn onderdeel van Conclusion, en pakken het allemaal nét even anders aan. Conclusion is een organisatie met meer dan 25 verschillende bedrijven in één ecosysteem. Met ruim 2.000 collega’s verbeteren we met technologische oplossingen, kritische bedrijfsprocessen van onze klanten. We werken samen als het kan en hebben op het juiste moment, de juiste mensen aan tafel. Experts in hun vakgebied, die elkaar aanvullen, scherp houden en uitdagingen vanuit verschillende perspectieven bekijken. Daar zit onze kracht. Lef en ondernemerschap helpen ons hierin. Met af en toe het nodige vuurwerk onderling, bereiken we het beste resultaat. Dat is onze aanpak.Jou missen we nogJij bent te herkennen aan je affiniteit met data en de zorg. Je bent op zoek naar een eerste uitdagende baan op het gebied van data in de zorg, bent leergierig en gaat een technische uitdaging niet uit de weg.Jij hebt:affiniteit met data;uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal;het liefst inhoudelijke kennis van de zorg- of wetenschapssector;voor deze functie vragen wij een hbo- en/of wo-diploma.Een bonus voor ons als jij ook:kennis hebt van zorgprocessen;kennis hebt van datamodelleren;ervaring hebt als data analist.Waardering voor je werkIn deze rol krijg je een contract voor 32-40 uur per week. Omdat wij erop vertrouwen dat jij uitblinkt als Junior Data Consultant bieden we jou:een uitstekend salaris dat past bij je kennis en ervaringsdeskundige (€ 2750 - € 3000);veel mogelijkheden om kennis uit te bouwen via cursussen, trainingen en opleidingen;flexibele werktijden en thuiswerkmogelijkheden;mogelijkheden om te sporten samen met collega’s;een baan bij een informeel bedrijf;we stimuleren nieuwsgierigheid en moedigen initiatief aan;uitdagende en innovatieve projecten in de zorg met nieuwe technologieën, zoals HL7 FHIR, PowerBI en virtual datawarehousing;samenwerken met de ICT afdeling en de eindgebruikers in de ziekenhuizen;intensieve begeleiding door een mentor/teamleider;bijzondere prestaties worden extra beloond.Benieuwd naar andere projecten die nu lopen? Onze Recruiter Tom Rooseboom, kan je er alles over vertellen. Je bereikt Tom door een mail te sturen naar: t.rooseboom@furore.comLiever inhoudelijk sparren met onze afdelingsmanager Data Dienstverlening? Ik breng je graag in contact met Bas Wencker!

title: Data Analyst
description: We're Creative Fabrica, a fast scaling tech start-up from Amsterdam.Our missionEnable creativity by giving access to everything related to the creative process: inspiration, learning, creating and sharing. The 'Creative Inspiration Flywheel'This creates a self-sustaining community that lives within the Creative Fabrica ecosystem.About The PlatformWe launched in 2016 as a marketplace for fonts with a subscription service. In the last 7 years we have been through tremendous growth, and we're just getting started!We have scaled to 40 million+ monthly page views, viewing over 10 million+ listed products from 14000+ active designers.Our focus is to create a platform for designers that enables them to offer exceptional high-quality content. We make their products searchable in unique ways. This allows our customers to speed up their workflow, allowing them to focus on what they love most: Creating.We are growing. Fast. You will help us grow even faster.Creative Fabrica is on the lookout for a dynamic, inquisitive, and driven Data Analyst who is eager to dive into the depths of data, uncover hidden insights, and contribute to our ambitious growth plans. If you are passionate about turning data into compelling stories and making a tangible impact on business decisions, this is your opportunity to join an international team and shape the future of data analytics at Creative Fabrica.In this role, you will be a key player in deciphering complex data, acting as a 'data detective' to uncover critical insights from vast data sets. You will be instrumental in enhancing our understanding of customers, improving our predictive capabilities, and driving growth.What you will do:Collect, manage, and maintain data sources, including internal databases and external datasets, to ensure data accuracy and currency. Perform complex data analyses using statistical methods, machine learning algorithms, and data visualization tools to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Identify business challenges and develop analytical solutions to address these challenges and support decision-making. Clearly and concisely communicate the results of analyses to stakeholders through reports, dashboards, and presentations. Translate data findings into actionable recommendations for improving processes, products, or strategies. Collaborate with teams within the organization, including IT, marketing, and operational departments, to understand data analysis needs and provide appropriate solutions. Stay up-to-date with new technologies and methodologies in the field of data analysis and apply them to enhance analysis processes. What you will bring:Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field, such as statistics, computer science, mathematics, or a related field. Strong programming skills in SQLExperience with data visualization and data analysis toolsKnowledge of statistical and machine learning techniques. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. Nice to have:Experience in complex modelling e.g. Fraud detection or time-series predictionStrong programming skills, preferably in languages like Python, R and/or other relevant tools. Experience and/or understanding in dbt (Data Build Tool)Let us take care of you.We embrace state-of-the-art technologies. We firmly believe in the potential of AI as the future of work. You will see us using ChatGPT in our daily work and your Pro subscription is on us. Competitive Compensation: We believe that hard work, skills and ambition should be fairly compensated. Flexibility: 30 remote days per year. The best tools and stylish kit: Laptop. Check. Collaboration tools. Check. Killer accessories. Check. Awesome Office: Based in a beautiful office in the centre, working here means delicious lunches in the garden, and access to our own CF library. TGIF: Work Life balance is important - we work hard together, and we have fun together. On Fridays we gather at the bar across the street and start celebrating the weekend. Is this you?Get in touch! We'd love to speak to you.You can apply by clicking the "Apply now" button.Creative Fabrica is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.Interested in roles similar to this? Subscribe to our newsletter and get notified about new relevant openings!

title: Data Scientist
description: Data ScientistLocation: UtrechtHybrid modelDuration: 1+ year rolling contractPreventing Money Laundering & Terrorist Financing is crucial in our society, and as a leading organisation in the banking industry, we play a vital role. We seek a talented individual like yourself who thrives on analysing data, identifying patterns, and uncovering illegal activities to join our team.As a Data Scientist, you will optimise our current Transaction Monitoring (TM) system and ensure its future-proof by incorporating advanced analytics methodologies like Machine Learning.Position Overview:Our TM system evaluates millions of transactions daily and needs to perform within specified computing time and resource constraints. It is an ongoing development, with new computationally intensive functionality being added. Your role will be to optimise the performance of model components. However, this task is more than just technical; you will also need to thoroughly understand the functionality of the model and its elements within the context of transaction monitoring.Requirements:Academic degree (MSc/PhD) in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field (required)Strong software development skills, including Git, bash scripting, release management, and proven success in bringing analytics models to production (required)Minimum of 5 years of experience in advanced analytics, modelling, or artificial intelligence activities with large data sets (required)Highly skilled in Python, PySpark, and Spark (required), with experience in Azure Databricks (preferred)Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English (required)Ideal Candidate:Motivated by the opportunity to make a measurable impact, such as catching criminals, rather than solely focusing on building complex analytics modelsStructured, precise, and communicative, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse individuals and rolesThrives in a high-impact, dynamic, and fast-paced environmentProactive, results-oriented, and has a business-focused mindset to fight financial crime effectivelyResponsibilities:The successful candidate will be responsible for delivering the following results:Enhancing functionality within our data model (TDM) while efficiently integrating all required data sources (30+) for Transaction Monitoring. These sources include transaction data, logging data from sources like CNA, AZS, PEX, RASS, as well as enrichment data from sources like Siebel, Omnikassa, Geldmaat, VCM.Ensuring the TDM design enables Rabobank to comply with regulatory, audit, and internal requirements, including building versions on both account and customer levels.Establishing the TDM as a solid building block that can function independently and be leveraged by other KYC/TM projects.Optimising the computational performance of the TDM for daily batch scoring and one-off runs on multiple years of data using (Py)Spark.Assignment Description:The assignment aims to add functionality to our data model (TDM) to meet regulatory deadlines related to Transaction Monitoring model changes, lookbacks, and tuning & back testing.The added functionality should be computationally optimised.
